for false witnesses rise up against me,
breathing out violence.

contents.verseText: Still I am certain to see the goodness of the LORD in the land of the living.
contents: Still I am certain to see
the goodness of the LORD
in the land of the living.

contents.verseText: Wait patiently for the LORD; be strong and courageous. Wait patiently for the LORD!
contents: Wait patiently for the LORD;
be strong and courageous.
Wait patiently for the LORD!

d: Of David.

contents.verseText: To You, O LORD, I call; be not deaf to me, O my Rock. For if You remain silent, I will be like those descending to the Pit.
contents: To You, O LORD, I call;
be not deaf to me, O my Rock.
For if You remain silent,
I will be like those descending to the Pit.

contents.verseText: Hear my cry for mercy when I call to You for help, when I lift up my hands toward Your holy sanctuary.
contents: Hear my cry for mercy
when I call to You for help,
when I lift up my hands
toward Your holy sanctuary.

footnote.ft: Or Your innermost sanctuary or Your Most Holy Place

contents.verseText: Do not drag me away with the wicked, and with the workers of iniquity, who speak peace to their neighbors while malice is in their hearts.
contents: Do not drag me away with the wicked,
and with the workers of iniquity,
who speak peace to their neighbors
while malice is in their hearts.

contents.verseText: Repay them according to their deeds and for their works of evil. Repay them for what their hands have done; bring back on them what they deserve.
contents: Repay them according to their deeds
and for their works of evil.
Repay them for what their hands have done;
bring back on them what they deserve.

contents.verseText: Since they show no regard for the works of the LORD or what His hands have done, He will tear them down and never rebuild them.
contents: Since they show no regard for the works of the LORD
or what His hands have done,
He will tear them down
and never rebuild them.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD, for He has heard my cry for mercy.
contents: Blessed be the LORD,
for He has heard my cry for mercy.

contents.verseText: The LORD is my strength and my shield; my heart trusts in Him, and I am helped. Therefore my heart rejoices, and I give thanks to Him with my song.
contents: The LORD is my strength and my shield;
my heart trusts in Him, and I am helped.
Therefore my heart rejoices,
and I give thanks to Him with my song.

contents.verseText: The LORD is the strength of His people, a stronghold of salvation for His anointed.
contents: The LORD is the strength of His people,
a stronghold of salvation for His anointed.

contents.verseText: Save Your people and bless Your inheritance; shepherd them and carry them forever.
contents: Save Your people and bless Your inheritance;
shepherd them and carry them forever.

d: A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: Ascribe to the LORD, O heavenly beings, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
contents: Ascribe to the LORD, O heavenly beings,

footnote.ft: Or sons of God or sons of might

contents: ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

contents.verseText: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name; worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness.
contents: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name;
worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness.

footnote.ft: Or in holy attire

contents.verseText: The voice of the LORD is over the waters; the God of glory thunders; the LORD is heard over many waters.
contents: The voice of the LORD is over the waters;
the God of glory thunders;
the LORD is heard over many waters.

contents.verseText: The voice of the LORD is powerful; the voice of the LORD is majestic.
contents: The voice of the LORD is powerful;
the voice of the LORD is majestic.

contents.verseText: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedars; the LORD shatters the cedars of Lebanon.
contents: The voice of the LORD breaks the cedars;
the LORD shatters the cedars of Lebanon.

contents.verseText: He makes Lebanon skip like a calf, and Sirion like a young wild ox.
contents: He makes Lebanon skip like a calf,
and Sirion

footnote.ft: That is, Mount Hermon

contents: like a young wild ox.

contents.verseText: The voice of the LORD strikes with flames of fire.
contents: The voice of the LORD
strikes with flames of fire.

contents.verseText: The voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness; the LORD shakes the Wilderness of Kadesh.
contents: The voice of the LORD shakes the wilderness;
the LORD shakes the Wilderness of Kadesh.

contents.verseText: The voice of the LORD twists the oaks and strips the forests bare. And in His temple all cry, “Glory!”
contents: The voice of the LORD twists the oaks

footnote.ft: Or LORD makes the deer to calve

contents: and strips the forests bare.
And in His temple all cry, “Glory!”

contents.verseText: The LORD sits enthroned over the flood; the LORD is enthroned as King forever.
contents: The LORD sits enthroned over the flood;
the LORD is enthroned as King forever.

contents.verseText: The LORD gives His people strength; the LORD blesses His people with peace.
contents: The LORD gives His people strength;
the LORD blesses His people with peace.

s1: You Turned My Mourning into Dancing

d: A Psalm. A song for the dedication of the temple. Of David.

contents.verseText: I will exalt You, O LORD, for You have lifted me up and have not allowed my foes to rejoice over me.
contents: I will exalt You, O LORD,
for You have lifted me up
and have not allowed my foes
to rejoice over me.

contents.verseText: O LORD my God, I cried to You for help, and You healed me.
contents: O LORD my God, I cried to You for help,
and You healed me.

contents.verseText: O LORD, You pulled me up from Sheol; You spared me from descending into the Pit.
contents: O LORD, You pulled me up from Sheol;
You spared me from descending into the Pit.

contents.verseText: Sing to the LORD, O you His saints, and praise His holy name.
contents: Sing to the LORD, O you His saints,
and praise His holy name.

footnote.ft: Or and praise the memorial of His holiness; see Exodus 3:15.

contents.verseText: For His anger is fleeting, but His favor lasts a lifetime. Weeping may stay the night, but joy comes in the morning.
contents: For His anger is fleeting,
but His favor lasts a lifetime.
Weeping may stay the night,
but joy comes in the morning.

contents.verseText: In prosperity I said, “I will never be shaken.”
contents: In prosperity I said,
“I will never be shaken.”

contents.verseText: O LORD, You favored me; You made my mountain stand strong. When You hid Your face, I was dismayed.
contents: O LORD, You favored me;
You made my mountain stand strong.
When You hid Your face,
I was dismayed.

contents.verseText: To You, O LORD, I called, and I begged my Lord for mercy:
contents: To You, O LORD, I called,
and I begged my Lord for mercy:

contents.verseText: “What gain is there in my bloodshed, in my descent to the Pit? Will the dust praise You? Will it proclaim Your faithfulness?
contents: “What gain is there in my bloodshed,

footnote.ft: Or in my destruction

contents: in my descent to the Pit?

footnote.ft: Or to corruption

contents: Will the dust praise You?
Will it proclaim Your faithfulness?

contents.verseText: Hear me, O LORD, and have mercy; O LORD, be my helper.”
contents: Hear me, O LORD, and have mercy;
O LORD, be my helper.”

contents.verseText: You turned my mourning into dancing; You peeled off my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,
contents: You turned my mourning into dancing;
You peeled off my sackcloth and clothed me with joy,

contents.verseText: that my heart may sing Your praises and not be silent. O LORD my God, I will give thanks forever.
contents: that my heart may sing Your praises and not be silent.
O LORD my God, I will give thanks forever.

s1: Into Your Hands I Commit My Spirit

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: In You, O LORD, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame; save me by Your righteousness.
contents: In You, O LORD, I have taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame;
save me by Your righteousness.

contents.verseText: Incline Your ear to me; come quickly to my rescue. Be my rock of refuge, the stronghold of my deliverance.
contents: Incline Your ear to me;
come quickly to my rescue.
Be my rock of refuge,
the stronghold of my deliverance.

contents.verseText: For You are my rock and my fortress; lead me and guide me for the sake of Your name.
contents: For You are my rock and my fortress;
lead me and guide me for the sake of Your name.

contents.verseText: You free me from the net laid out for me, for You are my refuge.
contents: You free me from the net laid out for me,
for You are my refuge.

contents.verseText: Into Your hands I commit my spirit; You have redeemed me, O LORD, God of truth.
contents: Into Your hands I commit my spirit;

footnote.ft: Cited in Luke 23:46

contents: You have redeemed me, O LORD, God of truth.

contents.verseText: I hate those who cling to worthless idols, but in the LORD I trust.
contents: I hate

footnote.ft: MT; one Hebrew manuscript, LXX, and Syriac You hate

contents: those who cling to worthless idols,
but in the LORD I trust.

contents.verseText: I will be glad and rejoice in Your loving devotion, for You have seen my affliction; You have known the anguish of my soul.
contents: I will be glad and rejoice in Your loving devotion,
for You have seen my affliction;
You have known the anguish of my soul.

contents.verseText: You have not delivered me to the enemy; You have set my feet in the open.
contents: You have not delivered me to the enemy;
You have set my feet in the open.

contents.verseText: Be merciful to me, O LORD, for I am in distress; my eyes fail from sorrow, my soul and body as well.
contents: Be merciful to me, O LORD,
for I am in distress;
my eyes fail from sorrow,
my soul and body as well.

contents.verseText: For my life is consumed with grief and my years with groaning; my iniquity has drained my strength, and my bones are wasting away.
contents: For my life is consumed with grief
and my years with groaning;
my iniquity has drained my strength,
and my bones are wasting away.

contents.verseText: Among all my enemies I am a disgrace, and among my neighbors even more. I am dreaded by my friends—they flee when they see me on the street.
contents: Among all my enemies I am a disgrace,
and among my neighbors even more.
I am dreaded by my friends—
they flee when they see me on the street.

contents.verseText: I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind. I am like a broken vessel.
contents: I am forgotten like a dead man, out of mind.
I am like a broken vessel.

contents.verseText: For I hear the slander of many; there is terror on every side. They conspire against me and plot to take my life.
contents: For I hear the slander of many;
there is terror on every side.
They conspire against me
and plot to take my life.

contents.verseText: But I trust in You, O LORD; I say, “You are my God.”
contents: But I trust in You, O LORD;
I say, “You are my God.”

contents.verseText: My times are in Your hands; deliver me from my enemies and from those who pursue me.
contents: My times are in Your hands;
deliver me from my enemies
and from those who pursue me.

contents.verseText: Make Your face shine on Your servant; save me by Your loving devotion.
contents: Make Your face shine on Your servant;
save me by Your loving devotion.

contents.verseText: O LORD, let me not be ashamed, for I have called on You. Let the wicked be put to shame; let them lie silent in Sheol.
contents: O LORD, let me not be ashamed,
for I have called on You.
Let the wicked be put to shame;
let them lie silent in Sheol.

contents.verseText: May lying lips be silenced—lips that speak with arrogance against the righteous, full of pride and contempt.
contents: May lying lips be silenced—
lips that speak with arrogance against the righteous,
full of pride and contempt.

contents.verseText: How great is Your goodness which You have laid up for those who fear You, which You have bestowed before the sons of men on those who take refuge in You!
contents: How great is Your goodness
which You have laid up for those who fear You,
which You have bestowed before the sons of men
on those who take refuge in You!

contents.verseText: You hide them in the secret place of Your presence from the schemes of men. You conceal them in Your shelter from accusing tongues.
contents: You hide them in the secret place of Your presence
from the schemes of men.
You conceal them in Your shelter
from accusing tongues.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD, for He has shown me His loving devotion in a city under siege.
contents: Blessed be the LORD,
for He has shown me His loving devotion
in a city under siege.

contents.verseText: In my alarm I said, “I am cut off from Your sight!” But You heard my plea for mercy when I called to You for help.
contents: In my alarm I said,
“I am cut off from Your sight!”
But You heard my plea for mercy
when I called to You for help.

contents.verseText: Love the LORD, all His saints. The LORD preserves the faithful, but fully repays the arrogant.
contents: Love the LORD, all His saints.
The LORD preserves the faithful,
but fully repays the arrogant.

contents.verseText: Be strong and courageous, all you who hope in the LORD.
contents: Be strong and courageous,
all you who hope in the LORD.

d: Of David. A Maskil.

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

contents.verseText: Blessed is he whose transgressions are forgiven, whose sins are covered.
contents: Blessed is he whose transgressions are forgiven,
whose sins are covered.

footnote.ft: LXX Blessed is he whose lawless acts are forgiven, whose sins are covered; cited in Romans 4:7

contents.verseText: Blessed is the man whose iniquity the LORD does not count against him, in whose spirit there is no deceit.
contents: Blessed is the man
whose iniquity the LORD does not count against him,

footnote.ft: LXX Blessed is the man whose sin the LORD does not count against him; cited in Romans 4:8

contents: in whose spirit there is no deceit.

contents.verseText: When I kept silent, my bones became brittle from my groaning all day long.
contents: When I kept silent, my bones became brittle
from my groaning all day long.

contents.verseText: For day and night Your hand was heavy upon me; my strength was drained as in the summer heat. Selah
contents: For day and night
Your hand was heavy upon me;
my strength was drained

footnote.ft: Or my vitality was turned

contents: as in the summer heat.
Selah

contents.verseText: Then I acknowledged my sin to You and did not hide my iniquity. I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,” and You forgave the guilt of my sin. Selah
contents: Then I acknowledged my sin to You
and did not hide my iniquity.
I said, “I will confess my transgressions to the LORD,”
and You forgave the guilt of my sin.
Selah

contents.verseText: Therefore let all the godly pray to You while You may be found. Surely when great waters rise, they will not come near.
contents: Therefore let all the godly pray to You
while You may be found.
Surely when great waters rise,
they will not come near.

contents.verseText: You are my hiding place. You protect me from trouble; You surround me with songs of deliverance. Selah
contents: You are my hiding place.
You protect me from trouble;
You surround me with songs of deliverance.
Selah

contents.verseText: I will instruct you and teach you the way you should go; I will give you counsel and watch over you.
contents: I will instruct you and teach you the way you should go;
I will give you counsel and watch over you.

contents.verseText: Do not be like the horse or mule, which have no understanding; they must be controlled with bit and bridle to make them come to you.
contents: Do not be like the horse or mule,
which have no understanding;
they must be controlled with bit and bridle
to make them come to you.

contents.verseText: Many are the sorrows of the wicked, but loving devotion surrounds him who trusts in the LORD.
contents: Many are the sorrows of the wicked,
but loving devotion surrounds him who trusts in the LORD.

contents.verseText: Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, O righteous ones; shout for joy, all you upright in heart.
contents: Be glad in the LORD and rejoice, O righteous ones;
shout for joy, all you upright in heart.

contents.verseText: Rejoice in the LORD, O righteous ones; it is fitting for the upright to praise Him.
contents: Rejoice in the LORD, O righteous ones;
it is fitting for the upright to praise Him.

contents.verseText: Praise the LORD with the harp; make music to Him with ten strings.
contents: Praise the LORD with the harp;
make music to Him with ten strings.

contents.verseText: Sing to Him a new song; play skillfully with a shout of joy.
contents: Sing to Him a new song;
play skillfully with a shout of joy.

contents.verseText: For the word of the LORD is upright, and all His work is trustworthy.
contents: For the word of the LORD is upright,
and all His work is trustworthy.

contents.verseText: The LORD loves righteousness and justice; the earth is full of His loving devotion.
contents: The LORD loves righteousness and justice;
the earth is full of His loving devotion.

contents.verseText: By the word of the LORD the heavens were made, and all the stars by the breath of His mouth.
contents: By the word of the LORD the heavens were made,
and all the stars by the breath of His mouth.

contents.verseText: He piles up the waters of the sea; He puts the depths into storehouses.
contents: He piles up the waters of the sea;
He puts the depths into storehouses.

contents.verseText: Let all the earth fear the LORD; let all the people of the world revere Him.
contents: Let all the earth fear the LORD;
let all the people of the world revere Him.

contents.verseText: For He spoke, and it came to be; He commanded, and it stood firm.
contents: For He spoke, and it came to be;
He commanded, and it stood firm.

contents.verseText: The LORD frustrates the plans of the nations; He thwarts the devices of the peoples.
contents: The LORD frustrates the plans of the nations;
He thwarts the devices of the peoples.

contents.verseText: The counsel of the LORD stands forever, the purposes of His heart to all generations.
contents: The counsel of the LORD stands forever,
the purposes of His heart to all generations.

contents.verseText: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD, the people He has chosen as His inheritance!
contents: Blessed is the nation whose God is the LORD,
the people He has chosen as His inheritance!

contents.verseText: The LORD looks down from heaven; He sees all the sons of men.
contents: The LORD looks down from heaven;
He sees all the sons of men.

contents.verseText: From His dwelling place He gazes on all who inhabit the earth.
contents: From His dwelling place He gazes
on all who inhabit the earth.

contents.verseText: He shapes the hearts of each; He considers all their works.
contents: He shapes the hearts of each;
He considers all their works.

contents.verseText: No king is saved by his vast army; no warrior is delivered by his great strength.
contents: No king is saved by his vast army;
no warrior is delivered by his great strength.

contents.verseText: A horse is a vain hope for salvation; even its great strength cannot save.
contents: A horse is a vain hope for salvation;
even its great strength cannot save.

contents.verseText: Surely the eyes of the LORD are on those who fear Him, on those whose hope is in His loving devotion
contents: Surely the eyes of the LORD are on those who fear Him,
on those whose hope is in His loving devotion

contents.verseText: to deliver them from death and keep them alive in famine.
contents: to deliver them from death
and keep them alive in famine.

contents.verseText: Our soul waits for the LORD; He is our help and our shield.
contents: Our soul waits for the LORD;
He is our help and our shield.

contents.verseText: For our hearts rejoice in Him, since we trust in His holy name.
contents: For our hearts rejoice in Him,
since we trust in His holy name.

contents.verseText: May Your loving devotion rest on us, O LORD, as we put our hope in You.
contents: May Your loving devotion rest on us, O LORD,
as we put our hope in You.

s1: Taste and See That the LORD Is Good

d: Of David, when he pretended to be insane before Abimelech,

footnote.ft: Abimelech is another name for Achish; see 1 Samuel 21–29 and 1 Kings 2:39.

d: so that the king drove him away.

footnote.ft: This psalm is an acrostic poem, each verse beginning with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet.

contents.verseText: I will bless the LORD at all times; His praise will always be on my lips.
contents: I will bless the LORD at all times;
His praise will always be on my lips.

contents.verseText: My soul boasts in the LORD; let the oppressed hear and rejoice.
contents: My soul boasts in the LORD;
let the oppressed hear and rejoice.

contents.verseText: Magnify the LORD with me; let us exalt His name together.
contents: Magnify the LORD with me;
let us exalt His name together.

contents.verseText: I sought the LORD, and He answered me; He delivered me from all my fears.
contents: I sought the LORD, and He answered me;
He delivered me from all my fears.

contents.verseText: Those who look to Him are radiant with joy; their faces shall never be ashamed.
contents: Those who look to Him are radiant with joy;
their faces shall never be ashamed.

contents.verseText: This poor man called out, and the LORD heard him; He saved him from all his troubles.
contents: This poor man called out, and the LORD heard him;
He saved him from all his troubles.

contents.verseText: The angel of the LORD encamps around those who fear Him, and he delivers them.
contents: The angel of the LORD encamps around those who fear Him,
and he delivers them.

contents.verseText: Taste and see that the LORD is good; blessed is the man who takes refuge in Him!
contents: Taste and see that the LORD is good;
blessed is the man who takes refuge in Him!

contents.verseText: Fear the LORD, you His saints, for those who fear Him lack nothing.
contents: Fear the LORD, you His saints,
for those who fear Him lack nothing.

contents.verseText: Young lions go lacking and hungry, but those who seek the LORD lack no good thing.
contents: Young lions go lacking and hungry,
but those who seek the LORD lack no good thing.

contents.verseText: Come, children, listen to me; I will teach you the fear of the LORD.
contents: Come, children, listen to me;
I will teach you the fear of the LORD.

contents.verseText: Who is the man who delights in life, who desires to see good days?
contents: Who is the man who delights in life,
who desires to see good days?

contents.verseText: Keep your tongue from evil and your lips from deceitful speech.
contents: Keep your tongue from evil
and your lips from deceitful speech.

contents.verseText: Turn away from evil and do good; seek peace and pursue it.
contents: Turn away from evil and do good;
seek peace and pursue it.

contents.verseText: The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous, and His ears are inclined to their cry.
contents: The eyes of the LORD are on the righteous,
and His ears are inclined to their cry.

footnote.ft: LXX to their prayer

contents.verseText: But the face of the LORD is against those who do evil, to wipe out all memory of them from the earth.
contents: But the face of the LORD is against those who do evil,

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Peter 3:10–12

contents: to wipe out all memory of them from the earth.

contents.verseText: The righteous cry out, and the LORD hears; He delivers them from all their troubles.
contents: The righteous cry out, and the LORD hears;
He delivers them from all their troubles.

contents.verseText: The LORD is near to the brokenhearted; He saves the contrite in spirit.
contents: The LORD is near to the brokenhearted;
He saves the contrite in spirit.

contents.verseText: Many are the afflictions of the righteous, but the LORD delivers him from them all.
contents: Many are the afflictions of the righteous,
but the LORD delivers him from them all.

contents.verseText: He protects all his bones; not one of them will be broken.
contents: He protects all his bones;
not one of them will be broken.

footnote.ft: Cited in John 19:36

contents.verseText: Evil will slay the wicked, and the haters of the righteous will be condemned.
contents: Evil will slay the wicked,
and the haters of the righteous will be condemned.

contents.verseText: The LORD redeems His servants, and none who take refuge in Him will be condemned.
contents: The LORD redeems His servants,
and none who take refuge in Him will be condemned.

s1: Contend with My Opponents, O LORD

d: Of David.

contents.verseText: Contend with my opponents, O LORD; fight against those who fight against me.
contents: Contend with my opponents, O LORD;
fight against those who fight against me.

contents.verseText: Take up Your shield and buckler; arise and come to my aid.
contents: Take up Your shield and buckler;
arise and come to my aid.

contents.verseText: Draw the spear and javelin against my pursuers; say to my soul: “I am your salvation.”
contents: Draw the spear and javelin

footnote.ft: Or and close the way

contents: against my pursuers;
say to my soul: “I am your salvation.”

contents.verseText: May those who seek my life be disgraced and put to shame; may those who plan to harm me be driven back and confounded.
contents: May those who seek my life
be disgraced and put to shame;
may those who plan to harm me
be driven back and confounded.

contents.verseText: May they be like chaff in the wind, as the angel of the LORD drives them away.
contents: May they be like chaff in the wind,
as the angel of the LORD drives them away.

contents.verseText: May their path be dark and slick, as the angel of the LORD pursues.
contents: May their path be dark and slick,
as the angel of the LORD pursues.

contents.verseText: For without cause they laid their net for me; without reason they dug a pit for my soul.
contents: For without cause they laid their net for me;
without reason they dug a pit for my soul.

contents.verseText: May ruin befall them by surprise; may the net they hid ensnare them; may they fall into the hazard they created.
contents: May ruin befall them by surprise;
may the net they hid ensnare them;
may they fall into the hazard they created.

contents.verseText: Then my soul will rejoice in the LORD and exult in His salvation.
contents: Then my soul will rejoice in the LORD
and exult in His salvation.

contents.verseText: All my bones will exclaim, “Who is like You, O LORD, who delivers the afflicted from the aggressor, the poor and needy from the robber?”
contents: All my bones will exclaim,
“Who is like You, O LORD,
who delivers the afflicted from the aggressor,
the poor and needy from the robber?”

contents.verseText: Hostile witnesses come forward; they make charges I know nothing about.
contents: Hostile witnesses come forward;
they make charges I know nothing about.

contents.verseText: They repay me evil for good, to the bereavement of my soul.
contents: They repay me evil for good,
to the bereavement of my soul.

contents.verseText: Yet when they were ill, I put on sackcloth; I humbled myself with fasting, but my prayers returned unanswered.
contents: Yet when they were ill,
I put on sackcloth;
I humbled myself with fasting,
but my prayers returned unanswered.

footnote.ft: Literally returned to my bosom

contents.verseText: I paced about as for my friend or brother; I was bowed down with grief, like one mourning for his mother.
contents: I paced about
as for my friend or brother;
I was bowed down with grief,
like one mourning for his mother.

contents.verseText: But when I stumbled, they assembled in glee; they gathered together against me. Assailants I did not know slandered me without ceasing.
contents: But when I stumbled, they assembled in glee;
they gathered together against me.
Assailants I did not know
slandered me without ceasing.

contents.verseText: Like godless jesters at a feast, they gnashed their teeth at me.
contents: Like godless jesters at a feast,

footnote.ft: Or Like a godless circle of mockers,

contents: they gnashed their teeth at me.

contents.verseText: How long, O Lord, will You look on? Rescue my soul from their ravages, my precious life from these lions.
contents: How long, O Lord, will You look on?
Rescue my soul from their ravages,
my precious life from these lions.

contents.verseText: Then I will give You thanks in the great assembly; I will praise You among many people.
contents: Then I will give You thanks in the great assembly;
I will praise You among many people.

contents.verseText: Let not my enemies gloat over me without cause, nor those who hate me without reason wink in malice.
contents: Let not my enemies gloat over me without cause,
nor those who hate me without reason wink in malice.

footnote.ft: See John 15:25.

contents.verseText: For they do not speak peace, but they devise deceitful schemes against those who live quietly in the land.
contents: For they do not speak peace,
but they devise deceitful schemes
against those who live quietly in the land.

contents.verseText: They gape at me and say, “Aha, aha! Our eyes have seen!”
contents: They gape at me and say,
“Aha, aha! Our eyes have seen!”

contents.verseText: O LORD, You have seen it; be not silent. O Lord, be not far from me.
contents: O LORD, You have seen it; be not silent.
O Lord, be not far from me.

contents.verseText: Awake and rise to my defense, to my cause, my God and my Lord!
contents: Awake and rise to my defense,
to my cause, my God and my Lord!

contents.verseText: Vindicate me by Your righteousness, O LORD my God, and do not let them gloat over me.
contents: Vindicate me by Your righteousness, O LORD my God,
and do not let them gloat over me.

contents.verseText: Let them not say in their hearts, “Aha, just what we wanted!” Let them not say, “We have swallowed him up!”
contents: Let them not say in their hearts,
“Aha, just what we wanted!”
Let them not say,
“We have swallowed him up!”

contents.verseText: May those who gloat in my distress be ashamed and confounded; may those who exalt themselves over me be clothed in shame and reproach.
contents: May those who gloat in my distress
be ashamed and confounded;
may those who exalt themselves over me
be clothed in shame and reproach.

contents.verseText: May those who favor my vindication shout for joy and gladness; may they always say, “Exalted be the LORD who delights in His servant’s well-being.”
contents: May those who favor my vindication
shout for joy and gladness;
may they always say, “Exalted be the LORD
who delights in His servant’s well-being.”

contents.verseText: Then my tongue will proclaim Your righteousness and Your praises all day long.
contents: Then my tongue will proclaim Your righteousness
and Your praises all day long.

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David, the servant of the LORD.

contents.verseText: An oracle is in my heart regarding the transgression of the wicked man: There is no fear of God before his eyes.
contents: An oracle is in my heart
regarding the transgression of the wicked man:
There is no fear of God
before his eyes.

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 3:18

contents.verseText: For his eyes are too full of conceit to detect or hate his own sin.
contents: For his eyes are too full of conceit
to detect or hate his own sin.

contents.verseText: The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful; he has ceased to be wise and well-doing.
contents: The words of his mouth are wicked and deceitful;
he has ceased to be wise and well-doing.

contents.verseText: Even on his bed he plots wickedness; he sets himself on a path that is not good; he fails to reject evil.
contents: Even on his bed he plots wickedness;
he sets himself on a path that is not good;
he fails to reject evil.

contents.verseText: Your loving devotion, O LORD, reaches to the heavens, Your faithfulness to the clouds.
contents: Your loving devotion, O LORD, reaches to the heavens,
Your faithfulness to the clouds.

contents.verseText: Your righteousness is like the highest mountains; Your judgments are like the deepest sea. O LORD, You preserve man and beast.
contents: Your righteousness is like the highest mountains;
Your judgments are like the deepest sea.
O LORD, You preserve man and beast.

contents.verseText: How precious is Your loving devotion, O God, that the children of men take refuge in the shadow of Your wings!
contents: How precious is Your loving devotion, O God,
that the children of men take refuge
in the shadow of Your wings!

contents.verseText: They feast on the abundance of Your house, and You give them drink from Your river of delights.
contents: They feast on the abundance of Your house,
and You give them drink from Your river of delights.

contents.verseText: For with You is the fountain of life; in Your light we see light.
contents: For with You is the fountain of life;
in Your light we see light.

contents.verseText: Extend Your loving devotion to those who know You, and Your righteousness to the upright in heart.
contents: Extend Your loving devotion to those who know You,
and Your righteousness to the upright in heart.

contents.verseText: Let not the foot of the proud come against me, nor the hand of the wicked drive me away.
contents: Let not the foot of the proud come against me,
nor the hand of the wicked drive me away.

contents.verseText: There the evildoers lie fallen, thrown down and unable to rise.
contents: There the evildoers lie fallen,
thrown down and unable to rise.

d: Of David.

footnote.ft: This psalm is an acrostic poem, each stanza beginning with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet.

contents.verseText: Do not fret over those who do evil; do not envy those who do wrong.
contents: Do not fret over those who do evil;
do not envy those who do wrong.

contents.verseText: For they wither quickly like grass and wilt like tender plants.
contents: For they wither quickly like grass
and wilt like tender plants.

contents.verseText: Trust in the LORD and do good; dwell in the land and cultivate faithfulness.
contents: Trust in the LORD and do good;
dwell in the land and cultivate faithfulness.

contents.verseText: Delight yourself in the LORD, and He will give you the desires of your heart.
contents: Delight yourself in the LORD,
and He will give you the desires of your heart.

contents.verseText: Commit your way to the LORD; trust in Him, and He will do it.
contents: Commit your way to the LORD;
trust in Him, and He will do it.

contents.verseText: He will bring forth your righteousness like the dawn, your justice like the noonday sun.
contents: He will bring forth your righteousness like the dawn,
your justice like the noonday sun.

contents.verseText: Be still before the LORD and wait patiently for Him; do not fret when men prosper in their ways, when they carry out wicked schemes.
contents: Be still before the LORD
and wait patiently for Him;
do not fret when men prosper in their ways,
when they carry out wicked schemes.

contents.verseText: Refrain from anger and abandon wrath; do not fret—it can only bring harm.
contents: Refrain from anger and abandon wrath;
do not fret—it can only bring harm.

contents.verseText: For the evildoers will be cut off, but those who hope in the LORD will inherit the land.
contents: For the evildoers will be cut off,
but those who hope in the LORD will inherit the land.

contents.verseText: Yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more; though you look for them, they will not be found.
contents: Yet a little while, and the wicked will be no more;
though you look for them, they will not be found.

contents.verseText: But the meek will inherit the land and delight in abundant prosperity.
contents: But the meek will inherit the land

footnote.ft: Or the earth; see Matthew 5:5.

contents: and delight in abundant prosperity.

contents.verseText: The wicked scheme against the righteous and gnash their teeth at them,
contents: The wicked scheme against the righteous
and gnash their teeth at them,

contents.verseText: but the Lord laughs, seeing that their day is coming.
contents: but the Lord laughs,
seeing that their day is coming.

contents.verseText: The wicked have drawn the sword and bent the bow to bring down the poor and needy, to slay those whose ways are upright.
contents: The wicked have drawn the sword
and bent the bow
to bring down the poor and needy,
to slay those whose ways are upright.

contents.verseText: But their swords will pierce their own hearts, and their bows will be broken.
contents: But their swords will pierce their own hearts,
and their bows will be broken.

contents.verseText: Better is the little of the righteous than the abundance of many who are wicked.
contents: Better is the little of the righteous
than the abundance of many who are wicked.

contents.verseText: For the arms of the wicked will be broken, but the LORD upholds the righteous.
contents: For the arms of the wicked will be broken,
but the LORD upholds the righteous.

contents.verseText: The LORD knows the days of the blameless, and their inheritance will last forever.
contents: The LORD knows the days of the blameless,
and their inheritance will last forever.

contents.verseText: In the time of evil they will not be ashamed, and in the days of famine they will be satisfied.
contents: In the time of evil they will not be ashamed,
and in the days of famine they will be satisfied.

contents.verseText: But the wicked and enemies of the LORD will perish like the glory of the fields. They will vanish; like smoke they will fade away.
contents: But the wicked and enemies of the LORD
will perish like the glory of the fields.
They will vanish;
like smoke they will fade away.

contents.verseText: The wicked borrow and do not repay, but the righteous are gracious and giving.
contents: The wicked borrow and do not repay,
but the righteous are gracious and giving.

contents.verseText: Surely those He blesses will inherit the land, but the cursed will be destroyed.
contents: Surely those He blesses will inherit the land,
but the cursed will be destroyed.

contents.verseText: The steps of a man are ordered by the LORD who takes delight in his journey.
contents: The steps of a man are ordered by the LORD
who takes delight in his journey.

contents.verseText: Though he falls, he will not be overwhelmed, for the LORD is holding his hand.
contents: Though he falls, he will not be overwhelmed,
for the LORD is holding his hand.

footnote.ft: Or upholds him with His hand

contents.verseText: I once was young and now am old, yet never have I seen the righteous abandoned or their children begging for bread.
contents: I once was young and now am old,
yet never have I seen the righteous abandoned
or their children begging for bread.

contents.verseText: They are ever generous and quick to lend, and their children are a blessing.
contents: They are ever generous and quick to lend,
and their children are a blessing.

contents.verseText: Turn away from evil and do good, so that you will abide forever.
contents: Turn away from evil and do good,
so that you will abide forever.

contents.verseText: For the LORD loves justice and will not forsake His saints. They are preserved forever, but the offspring of the wicked will be cut off.
contents: For the LORD loves justice
and will not forsake His saints.
They are preserved forever,
but the offspring of the wicked will be cut off.

contents.verseText: The righteous will inherit the land and dwell in it forever.
contents: The righteous will inherit the land
and dwell in it forever.

contents.verseText: The mouth of the righteous man utters wisdom, and his tongue speaks justice.
contents: The mouth of the righteous man utters wisdom,
and his tongue speaks justice.

contents.verseText: The law of his God is in his heart; his steps do not falter.
contents: The law of his God is in his heart;
his steps do not falter.

contents.verseText: Though the wicked lie in wait for the righteous, and seek to slay them,
contents: Though the wicked lie in wait for the righteous,
and seek to slay them,

contents.verseText: the LORD will not leave them in their power or let them be condemned under judgment.
contents: the LORD will not leave them in their power
or let them be condemned under judgment.

contents.verseText: Wait for the LORD and keep His way, and He will raise you up to inherit the land. When the wicked are cut off, you will see it.
contents: Wait for the LORD and keep His way,
and He will raise you up to inherit the land.
When the wicked are cut off,
you will see it.

contents.verseText: I have seen a wicked, ruthless man flourishing like a well-rooted native tree,
contents: I have seen a wicked, ruthless man
flourishing like a well-rooted native tree,

contents.verseText: yet he passed away and was no more; though I searched, he could not be found.
contents: yet he passed away and was no more;
though I searched, he could not be found.

contents.verseText: Consider the blameless and observe the upright, for posterity awaits the man of peace.
contents: Consider the blameless and observe the upright,
for posterity awaits the man of peace.

footnote.ft: Or for there is a future for the man of peace

contents.verseText: But the transgressors will all be destroyed; the future of the wicked will be cut off.
contents: But the transgressors will all be destroyed;
the future of the wicked will be cut off.

contents.verseText: The salvation of the righteous is from the LORD; He is their stronghold in time of trouble.
contents: The salvation of the righteous is from the LORD;
He is their stronghold in time of trouble.

contents.verseText: The LORD helps and delivers them; He rescues and saves them from the wicked, because they take refuge in Him.
contents: The LORD helps and delivers them;
He rescues and saves them from the wicked,
because they take refuge in Him.

s1: Do Not Rebuke Me in Your Anger

d: A Psalm of David, for remembrance.

contents.verseText: O LORD, do not rebuke me in Your anger or discipline me in Your wrath.
contents: O LORD, do not rebuke me in Your anger
or discipline me in Your wrath.

contents.verseText: For Your arrows have pierced me deeply, and Your hand has pressed down on me.
contents: For Your arrows have pierced me deeply,
and Your hand has pressed down on me.

contents.verseText: There is no soundness in my body because of Your anger; there is no rest in my bones because of my sin.
contents: There is no soundness in my body
because of Your anger;
there is no rest in my bones
because of my sin.

contents.verseText: For my iniquities have overwhelmed me; they are a burden too heavy to bear.
contents: For my iniquities have overwhelmed me;
they are a burden too heavy to bear.

contents.verseText: My wounds are foul and festering because of my sinful folly.
contents: My wounds are foul and festering
because of my sinful folly.

contents.verseText: I am bent and brought low; all day long I go about mourning.
contents: I am bent and brought low;
all day long I go about mourning.

contents.verseText: For my loins are full of burning pain, and no soundness remains in my body.
contents: For my loins are full of burning pain,
and no soundness remains in my body.

contents.verseText: I am numb and badly crushed; I groan in anguish of heart.
contents: I am numb and badly crushed;
I groan in anguish of heart.

contents.verseText: O Lord, my every desire is before You; my groaning is not hidden from You.
contents: O Lord, my every desire is before You;
my groaning is not hidden from You.

contents.verseText: My heart pounds, my strength fails, and even the light of my eyes has faded.
contents: My heart pounds, my strength fails,
and even the light of my eyes has faded.

contents.verseText: My beloved and friends shun my disease, and my kinsmen stand at a distance.
contents: My beloved and friends shun my disease,
and my kinsmen stand at a distance.

contents.verseText: Those who seek my life lay snares; those who wish me harm speak destruction, plotting deceit all day long.
contents: Those who seek my life lay snares;
those who wish me harm speak destruction,
plotting deceit all day long.

contents.verseText: But like a deaf man, I do not hear; and like a mute man, I do not open my mouth.
contents: But like a deaf man, I do not hear;
and like a mute man, I do not open my mouth.

contents.verseText: I am like a man who cannot hear, whose mouth offers no reply.
contents: I am like a man who cannot hear,
whose mouth offers no reply.

contents.verseText: I wait for You, O LORD; You will answer, O Lord my God.
contents: I wait for You, O LORD;
You will answer, O Lord my God.

contents.verseText: For I said, “Let them not gloat over me—those who taunt me when my foot slips.”
contents: For I said, “Let them not gloat over me—
those who taunt me when my foot slips.”

contents.verseText: For I am ready to fall, and my pain is ever with me.
contents: For I am ready to fall,
and my pain is ever with me.

contents.verseText: Yes, I confess my iniquity; I am troubled by my sin.
contents: Yes, I confess my iniquity;
I am troubled by my sin.

contents.verseText: Many are my enemies without cause, and many hate me without reason.
contents: Many are my enemies without cause,

footnote.ft: One DSS manuscript; MT My enemies are vigorous and strong

contents: and many hate me without reason.

footnote.ft: See John 15:25

contents.verseText: Those who repay my good with evil attack me for pursuing the good.
contents: Those who repay my good with evil
attack me for pursuing the good.

contents.verseText: Do not forsake me, O LORD; be not far from me, O my God.
contents: Do not forsake me, O LORD;
be not far from me, O my God.

contents.verseText: Come quickly to help me, O Lord my Savior.
contents: Come quickly to help me,
O Lord my Savior.

d: For the choirmaster. For Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: I said, “I will watch my ways so that I will not sin with my tongue; I will guard my mouth with a muzzle as long as the wicked are present.”
contents: I said, “I will watch my ways
so that I will not sin with my tongue;
I will guard my mouth with a muzzle
as long as the wicked are present.”

contents.verseText: I was speechless and still; I remained silent, even from speaking good, and my sorrow was stirred.
contents: I was speechless and still;
I remained silent, even from speaking good,
and my sorrow was stirred.

contents.verseText: My heart grew hot within me; as I mused, the fire burned. Then I spoke with my tongue:
contents: My heart grew hot within me;
as I mused, the fire burned.
Then I spoke with my tongue:

contents.verseText: “Show me, O LORD, my end and the measure of my days. Let me know how fleeting my life is.
contents: “Show me, O LORD, my end
and the measure of my days.
Let me know how fleeting my life is.

contents.verseText: You, indeed, have made my days as handbreadths, and my lifetime as nothing before You. Truly each man at his best exists as but a breath. Selah
contents: You, indeed, have made my days as handbreadths,
and my lifetime as nothing before You.
Truly each man at his best
exists as but a breath.
Selah

contents.verseText: Surely every man goes about like a phantom; surely he bustles in vain; he heaps up riches not knowing who will haul them away.
contents: Surely every man goes about like a phantom;
surely he bustles in vain;
he heaps up riches
not knowing who will haul them away.

contents.verseText: And now, O Lord, for what do I wait? My hope is in You.
contents: And now, O Lord, for what do I wait?
My hope is in You.

contents.verseText: Deliver me from all my transgressions; do not make me the reproach of fools.
contents: Deliver me from all my transgressions;
do not make me the reproach of fools.

contents.verseText: I have become mute; I do not open my mouth because of what You have done.
contents: I have become mute;
I do not open my mouth
because of what You have done.

contents.verseText: Remove Your scourge from me; I am perishing by the force of Your hand.
contents: Remove Your scourge from me;
I am perishing by the force of Your hand.

contents.verseText: You discipline and correct a man for his iniquity, consuming like a moth what he holds dear; surely each man is but a vapor. Selah
contents: You discipline and correct a man for his iniquity,
consuming like a moth what he holds dear;
surely each man is but a vapor.
Selah

contents.verseText: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and give ear to my cry for help; do not be deaf to my weeping. For I am a foreigner dwelling with You, a stranger like all my fathers.
contents: Hear my prayer, O LORD,
and give ear to my cry for help;
do not be deaf to my weeping.
For I am a foreigner dwelling with You,
a stranger like all my fathers.

contents.verseText: Turn Your gaze away from me, that I may again be cheered before I depart and am no more.”
contents: Turn Your gaze away from me,
that I may again be cheered
before I depart and am no more.”

s1: I Waited Patiently for the LORD

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: I waited patiently for the LORD; He inclined to me and heard my cry.
contents: I waited patiently for the LORD;
He inclined to me and heard my cry.

contents.verseText: He lifted me up from the pit of despair, out of the miry clay; He set my feet upon a rock, and made my footsteps firm.
contents: He lifted me up from the pit of despair,
out of the miry clay;
He set my feet upon a rock,
and made my footsteps firm.

contents.verseText: He put a new song in my mouth, a hymn of praise to our God. Many will see and fear and put their trust in the LORD.
contents: He put a new song in my mouth,
a hymn of praise to our God.
Many will see and fear
and put their trust in the LORD.

contents.verseText: Blessed is the man who has made the LORD his trust, who has not turned to the proud, nor to those who lapse into falsehood.
contents: Blessed is the man
who has made the LORD his trust,
who has not turned to the proud,
nor to those who lapse into falsehood.

footnote.ft: Or who turn aside to false gods or who run after lies

contents.verseText: Many, O LORD my God, are the wonders You have done, and the plans You have for us—none can compare to You—if I proclaim and declare them, they are more than I can count.
contents: Many, O LORD my God,
are the wonders You have done,
and the plans You have for us—
none can compare to You—
if I proclaim and declare them,
they are more than I can count.

contents.verseText: Sacrifice and offering You did not desire, but my ears You have opened. Burnt offerings and sin offerings You did not require.
contents: Sacrifice and offering You did not desire,
but my ears You have opened.

footnote.ft: Hebrew; some LXX manuscripts but a body You prepared for me

contents: Burnt offerings and sin offerings
You did not require.

contents.verseText: Then I said, “Here I am, I have come—it is written about me in the scroll:
contents: Then I said, “Here I am, I have come—
it is written about me in the scroll:

contents.verseText: I delight to do Your will, O my God; Your law is within my heart.”
contents: I delight to do Your will, O my God;

footnote.ft: Cited in Hebrews 10:5–7

contents: Your law is within my heart.”

contents.verseText: I proclaim righteousness in the great assembly; behold, I do not seal my lips, as You, O LORD, do know.
contents: I proclaim righteousness in the great assembly;
behold, I do not seal my lips,
as You, O LORD, do know.

contents.verseText: I have not covered up Your righteousness in my heart; I have declared Your faithfulness and salvation; I have not concealed Your loving devotion and faithfulness from the great assembly.
contents: I have not covered up Your righteousness in my heart;
I have declared Your faithfulness and salvation;
I have not concealed Your loving devotion and faithfulness
from the great assembly.

contents.verseText: O LORD, do not withhold Your mercy from me; Your loving devotion and faithfulness will always guard me.
contents: O LORD, do not withhold Your mercy from me;
Your loving devotion and faithfulness will always guard me.

contents.verseText: For evils without number surround me; my sins have overtaken me, so that I cannot see. They are more than the hairs of my head, and my heart has failed within me.
contents: For evils without number surround me;
my sins have overtaken me, so that I cannot see.
They are more than the hairs of my head,
and my heart has failed within me.

contents.verseText: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me; hurry, O LORD, to help me.
contents: Be pleased, O LORD, to deliver me;
hurry, O LORD, to help me.

contents.verseText: May those who seek my life be ashamed and confounded; may those who wish me harm be repelled and humiliated.
contents: May those who seek my life
be ashamed and confounded;
may those who wish me harm
be repelled and humiliated.

contents.verseText: May those who say to me, “Aha, aha!” be appalled at their own shame.
contents: May those who say to me, “Aha, aha!”
be appalled at their own shame.

contents.verseText: May all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; may those who love Your salvation always say, “The LORD be magnified!”
contents: May all who seek You
rejoice and be glad in You;
may those who love Your salvation
always say, “The LORD be magnified!”

contents.verseText: But I am poor and needy; may the Lord think of me. You are my helper and deliverer; O my God, do not delay.
contents: But I am poor and needy;
may the Lord think of me.
You are my helper and deliverer;
O my God, do not delay.

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: Blessed is the one who cares for the poor; the LORD will deliver him in the day of trouble.
contents: Blessed is the one who cares for the poor;
the LORD will deliver him in the day of trouble.

contents.verseText: The LORD will protect and preserve him; He will bless him in the land and refuse to surrender him to the will of his foes.
contents: The LORD will protect and preserve him;
He will bless him in the land
and refuse to surrender him
to the will of his foes.

contents.verseText: The LORD will sustain him on his bed of illness and restore him from his bed of sickness.
contents: The LORD will sustain him on his bed of illness
and restore him from his bed of sickness.

contents.verseText: I said, “O LORD, be gracious to me; heal me, for I have sinned against You.”
contents: I said, “O LORD, be gracious to me;
heal me, for I have sinned against You.”

contents.verseText: My enemies say with malice: “When will he die and be forgotten?”
contents: My enemies say with malice:
“When will he die and be forgotten?”

contents.verseText: My visitor speaks falsehood; he gathers slander in his heart; he goes out and spreads it abroad.
contents: My visitor speaks falsehood;
he gathers slander in his heart;
he goes out and spreads it abroad.

contents.verseText: All who hate me whisper against me; they imagine the worst for me:
contents: All who hate me whisper against me;
they imagine the worst for me:

contents.verseText: “A vile disease has been poured into him; he will never get up from where he lies!”
contents: “A vile disease has been poured into him;
he will never get up from where he lies!”

contents.verseText: Even my close friend whom I trusted, the one who shared my bread, has lifted up his heel against me.
contents: Even my close friend whom I trusted,
the one who shared my bread,
has lifted up his heel against me.

footnote.ft: Cited in John 13:18

contents.verseText: But You, O LORD, be gracious to me and raise me up, that I may repay them.
contents: But You, O LORD, be gracious to me and raise me up,
that I may repay them.

contents.verseText: By this I know that You delight in me, for my enemy does not triumph over me.
contents: By this I know that You delight in me,
for my enemy does not triumph over me.

contents.verseText: In my integrity You uphold me and set me in Your presence forever.
contents: In my integrity You uphold me
and set me in Your presence forever.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Amen and Amen.
contents: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel,
from everlasting to everlasting.
Amen and Amen.

s1: As the Deer Pants for the Water

d: For the choirmaster. A Maskil of the sons of Korah.

footnote.ft: In many Hebrew manuscripts Psalms 42 and 43 constitute one psalm. Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

contents.verseText: As the deer pants for streams of water, so my soul longs after You, O God.
contents: As the deer pants for streams of water,
so my soul longs after You, O God.

contents.verseText: My soul thirsts for God, the living God. When shall I come and appear in God’s presence?
contents: My soul thirsts for God, the living God.
When shall I come and appear in God’s presence?

footnote.ft: Or and see the face of God?

contents.verseText: My tears have been my food both day and night, while men ask me all day long, “Where is your God?”
contents: My tears have been my food
both day and night,
while men ask me all day long,
“Where is your God?”

contents.verseText: These things come to mind as I pour out my soul: how I walked with the multitude, leading the procession to the house of God with shouts of joy and praise.
contents: These things come to mind as I pour out my soul:
how I walked with the multitude,
leading the procession to the house of God
with shouts of joy and praise.

contents.verseText: Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why the unease within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise Him for the salvation of His presence.
contents: Why are you downcast, O my soul?
Why the unease within me?
Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise Him
for the salvation of His presence.

contents.verseText: O my God, my soul despairs within me. Therefore I remember You from the land of Jordan and the peaks of Hermon—even from Mount Mizar.
contents: O my God, my soul despairs within me.
Therefore I remember You
from the land of Jordan and the peaks of Hermon—
even from Mount Mizar.

contents.verseText: Deep calls to deep in the roar of Your waterfalls; all Your breakers and waves have rolled over me.
contents: Deep calls to deep
in the roar of Your waterfalls;
all Your breakers and waves
have rolled over me.

contents.verseText: The LORD decrees His loving devotion by day, and at night His song is with me as a prayer to the God of my life.
contents: The LORD decrees His loving devotion by day,
and at night His song is with me
as a prayer to the God of my life.

contents.verseText: I say to God my Rock, “Why have You forgotten me? Why must I walk in sorrow because of the enemy’s oppression?”
contents: I say to God my Rock,
“Why have You forgotten me?
Why must I walk in sorrow
because of the enemy’s oppression?”

contents.verseText: Like the crushing of my bones, my enemies taunt me, while they say to me all day long, “Where is your God?”
contents: Like the crushing of my bones,
my enemies taunt me,
while they say to me all day long,
“Where is your God?”

contents.verseText: Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why the unease within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise Him, my Savior and my God.
contents: Why are you downcast, O my soul?
Why the unease within me?
Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise Him,
my Savior and my God.

contents.verseText: Vindicate me, O God, and plead my case against an ungodly nation; deliver me from deceitful and unjust men.
contents: Vindicate me, O God, and plead my case
against an ungodly nation;
deliver me from deceitful and unjust men.

contents.verseText: For You are the God of my refuge. Why have You rejected me? Why must I walk in sorrow because of the enemy’s oppression?
contents: For You are the God of my refuge.
Why have You rejected me?
Why must I walk in sorrow
because of the enemy’s oppression?

contents.verseText: Send out Your light and Your truth; let them lead me. Let them bring me to Your holy mountain, and to the place where You dwell.
contents: Send out Your light and Your truth;
let them lead me.
Let them bring me to Your holy mountain,
and to the place where You dwell.

contents.verseText: Then I will go to the altar of God, to God, my greatest joy. I will praise You with the harp, O God, my God.
contents: Then I will go to the altar of God,
to God, my greatest joy.
I will praise You with the harp,
O God, my God.

contents.verseText: Why are you downcast, O my soul? Why the unease within me? Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise Him, my Savior and my God.
contents: Why are you downcast, O my soul?
Why the unease within me?
Put your hope in God, for I will yet praise Him,
my Savior and my God.

d: For the choirmaster. A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of the sons of Korah.

contents.verseText: We have heard with our ears, O God; our fathers have told us the work You did in their days, in the days of old.
contents: We have heard with our ears, O God;
our fathers have told us
the work You did in their days,
in the days of old.

contents.verseText: With Your hand You drove out the nations and planted our fathers there; You crushed the peoples and cast them out.
contents: With Your hand You drove out the nations
and planted our fathers there;
You crushed the peoples
and cast them out.

contents.verseText: For it was not by their sword that they took the land; their arm did not bring them victory. It was by Your right hand, Your arm, and the light of Your face, because You favored them.
contents: For it was not by their sword that they took the land;
their arm did not bring them victory.
It was by Your right hand,
Your arm, and the light of Your face,
because You favored them.

contents.verseText: You are my King, O God, who ordains victories for Jacob.
contents: You are my King, O God,
who ordains victories for Jacob.

contents.verseText: Through You we repel our foes; through Your name we trample our enemies.
contents: Through You we repel our foes;
through Your name we trample our enemies.

contents.verseText: For I do not trust in my bow, nor does my sword save me.
contents: For I do not trust in my bow,
nor does my sword save me.

footnote.ft: Or give me victory; similarly in verse 7

contents.verseText: For You save us from our enemies; You put those who hate us to shame.
contents: For You save us from our enemies;
You put those who hate us to shame.

contents.verseText: In God we have boasted all day long, and Your name we will praise forever. Selah
contents: In God we have boasted all day long,
and Your name we will praise forever.
Selah

contents.verseText: But You have rejected and humbled us; You no longer go forth with our armies.
contents: But You have rejected and humbled us;
You no longer go forth with our armies.

contents.verseText: You have made us retreat from the foe, and those who hate us have plundered us.
contents: You have made us retreat from the foe,
and those who hate us have plundered us.

contents.verseText: You have given us up as sheep to be devoured; You have scattered us among the nations.
contents: You have given us up as sheep to be devoured;
You have scattered us among the nations.

contents.verseText: You sell Your people for nothing; no profit do You gain from their sale.
contents: You sell Your people for nothing;
no profit do You gain from their sale.

contents.verseText: You have made us a reproach to our neighbors, a mockery and derision to those around us.
contents: You have made us a reproach to our neighbors,
a mockery and derision to those around us.

contents.verseText: You have made us a byword among the nations, a laughingstock among the peoples.
contents: You have made us a byword among the nations,
a laughingstock

footnote.ft: Literally a shaking of the head

contents: among the peoples.

contents.verseText: All day long my disgrace is before me, and shame has covered my face,
contents: All day long my disgrace is before me,
and shame has covered my face,

contents.verseText: at the voice of the scorner and reviler, because of the enemy, bent on revenge.
contents: at the voice of the scorner and reviler,
because of the enemy, bent on revenge.

contents.verseText: All this has come upon us, though we have not forgotten You or betrayed Your covenant.
contents: All this has come upon us,
though we have not forgotten You
or betrayed Your covenant.

contents.verseText: Our hearts have not turned back; our steps have not strayed from Your path.
contents: Our hearts have not turned back;
our steps have not strayed from Your path.

contents.verseText: But You have crushed us in the lair of jackals; You have covered us with deepest darkness.
contents: But You have crushed us in the lair of jackals;

footnote.ft: Or serpents or dragons

contents: You have covered us with deepest darkness.

contents.verseText: If we had forgotten the name of our God or spread out our hands to a foreign god,
contents: If we had forgotten the name of our God
or spread out our hands to a foreign god,

contents.verseText: would not God have discovered, since He knows the secrets of the heart?
contents: would not God have discovered,
since He knows the secrets of the heart?

contents.verseText: Yet for Your sake we face death all day long; we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.
contents: Yet for Your sake we face death all day long;
we are considered as sheep to be slaughtered.

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 8:36

contents.verseText: Wake up, O Lord! Why are You sleeping? Arise! Do not reject us forever.
contents: Wake up, O Lord! Why are You sleeping?
Arise! Do not reject us forever.

contents.verseText: Why do You hide Your face and forget our affliction and oppression?
contents: Why do You hide Your face
and forget our affliction and oppression?

contents.verseText: For our soul has sunk to the dust; our bodies cling to the earth.
contents: For our soul has sunk to the dust;
our bodies cling to the earth.

contents.verseText: Rise up; be our help! Redeem us on account of Your loving devotion.
contents: Rise up; be our help!
Redeem us on account of Your loving devotion.

s1: My Heart Is Stirred by a Noble Theme

d: For the choirmaster. To the tune of “The Lilies.” A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of the sons of Korah. A love song.

contents.verseText: My heart is stirred by a noble theme as I recite my verses to the king; my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.
contents: My heart is stirred by a noble theme
as I recite my verses to the king;

footnote.ft: Or King; here and throughout Psalm 45

contents: my tongue is the pen of a skillful writer.

contents.verseText: You are the most handsome of men; grace has anointed your lips, since God has blessed you forever.
contents: You are the most handsome of men;
grace has anointed your lips,
since God has blessed you forever.

contents.verseText: Strap your sword at your side, O mighty warrior; appear in your majesty and splendor.
contents: Strap your sword at your side, O mighty warrior;
appear in your majesty and splendor.

contents.verseText: In your splendor ride forth in victory on behalf of truth and humility and justice; may your right hand show your awesome deeds.
contents: In your splendor ride forth in victory
on behalf of truth and humility and justice;
may your right hand show your awesome deeds.

contents.verseText: Your arrows pierce the hearts of the king’s foes; the nations fall beneath your feet.
contents: Your arrows pierce the hearts of the king’s foes;
the nations fall beneath your feet.

contents.verseText: Your throne, O God, endures forever and ever, and justice is the scepter of Your kingdom.
contents: Your throne, O God, endures forever and ever,
and justice is the scepter of Your kingdom.

contents.verseText: You have loved righteousness and hated wickedness; therefore God, your God, has anointed you above your companions with the oil of joy.
contents: You have loved righteousness
and hated wickedness;
therefore God, your God, has anointed you
above your companions with the oil of joy.

footnote.ft: Cited in Hebrews 1:8–9

contents.verseText: All your garments are fragrant with myrrh and aloes and cassia; from palaces of ivory the harps make you glad.
contents: All your garments are fragrant
with myrrh and aloes and cassia;
from palaces of ivory the harps make you glad.

contents.verseText: The daughters of kings are among your honored women; the queen stands at your right hand, adorned with the gold of Ophir.
contents: The daughters of kings are among your honored women;
the queen stands at your right hand,
adorned with the gold of Ophir.

contents.verseText: Listen, O daughter! Consider and incline your ear: Forget your people and your father’s house,
contents: Listen, O daughter! Consider and incline your ear:
Forget your people and your father’s house,

contents.verseText: and the king will desire your beauty; bow to him, for he is your lord.
contents: and the king will desire your beauty;
bow to him, for he is your lord.

contents.verseText: The Daughter of Tyre will come with a gift; men of wealth will seek your favor.
contents: The Daughter of Tyre will come with a gift;
men of wealth will seek your favor.

contents.verseText: All glorious is the princess in her chamber; her gown is embroidered with gold.
contents: All glorious is the princess in her chamber;
her gown is embroidered with gold.

contents.verseText: In colorful garments she is led to the king; her virgin companions are brought before you.
contents: In colorful garments she is led to the king;
her virgin companions are brought before you.

contents.verseText: They are led in with joy and gladness; they enter the palace of the king.
contents: They are led in with joy and gladness;
they enter the palace of the king.

contents.verseText: Your sons will succeed your fathers; you will make them princes throughout the land.
contents: Your sons will succeed your fathers;
you will make them princes throughout the land.

contents.verseText: I will commemorate your name through all generations; therefore the nations will praise you forever and ever.
contents: I will commemorate your name through all generations;
therefore the nations will praise you forever and ever.

s1: God Is Our Refuge and Strength

d: For the choirmaster. Of the sons of Korah. According to Alamoth.

footnote.ft: Alamoth is probably a musical or liturgical term; here and in 1 Chronicles 15:20.

d: A song.

contents.verseText: God is our refuge and strength, an ever-present help in times of trouble.
contents: God is our refuge and strength,
an ever-present help in times of trouble.

contents.verseText: Therefore we will not fear, though the earth is transformed and the mountains are toppled into the depths of the seas,
contents: Therefore we will not fear,
though the earth is transformed
and the mountains are toppled
into the depths of the seas,

contents.verseText: though their waters roar and foam and the mountains quake in the surge. Selah
contents: though their waters roar and foam
and the mountains quake in the surge.
Selah

contents.verseText: There is a river whose streams delight the city of God, the holy place where the Most High dwells.
contents: There is a river whose streams delight the city of God,
the holy place where the Most High dwells.

contents.verseText: God is within her; she will not be moved. God will help her when morning dawns.
contents: God is within her; she will not be moved.
God will help her when morning dawns.

contents.verseText: Nations rage, kingdoms crumble; the earth melts when He lifts His voice.
contents: Nations rage, kingdoms crumble;
the earth melts when He lifts His voice.

contents.verseText: The LORD of Hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah
contents: The LORD of Hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our fortress.
Selah

contents.verseText: Come, see the works of the LORD, who brings devastation upon the earth.
contents: Come, see the works of the LORD,
who brings devastation upon the earth.

contents.verseText: He makes wars to cease throughout the earth; He breaks the bow and shatters the spear; He burns the shields in the fire.
contents: He makes wars to cease throughout the earth;
He breaks the bow and shatters the spear;
He burns the shields

footnote.ft: Or chariots

contents: in the fire.

contents.verseText: “Be still and know that I am God; I will be exalted among the nations, I will be exalted over the earth.”
contents: “Be still and know that I am God;
I will be exalted among the nations,
I will be exalted over the earth.”

contents.verseText: The LORD of Hosts is with us; the God of Jacob is our fortress. Selah
contents: The LORD of Hosts is with us;
the God of Jacob is our fortress.
Selah

s1: Clap Your Hands, All You Peoples

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.

contents.verseText: Clap your hands, all you peoples; shout unto God with a voice of triumph.
contents: Clap your hands, all you peoples;
shout unto God with a voice of triumph.

contents.verseText: How awesome is the LORD Most High, the great King over all the earth!
contents: How awesome is the LORD Most High,
the great King over all the earth!

contents.verseText: He subdues nations beneath us, and peoples under our feet.
contents: He subdues nations beneath us,
and peoples under our feet.

contents.verseText: He chooses our inheritance for us, the pride of Jacob, whom He loves. Selah
contents: He chooses our inheritance for us,
the pride of Jacob, whom He loves.
Selah

contents.verseText: God has ascended amid shouts of joy, the LORD with the sound of the horn.
contents: God has ascended amid shouts of joy,
the LORD with the sound of the horn.

contents.verseText: Sing praises to God, sing praises; sing praises to our King, sing praises!
contents: Sing praises to God, sing praises;
sing praises to our King, sing praises!

contents.verseText: For God is King of all the earth; sing profound praises to Him.
contents: For God is King of all the earth;
sing profound praises to Him.

footnote.ft: Or sing a Maskil of praise or sing praises with understanding

contents.verseText: God reigns over the nations; God is seated on His holy throne.
contents: God reigns over the nations;
God is seated on His holy throne.

contents.verseText: The nobles of the nations have assembled as the people of the God of Abraham; for the shields of the earth belong to God; He is highly exalted.
contents: The nobles of the nations have assembled
as the people of the God of Abraham;
for the shields of the earth belong to God;
He is highly exalted.

d: A song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.

contents.verseText: Great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised in the city of our God, His holy mountain.
contents: Great is the LORD,
and greatly to be praised
in the city of our God,
His holy mountain.

contents.verseText: Beautiful in loftiness, the joy of all the earth, like the peaks of Zaphon is Mount Zion, the city of the great King.
contents: Beautiful in loftiness,
the joy of all the earth,
like the peaks of Zaphon

footnote.ft: Or in the far north; the most sacred mountain of the Canaanites was Zaphon

contents: is Mount Zion,
the city of the great King.

contents.verseText: God is in her citadels; He has shown Himself to be a fortress.
contents: God is in her citadels;
He has shown Himself to be a fortress.

contents.verseText: For behold, the kings assembled; they all advanced together.
contents: For behold, the kings assembled;
they all advanced together.

contents.verseText: They saw and were astounded; they fled in terror.
contents: They saw and were astounded;
they fled in terror.

contents.verseText: Trembling seized them there, anguish like a woman in labor.
contents: Trembling seized them there,
anguish like a woman in labor.

contents.verseText: With a wind from the east You wrecked the ships of Tarshish.
contents: With a wind from the east
You wrecked the ships of Tarshish.

footnote.ft: Or a fleet of trading ships

contents.verseText: As we have heard, so we have seen in the city of the LORD of Hosts, in the city of our God: God will establish her forever. Selah
contents: As we have heard, so we have seen
in the city of the LORD of Hosts,
in the city of our God:
God will establish her forever.
Selah

contents.verseText: Within Your temple, O God, we contemplate Your loving devotion.
contents: Within Your temple, O God,
we contemplate Your loving devotion.

contents.verseText: Your name, O God, like Your praise, reaches to the ends of the earth; Your right hand is full of righteousness.
contents: Your name, O God, like Your praise,
reaches to the ends of the earth;
Your right hand is full of righteousness.

contents.verseText: Mount Zion is glad, the daughters of Judah rejoice, on account of Your judgments.
contents: Mount Zion is glad,
the daughters

footnote.ft: Or the villages

contents: of Judah rejoice,
on account of Your judgments.

contents.verseText: March around Zion, encircle her, count her towers,
contents: March around Zion, encircle her,
count her towers,

contents.verseText: consider her ramparts, tour her citadels, that you may tell the next generation.
contents: consider her ramparts, tour her citadels,
that you may tell the next generation.

contents.verseText: For this God is our God forever and ever; He will be our guide even till death.
contents: For this God is our God forever and ever;
He will be our guide even till death.

footnote.ft: Or He will guide us beyond death

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.

contents.verseText: Hear this, all you peoples; listen, all inhabitants of the world,
contents: Hear this, all you peoples;
listen, all inhabitants of the world,

contents.verseText: both low and high, rich and poor alike.
contents: both low and high,
rich and poor alike.

contents.verseText: My mouth will impart wisdom, and the meditation of my heart will bring understanding.
contents: My mouth will impart wisdom,
and the meditation of my heart will bring understanding.

contents.verseText: I will incline my ear to a proverb; I will express my riddle with the harp:
contents: I will incline my ear to a proverb;
I will express my riddle with the harp:

contents.verseText: Why should I fear in times of trouble, when wicked usurpers surround me?
contents: Why should I fear in times of trouble,
when wicked usurpers surround me?

contents.verseText: They trust in their wealth and boast in their great riches.
contents: They trust in their wealth
and boast in their great riches.

contents.verseText: No man can possibly redeem his brother or pay his ransom to God.
contents: No man can possibly redeem his brother

footnote.ft: Or redeem another

contents: or pay his ransom to God.

contents.verseText: For the redemption of his soul is costly, and never can payment suffice,
contents: For the redemption of his soul is costly,
and never can payment suffice,

contents.verseText: that he should live on forever and not see decay.
contents: that he should live on forever
and not see decay.

contents.verseText: For it is clear that wise men die, and the foolish and the senseless both perish and leave their wealth to others.
contents: For it is clear that wise men die,
and the foolish and the senseless both perish
