and leave their wealth to others.

contents.verseText: Their graves are their eternal homes—their dwellings for endless generations—even though their lands were their namesakes.
contents: Their graves

footnote.ft: LXX, Syriac, and Aramaic Targum; Hebrew Their inward thoughts

contents: are their eternal homes—
their dwellings for endless generations—
even though their lands were their namesakes.

contents.verseText: But a man, despite his wealth, cannot endure; he is like the beasts that perish.
contents: But a man, despite his wealth, cannot endure;
he is like the beasts that perish.

contents.verseText: This is the fate of the self-confident and their followers who endorse their sayings. Selah
contents: This is the fate of the self-confident

footnote.ft: Or the way of the foolish

contents: and their followers who endorse their sayings.
Selah

contents.verseText: Like sheep they are destined for Sheol. Death will be their shepherd. The upright will rule them in the morning, and their form will decay in Sheol, far from their lofty abode.
contents: Like sheep they are destined for Sheol.
Death will be their shepherd.
The upright will rule them in the morning,
and their form will decay in Sheol,
far from their lofty abode.

contents.verseText: But God will redeem my life from Sheol, for He will surely take me to Himself. Selah
contents: But God will redeem my life from Sheol,
for He will surely take me to Himself.
Selah

contents.verseText: Do not be amazed when a man grows rich, when the splendor of his house increases.
contents: Do not be amazed when a man grows rich,
when the splendor of his house increases.

contents.verseText: For when he dies, he will carry nothing away; his abundance will not follow him down.
contents: For when he dies, he will carry nothing away;
his abundance will not follow him down.

contents.verseText: Though in his lifetime he blesses his soul—and men praise you when you prosper—
contents: Though in his lifetime he blesses his soul—
and men praise you when you prosper—

contents.verseText: he will join the generation of his fathers, who will never see the light of day.
contents: he will join the generation of his fathers,
who will never see the light of day.

contents.verseText: A man who has riches without understanding is like the beasts that perish.
contents: A man who has riches without understanding
is like the beasts that perish.

d: A Psalm of Asaph.

contents.verseText: The Mighty One, God the LORD, speaks and summons the earth from where the sun rises to where it sets.
contents: The Mighty One, God the LORD,
speaks and summons the earth
from where the sun rises to where it sets.

contents.verseText: From Zion, perfect in beauty, God shines forth.
contents: From Zion, perfect in beauty,
God shines forth.

contents.verseText: Our God approaches and will not be silent! Consuming fire precedes Him, and a tempest rages around Him.
contents: Our God approaches and will not be silent!
Consuming fire precedes Him,
and a tempest rages around Him.

contents.verseText: He summons the heavens above, and the earth, that He may judge His people:
contents: He summons the heavens above,
and the earth, that He may judge His people:

contents.verseText: “Gather to Me My saints, who made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”
contents: “Gather to Me My saints,
who made a covenant with Me by sacrifice.”

contents.verseText: And the heavens proclaim His righteousness, for God Himself is Judge. Selah
contents: And the heavens proclaim His righteousness,
for God Himself is Judge.

footnote.ft: Or He is a God of justice

contents: Selah

contents.verseText: “Hear, O My people, and I will speak, O Israel, and I will testify against you: I am God, your God.
contents: “Hear, O My people, and I will speak,
O Israel, and I will testify against you:
I am God, your God.

contents.verseText: I do not rebuke you for your sacrifices, and your burnt offerings are ever before Me.
contents: I do not rebuke you for your sacrifices,
and your burnt offerings are ever before Me.

contents.verseText: I have no need for a bull from your stall or goats from your pens,
contents: I have no need for a bull from your stall
or goats from your pens,

contents.verseText: for every beast of the forest is Mine—the cattle on a thousand hills.
contents: for every beast of the forest is Mine—
the cattle on a thousand hills.

contents.verseText: I know every bird in the mountains, and the creatures of the field are Mine.
contents: I know every bird in the mountains,
and the creatures of the field are Mine.

contents.verseText: If I were hungry, I would not tell you, for the world is Mine, and the fullness thereof.
contents: If I were hungry, I would not tell you,
for the world is Mine, and the fullness thereof.

contents.verseText: Do I eat the flesh of bulls, or drink the blood of goats?
contents: Do I eat the flesh of bulls,
or drink the blood of goats?

contents.verseText: Sacrifice a thank offering to God, and fulfill your vows to the Most High.
contents: Sacrifice a thank offering to God,
and fulfill your vows to the Most High.

contents.verseText: Call upon Me in the day of trouble; I will deliver you, and you will honor Me.”
contents: Call upon Me in the day of trouble;
I will deliver you, and you will honor Me.”

contents.verseText: To the wicked, however, God says, “What right have you to recite My statutes and to bear My covenant on your lips?
contents: To the wicked, however, God says,
“What right have you to recite My statutes
and to bear My covenant on your lips?

contents.verseText: For you hate My instruction and cast My words behind you.
contents: For you hate My instruction
and cast My words behind you.

contents.verseText: When you see a thief, you befriend him, and throw in your lot with adulterers.
contents: When you see a thief, you befriend him,
and throw in your lot with adulterers.

contents.verseText: You unleash your mouth for evil and unharness your tongue for deceit.
contents: You unleash your mouth for evil
and unharness your tongue for deceit.

contents.verseText: You sit and malign your brother; you slander your own mother’s son.
contents: You sit and malign your brother;
you slander your own mother’s son.

contents.verseText: You have done these things, and I kept silent; you thought I was just like you. But now I rebuke you and accuse you to your face.
contents: You have done these things, and I kept silent;
you thought I was

footnote.ft: Or you thought the ‘I AM’ was

contents: just like you.
But now I rebuke you
and accuse you to your face.

footnote.ft: Literally and I set it in order before your eyes

contents.verseText: Now consider this, you who forget God, lest I tear you to pieces, with no one to rescue you:
contents: Now consider this, you who forget God,
lest I tear you to pieces,
with no one to rescue you:

contents.verseText: He who sacrifices a thank offering honors Me, and to him who rights his way, I will show the salvation of God.”
contents: He who sacrifices a thank offering honors Me,
and to him who rights his way,
I will show the salvation of God.”

s1: Create in Me a Clean Heart, O God

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David. When Nathan the prophet came to him after his adultery with Bathsheba.

contents.verseText: Have mercy on me, O God, according to Your loving devotion; according to Your great compassion, blot out my transgressions.
contents: Have mercy on me,

footnote.ft: Or Be gracious to me

contents: O God,
according to Your loving devotion;
according to Your great compassion,
blot out my transgressions.

contents.verseText: Wash me clean of my iniquity and cleanse me from my sin.
contents: Wash me clean of my iniquity
and cleanse me from my sin.

contents.verseText: For I know my transgressions, and my sin is always before me.
contents: For I know my transgressions,
and my sin is always before me.

contents.verseText: Against You, You only, have I sinned and done what is evil in Your sight, so that You may be proved right when You speak and blameless when You judge.
contents: Against You, You only, have I sinned
and done what is evil in Your sight,
so that You may be proved right when You speak
and blameless when You judge.

footnote.ft: LXX and victorious when You judge; cited in Romans 3:4

contents.verseText: Surely I was brought forth in iniquity; I was sinful when my mother conceived me.
contents: Surely I was brought forth in iniquity;
I was sinful when my mother conceived me.

contents.verseText: Surely You desire truth in the inmost being; You teach me wisdom in the inmost place.
contents: Surely You desire truth in the inmost being;
You teach me wisdom in the inmost place.

contents.verseText: Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean; wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.
contents: Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean;
wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

contents.verseText: Let me hear joy and gladness; let the bones You have crushed rejoice.
contents: Let me hear joy and gladness;
let the bones You have crushed rejoice.

contents.verseText: Hide Your face from my sins and blot out all my iniquities.
contents: Hide Your face from my sins
and blot out all my iniquities.

contents.verseText: Create in me a clean heart, O God, and renew a right spirit within me.
contents: Create in me a clean heart, O God,
and renew a right spirit within me.

contents.verseText: Cast me not away from Your presence; take not Your Holy Spirit from me.
contents: Cast me not away from Your presence;
take not Your Holy Spirit from me.

contents.verseText: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation, and sustain me with a willing spirit.
contents: Restore to me the joy of Your salvation,
and sustain me with a willing spirit.

contents.verseText: Then I will teach transgressors Your ways, and sinners will return to You.
contents: Then I will teach transgressors Your ways,
and sinners will return to You.

contents.verseText: Deliver me from bloodguilt, O God, the God of my salvation, and my tongue will sing of Your righteousness.
contents: Deliver me from bloodguilt, O God,
the God of my salvation,
and my tongue will sing of Your righteousness.

contents.verseText: O Lord, open my lips, and my mouth will declare Your praise.
contents: O Lord, open my lips,
and my mouth will declare Your praise.

contents.verseText: For You do not delight in sacrifice, or I would bring it; You take no pleasure in burnt offerings.
contents: For You do not delight in sacrifice, or I would bring it;
You take no pleasure in burnt offerings.

contents.verseText: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit; a broken and a contrite heart, O God, You will not despise.
contents: The sacrifices of God are a broken spirit;
a broken and a contrite heart,
O God, You will not despise.

contents.verseText: In Your good pleasure, cause Zion to prosper; build up the walls of Jerusalem.
contents: In Your good pleasure, cause Zion to prosper;
build up the walls of Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Then You will delight in righteous sacrifices, in whole burnt offerings; then bulls will be offered on Your altar.
contents: Then You will delight in righteous sacrifices,
in whole burnt offerings;
then bulls will be offered on Your altar.

s1: Why Do You Boast of Evil?

d: For the choirmaster. A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of David. After Doeg the Edomite went to Saul and told him, “David has gone to the house of Ahimelech.”

contents.verseText: Why do you boast of evil, O mighty man? The loving devotion of God endures all day long.
contents: Why do you boast of evil, O mighty man?
The loving devotion of God endures all day long.

contents.verseText: Your tongue devises destruction like a sharpened razor, O worker of deceit.
contents: Your tongue devises destruction
like a sharpened razor,
O worker of deceit.

contents.verseText: You love evil more than good, falsehood more than speaking truth. Selah
contents: You love evil more than good,
falsehood more than speaking truth.
Selah

contents.verseText: You love every word that devours, O deceitful tongue.
contents: You love every word that devours,
O deceitful tongue.

contents.verseText: Surely God will bring you down to everlasting ruin; He will snatch you up and tear you away from your tent; He will uproot you from the land of the living. Selah
contents: Surely God will bring you down to everlasting ruin;
He will snatch you up and tear you away from your tent;
He will uproot you from the land of the living.
Selah

contents.verseText: The righteous will see and fear; they will mock the evildoer, saying,
contents: The righteous will see and fear;
they will mock the evildoer, saying,

contents.verseText: “Look at the man who did not make God his refuge, but trusted in the abundance of his wealth and strengthened himself by destruction.”
contents: “Look at the man
who did not make God his refuge,
but trusted in the abundance of his wealth
and strengthened himself by destruction.”

contents.verseText: But I am like an olive tree flourishing in the house of God; I trust in the loving devotion of God forever and ever.
contents: But I am like an olive tree
flourishing in the house of God;
I trust in the loving devotion of God
forever and ever.

contents.verseText: I will praise You forever, because You have done it. I will wait on Your name—for it is good—in the presence of Your saints.
contents: I will praise You forever,
because You have done it.
I will wait on Your name—
for it is good—
in the presence of Your saints.

s1: The Fool Says There Is No God

d: For the choirmaster. According to Mahalath.

footnote.ft: Mahalath is probably a musical or liturgical term; see also Psalm 88:1.

d: A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of David.

contents.verseText: The fool says in his heart, “There is no God.” They are corrupt; their ways are vile. There is no one who does good.
contents: The fool says in his heart,
“There is no God.”
They are corrupt; their ways are vile.
There is no one who does good.

contents.verseText: God looks down from heaven upon the sons of men to see if any understand, if any seek God.
contents: God looks down from heaven
upon the sons of men
to see if any understand,
if any seek God.

contents.verseText: All have turned away, they have together become corrupt; there is no one who does good, not even one.
contents: All have turned away,
they have together become corrupt;

footnote.ft: LXX worthless

contents: there is no one who does good,
not even one.

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 3:10–12

contents.verseText: Will the workers of iniquity never learn? They devour my people like bread; they refuse to call upon God.
contents: Will the workers of iniquity never learn?
They devour my people like bread;
they refuse to call upon God.

contents.verseText: There they are, overwhelmed with dread, where there was nothing to fear. For God has scattered the bones of those who besieged you. You put them to shame, for God has despised them.
contents: There they are, overwhelmed with dread,
where there was nothing to fear.
For God has scattered the bones
of those who besieged you.
You put them to shame,
for God has despised them.

contents.verseText: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come from Zion! When God restores His captive people, let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad!
contents: Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come from Zion!
When God restores His captive people,

footnote.ft: Or the fortunes of His people

contents: let Jacob rejoice, let Israel be glad!

d: For the choirmaster. With stringed instruments. A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of David. When the Ziphites went to Saul and said, “Is David not hiding among us?”

contents.verseText: Save me, O God, by Your name, and vindicate me by Your might!
contents: Save me, O God, by Your name,
and vindicate me by Your might!

contents.verseText: Hear my prayer, O God; listen to the words of my mouth.
contents: Hear my prayer, O God;
listen to the words of my mouth.

contents.verseText: For strangers rise up against me, and ruthless men seek my life—men with no regard for God. Selah
contents: For strangers rise up against me,
and ruthless men seek my life—
men with no regard for God.
Selah

contents.verseText: Surely God is my helper; the Lord is the sustainer of my soul.
contents: Surely God is my helper;
the Lord is the sustainer of my soul.

contents.verseText: He will reward my enemies with evil. In Your faithfulness, destroy them.
contents: He will reward my enemies with evil.
In Your faithfulness, destroy them.

contents.verseText: Freely I will sacrifice to You; I will praise Your name, O LORD, for it is good.
contents: Freely I will sacrifice to You;
I will praise Your name, O LORD, for it is good.

contents.verseText: For He has delivered me from every trouble, and my eyes have stared down my foes.
contents: For He has delivered me from every trouble,
and my eyes have stared down my foes.

s1: Cast Your Burden upon the LORD

d: For the choirmaster. With stringed instruments. A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of David.

contents.verseText: Listen to my prayer, O God, and do not ignore my plea.
contents: Listen to my prayer, O God,
and do not ignore my plea.

contents.verseText: Attend to me and answer me. I am restless in my complaint, and distraught
contents: Attend to me and answer me.
I am restless in my complaint,
and distraught

contents.verseText: at the voice of the enemy, at the pressure of the wicked. For they release disaster upon me and revile me in their anger.
contents: at the voice of the enemy,
at the pressure of the wicked.
For they release disaster upon me
and revile me in their anger.

contents.verseText: My heart murmurs within me, and the terrors of death assail me.
contents: My heart murmurs within me,
and the terrors of death assail me.

contents.verseText: Fear and trembling grip me, and horror has overwhelmed me.
contents: Fear and trembling grip me,
and horror has overwhelmed me.

contents.verseText: I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and find rest.
contents: I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove!
I would fly away and find rest.

contents.verseText: How far away I would flee! In the wilderness I would remain. Selah
contents: How far away I would flee!
In the wilderness I would remain.
Selah

contents.verseText: I would hurry to my shelter, far from this raging tempest.”
contents: I would hurry to my shelter,
far from this raging tempest.”

contents.verseText: O Lord, confuse and confound their speech, for I see violence and strife in the city.
contents: O Lord, confuse and confound their speech,
for I see violence and strife in the city.

contents.verseText: Day and night they encircle the walls, while malice and trouble lie within.
contents: Day and night they encircle the walls,
while malice and trouble lie within.

contents.verseText: Destruction is within; oppression and deceit never leave the streets.
contents: Destruction is within;
oppression and deceit never leave the streets.

contents.verseText: For it is not an enemy who insults me; that I could endure. It is not a foe who rises against me; from him I could hide.
contents: For it is not an enemy who insults me;
that I could endure.
It is not a foe who rises against me;
from him I could hide.

contents.verseText: But it is you, a man like myself, my companion and close friend.
contents: But it is you, a man like myself,
my companion and close friend.

contents.verseText: We shared sweet fellowship together; we walked with the crowd into the house of God.
contents: We shared sweet fellowship together;
we walked with the crowd into the house of God.

contents.verseText: Let death seize them by surprise; let them go down to Sheol alive, for evil is with them in their homes.
contents: Let death seize them by surprise;
let them go down to Sheol alive,
for evil is with them in their homes.

contents.verseText: But I call to God, and the LORD saves me.
contents: But I call to God,
and the LORD saves me.

contents.verseText: Morning, noon, and night, I cry out in distress, and He hears my voice.
contents: Morning, noon, and night, I cry out in distress,
and He hears my voice.

contents.verseText: He redeems my soul in peace from the battle waged against me, even though many oppose me.
contents: He redeems my soul in peace
from the battle waged against me,
even though many oppose me.

contents.verseText: God will hear and humiliate them—the One enthroned for the ages—Selah because they do not change and they have no fear of God.
contents: God will hear and humiliate them—
the One enthroned for the ages—
Selah
because they do not change
and they have no fear of God.

contents.verseText: My companion attacks his friends; he violates his covenant.
contents: My companion attacks his friends;
he violates his covenant.

contents.verseText: His speech is smooth as butter, but war is in his heart. His words are softer than oil, yet they are swords unsheathed.
contents: His speech is smooth as butter,
but war is in his heart.
His words are softer than oil,
yet they are swords unsheathed.

contents.verseText: Cast your burden upon the LORD and He will sustain you; He will never let the righteous be shaken.
contents: Cast your burden upon the LORD
and He will sustain you;
He will never let the righteous be shaken.

contents.verseText: But You, O God, will bring them down to the Pit of destruction; men of bloodshed and deceit will not live out half their days. But I will trust in You.
contents: But You, O God, will bring them down
to the Pit of destruction;
men of bloodshed and deceit
will not live out half their days.
But I will trust in You.

s1: Be Merciful to Me, O God

d: For the choirmaster. To the tune of “A Dove on Distant Oaks.” A Miktam

footnote.ft: Miktam is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 16 and 56–60.

d: of David, when the Philistines seized him in Gath.

contents.verseText: Be merciful to me, O God, for men are hounding me; all day they press their attack.
contents: Be merciful to me, O God,
for men are hounding me;
all day they press their attack.

contents.verseText: My enemies pursue me all day long, for many proudly assail me.
contents: My enemies pursue me all day long,
for many proudly assail me.

contents.verseText: When I am afraid, I put my trust in You.
contents: When I am afraid,
I put my trust in You.

contents.verseText: In God, whose word I praise—in God I trust. I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
contents: In God, whose word I praise—
in God I trust.
I will not be afraid.
What can man do to me?

contents.verseText: All day long they twist my words; all their thoughts are on my demise.
contents: All day long they twist my words;
all their thoughts are on my demise.

contents.verseText: They conspire, they lurk, they watch my steps while they wait to take my life.
contents: They conspire, they lurk,
they watch my steps
while they wait to take my life.

contents.verseText: In spite of such sin, will they escape? In Your anger, O God, cast down the nations.
contents: In spite of such sin, will they escape?

footnote.ft: Or do not let them escape; MT does not include do not.

contents: In Your anger, O God, cast down the nations.

contents.verseText: You have taken account of my wanderings. Put my tears in Your bottle—are they not in Your book?
contents: You have taken account of my wanderings.

footnote.ft: Or sorrows

contents: Put my tears in Your bottle—
are they not in Your book?

contents.verseText: Then my enemies will retreat on the day I cry for help. By this I will know that God is on my side.
contents: Then my enemies will retreat
on the day I cry for help.
By this I will know that God is on my side.

contents.verseText: In God, whose word I praise, in the LORD, whose word I praise,
contents: In God, whose word I praise,
in the LORD, whose word I praise,

contents.verseText: in God I trust; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
contents: in God I trust; I will not be afraid.
What can man do to me?

contents.verseText: Your vows are upon me, O God; I will render thank offerings to You.
contents: Your vows are upon me, O God;
I will render thank offerings to You.

contents.verseText: For You have delivered my soul from death, and my feet from stumbling, that I may walk before God in the light of life.
contents: For You have delivered my soul from death,
and my feet from stumbling,
that I may walk before God
in the light of life.

s1: In You My Soul Takes Refuge

d: For the choirmaster. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A Miktam

footnote.ft: Miktam is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 16 and 56–60.

d: of David, when he fled from Saul into the cave.

contents.verseText: Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy, for in You my soul takes refuge. In the shadow of Your wings I will take shelter until the danger has passed.
contents: Have mercy on me, O God, have mercy,
for in You my soul takes refuge.
In the shadow of Your wings I will take shelter
until the danger has passed.

contents.verseText: I cry out to God Most High, to God who fulfills His purpose for me.
contents: I cry out to God Most High,

footnote.ft: Hebrew Elohim-Elyon

contents: to God who fulfills His purpose for me.

contents.verseText: He reaches down from heaven and saves me; He rebukes those who trample me. Selah God sends forth His loving devotion and His truth.
contents: He reaches down from heaven and saves me;
He rebukes those who trample me.
Selah
God sends forth
His loving devotion and His truth.

contents.verseText: My soul is among the lions; I lie down with ravenous beasts—with men whose teeth are spears and arrows, whose tongues are sharp swords.
contents: My soul is among the lions;
I lie down with ravenous beasts—
with men whose teeth are spears and arrows,
whose tongues are sharp swords.

contents.verseText: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; may Your glory cover all the earth.
contents: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;
may Your glory cover all the earth.

contents.verseText: They spread a net for my feet; my soul was despondent. They dug a pit before me, but they themselves have fallen into it! Selah
contents: They spread a net for my feet;
my soul was despondent.
They dug a pit before me,
but they themselves have fallen into it!
Selah

contents.verseText: My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast. I will sing and make music.
contents: My heart is steadfast, O God, my heart is steadfast.
I will sing and make music.

contents.verseText: Awake, my glory! Awake, O harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.
contents: Awake, my glory!

footnote.ft: Or Awake, my soul!

contents: Awake, O harp and lyre!
I will awaken the dawn.

contents.verseText: I will praise You, O Lord, among the nations; I will sing Your praises among the peoples.
contents: I will praise You, O Lord, among the nations;
I will sing Your praises among the peoples.

contents.verseText: For Your loving devotion reaches to the heavens, and Your faithfulness to the clouds.
contents: For Your loving devotion reaches to the heavens,
and Your faithfulness to the clouds.

contents.verseText: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; may Your glory cover all the earth.
contents: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;
may Your glory cover all the earth.

d: For the choirmaster. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A Miktam

footnote.ft: Miktam is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 16 and 56–60.

d: of David.

contents.verseText: Do you indeed speak justly, O rulers? Do you judge uprightly, O sons of men?
contents: Do you indeed speak justly, O rulers?
Do you judge uprightly, O sons of men?

contents.verseText: No, in your hearts you devise injustice; with your hands you mete out violence on the earth.
contents: No, in your hearts you devise injustice;
with your hands you mete out violence on the earth.

contents.verseText: The wicked are estranged from the womb; the liars go astray from birth.
contents: The wicked are estranged from the womb;
the liars go astray from birth.

contents.verseText: Their venom is like the venom of a snake, like a cobra that shuts its ears,
contents: Their venom is like the venom of a snake,
like a cobra that shuts its ears,

contents.verseText: refusing to hear the tune of the charmer who skillfully weaves his spell.
contents: refusing to hear the tune of the charmer
who skillfully weaves his spell.

contents.verseText: O God, shatter their teeth in their mouths; O LORD, tear out the fangs of the lions.
contents: O God, shatter their teeth in their mouths;
O LORD, tear out the fangs of the lions.

contents.verseText: May they vanish like water that runs off; when they draw the bow, may their arrows be blunted.
contents: May they vanish
like water that runs off;
when they draw the bow,
may their arrows be blunted.

footnote.ft: Or when they are trodden down, may they wither like grass

contents.verseText: Like a slug that dissolves in its slime, like a woman’s stillborn child, may they never see the sun.
contents: Like a slug that dissolves in its slime,
like a woman’s stillborn child,
may they never see the sun.

contents.verseText: Before your pots can feel the burning thorns—whether green or dry—He will sweep them away.
contents: Before your pots can feel the burning thorns—
whether green or dry—
He will sweep them away.

contents.verseText: The righteous will rejoice when they see they are avenged; they will wash their feet in the blood of the wicked.
contents: The righteous will rejoice
when they see they are avenged;
they will wash their feet
in the blood of the wicked.

contents.verseText: Then men will say, “There is surely a reward for the righteous! There is surely a God who judges the earth!”
contents: Then men will say,
“There is surely a reward for the righteous!
There is surely a God who judges the earth!”

d: For the choirmaster. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A Miktam

footnote.ft: Miktam is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 16 and 56–60.

d: of David, when Saul sent men to watch David’s house in order to kill him.

contents.verseText: Deliver me from my enemies, O my God; protect me from those who rise against me.
contents: Deliver me from my enemies, O my God;
protect me from those who rise against me.

contents.verseText: Deliver me from workers of iniquity, and save me from men of bloodshed.
contents: Deliver me from workers of iniquity,
and save me from men of bloodshed.

contents.verseText: See how they lie in wait for me. Fierce men conspire against me for no transgression or sin of my own, O LORD.
contents: See how they lie in wait for me.
Fierce men conspire against me
for no transgression or sin of my own, O LORD.

contents.verseText: For no fault of my own, they move swiftly to attack me. Arise to help me, and take notice.
contents: For no fault of my own,
they move swiftly to attack me.
Arise to help me, and take notice.

contents.verseText: O LORD God of Hosts, the God of Israel, rouse Yourself to punish all the nations; show no mercy to the wicked traitors. Selah
contents: O LORD God of Hosts, the God of Israel,
rouse Yourself to punish all the nations;
show no mercy to the wicked traitors.
Selah

contents.verseText: They return in the evening, snarling like dogs and prowling around the city.
contents: They return in the evening, snarling like dogs
and prowling around the city.

contents.verseText: See what they spew from their mouths—sharp words from their lips: “For who can hear us?”
contents: See what they spew from their mouths—
sharp words from their lips:
“For who can hear us?”

contents.verseText: But You, O LORD, laugh at them; You scoff at all the nations.
contents: But You, O LORD, laugh at them;
You scoff at all the nations.

contents.verseText: I will keep watch for You, O my strength, because You, O God, are my fortress.
contents: I will keep watch for You, O my strength,
because You, O God, are my fortress.

contents.verseText: My God of loving devotion will come to meet me; God will let me stare down my foes.
contents: My God of loving devotion will come to meet me;
God will let me stare down my foes.

contents.verseText: Do not kill them, or my people will forget. Scatter them by Your power, and bring them down, O Lord, our shield.
contents: Do not kill them,
or my people will forget.
Scatter them by Your power,
and bring them down,
O Lord, our shield.

contents.verseText: By the sins of their mouths and the words of their lips, let them be trapped in their pride, in the curses and lies they utter.
contents: By the sins of their mouths
and the words of their lips,
let them be trapped in their pride,
in the curses and lies they utter.

contents.verseText: Consume them in wrath; consume them till they are no more, so it may be known to the ends of the earth that God rules over Jacob. Selah
contents: Consume them in wrath;
consume them till they are no more,
so it may be known to the ends of the earth
that God rules over Jacob.
Selah

contents.verseText: They return in the evening, snarling like dogs and prowling around the city.
contents: They return in the evening,
snarling like dogs
and prowling around the city.

contents.verseText: They scavenge for food, and growl if they are not satisfied.
contents: They scavenge for food,
and growl if they are not satisfied.

contents.verseText: But I will sing of Your strength and proclaim Your loving devotion in the morning. For You are my fortress, my refuge in times of trouble.
contents: But I will sing of Your strength
and proclaim Your loving devotion in the morning.
For You are my fortress,
my refuge in times of trouble.

contents.verseText: To You, O my strength, I sing praises, for You, O God, are my fortress, my God of loving devotion.
contents: To You, O my strength, I sing praises,
for You, O God, are my fortress,
my God of loving devotion.

d: For the choirmaster. To the tune of “The Lily of the Covenant.” A Miktam

footnote.ft: Miktam is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 16 and 56–60.

d: of David for instruction. When he fought Aram-naharaim

footnote.ft: That is, Mesopotamia; Aram-naharaim means Aram of the two rivers, likely the region between the Euphrates and Balih Rivers in northwestern Mesopotamia.

d: and Aram-zobah,

footnote.ft: That is, the land northeast of Damascus

d: and Joab returned and struck down 12,000 Edomites in the Valley of Salt.

contents.verseText: You have rejected us, O God; You have broken us; You have been angry; restore us!
contents: You have rejected us, O God;
You have broken us;
You have been angry;
restore us!

contents.verseText: You have shaken the land and torn it open. Heal its fractures, for it is quaking.
contents: You have shaken the land
and torn it open.
Heal its fractures,
for it is quaking.

contents.verseText: You have shown Your people hardship; we are staggered from the wine You made us drink.
contents: You have shown Your people hardship;
we are staggered from the wine You made us drink.

contents.verseText: You have raised a banner for those who fear You, that they may flee the bow. Selah
contents: You have raised a banner for those who fear You,
that they may flee the bow.

footnote.ft: Or that it may be displayed because of truth

contents: Selah

contents.verseText: Respond and save us with Your right hand, that Your beloved may be delivered.
contents: Respond and save us with Your right hand,
that Your beloved may be delivered.

contents.verseText: God has spoken from His sanctuary: “I will triumph! I will parcel out Shechem and apportion the Valley of Succoth.
contents: God has spoken from His sanctuary:

footnote.ft: Or in His holiness

contents: “I will triumph!
I will parcel out Shechem
and apportion the Valley of Succoth.

contents.verseText: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine; Ephraim is My helmet, Judah is My scepter.
contents: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine;
Ephraim is My helmet, Judah is My scepter.

contents.verseText: Moab is My washbasin; upon Edom I toss My sandal; over Philistia I shout in triumph.”
contents: Moab is My washbasin;
upon Edom I toss My sandal;
over Philistia I shout in triumph.”

contents.verseText: Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
contents: Who will bring me to the fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?

contents.verseText: Have You not rejected us, O God? Will You no longer march out, O God, with our armies?
contents: Have You not rejected us, O God?
Will You no longer march out, O God, with our armies?

contents.verseText: Give us aid against the enemy, for the help of man is worthless.
contents: Give us aid against the enemy,
for the help of man is worthless.

contents.verseText: With God we will perform with valor, and He will trample our enemies.
contents: With God we will perform with valor,
and He will trample our enemies.

d: For the choirmaster. With stringed instruments. Of David.

contents.verseText: Hear my cry, O God; attend to my prayer.
contents: Hear my cry, O God;
attend to my prayer.

contents.verseText: From the ends of the earth I call out to You whenever my heart is faint. Lead me to the rock that is higher than I.
contents: From the ends of the earth I call out to You
whenever my heart is faint.
Lead me to the rock
that is higher than I.

contents.verseText: For You have been my refuge, a tower of strength against the enemy.
contents: For You have been my refuge,
a tower of strength against the enemy.

contents.verseText: Let me dwell in Your tent forever and take refuge in the shelter of Your wings. Selah
contents: Let me dwell in Your tent forever
and take refuge in the shelter of Your wings.
Selah

contents.verseText: For You have heard my vows, O God; You have given me the inheritance reserved for those who fear Your name.
contents: For You have heard my vows, O God;
You have given me the inheritance
reserved for those who fear Your name.

contents.verseText: Increase the days of the king’s life; may his years span many generations.
contents: Increase the days of the king’s life;
may his years span many generations.

contents.verseText: May he sit enthroned in God’s presence forever; appoint Your loving devotion and Your faithfulness to guard him.
contents: May he sit enthroned in God’s presence forever;
appoint Your loving devotion
and Your faithfulness to guard him.

contents.verseText: Then I will ever sing praise to Your name and fulfill my vows day by day.
contents: Then I will ever sing praise to Your name
and fulfill my vows day by day.

d: For the choirmaster. According to Jeduthun. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: In God alone my soul finds rest; my salvation comes from Him.
contents: In God alone my soul finds rest;
my salvation comes from Him.

contents.verseText: He alone is my rock and my salvation. He is my fortress; I will never be shaken.
contents: He alone is my rock and my salvation.
He is my fortress;
I will never be shaken.

contents.verseText: How long will you threaten a man? Will all of you throw him down like a leaning wall or a tottering fence?
contents: How long will you threaten a man?
Will all of you throw him down
like a leaning wall
or a tottering fence?

contents.verseText: They fully intend to cast him down from his lofty perch; they delight in lies; with their mouths they bless, but inwardly they curse. Selah
contents: They fully intend to cast him down from his lofty perch;
they delight in lies;
with their mouths they bless,
but inwardly they curse.
Selah

contents.verseText: Rest in God alone, O my soul, for my hope comes from Him.
contents: Rest in God alone, O my soul,
for my hope comes from Him.

contents.verseText: He alone is my rock and my salvation; He is my fortress; I will not be shaken.
contents: He alone is my rock and my salvation;
He is my fortress; I will not be shaken.

contents.verseText: My salvation and my honor rest on God, my strong rock; my refuge is in God.
contents: My salvation and my honor rest on God, my strong rock;
my refuge is in God.

contents.verseText: Trust in Him at all times, O people; pour out your hearts before Him. God is our refuge. Selah
contents: Trust in Him at all times, O people;
pour out your hearts before Him.
God is our refuge.
Selah

contents.verseText: Lowborn men are but a vapor, the exalted but a lie. Weighed on the scale, they go up; together they are but a vapor.
contents: Lowborn men are but a vapor,
the exalted but a lie.
Weighed on the scale, they go up;
together they are but a vapor.

contents.verseText: Place no trust in extortion, or false hope in stolen goods. If your riches increase, do not set your heart upon them.
contents: Place no trust in extortion,
or false hope in stolen goods.
If your riches increase,
do not set your heart upon them.

contents.verseText: God has spoken once; I have heard this twice: that power belongs to God,
contents: God has spoken once;
I have heard this twice:
that power belongs to God,

contents.verseText: and loving devotion to You, O Lord. For You will repay each man according to his deeds.
contents: and loving devotion to You, O Lord.
For You will repay each man
according to his deeds.

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 2:6

d: A Psalm of David, when he was in the Wilderness of Judah.

contents.verseText: O God, You are my God. Earnestly I seek You; my soul thirsts for You. My body yearns for You in a dry and weary land without water.
contents: O God, You are my God.
Earnestly I seek You;
my soul thirsts for You.
My body yearns for You
in a dry and weary land without water.

contents.verseText: So I have seen You in the sanctuary and beheld Your power and glory.
contents: So I have seen You in the sanctuary
and beheld Your power and glory.

contents.verseText: Because Your loving devotion is better than life, my lips will glorify You.
contents: Because Your loving devotion is better than life,
my lips will glorify You.

contents.verseText: So I will bless You as long as I live; in Your name I will lift my hands.
contents: So I will bless You as long as I live;
in Your name I will lift my hands.

contents.verseText: My soul is satisfied as with the richest of foods; with joyful lips my mouth will praise You.
contents: My soul is satisfied as with the richest of foods;
with joyful lips my mouth will praise You.

contents.verseText: When I remember You on my bed, I think of You through the watches of the night.
contents: When I remember You on my bed,
I think of You through the watches of the night.

contents.verseText: For You are my help; I will sing for joy in the shadow of Your wings.
contents: For You are my help;
I will sing for joy in the shadow of Your wings.

contents.verseText: My soul clings to You; Your right hand upholds me.
contents: My soul clings to You;
Your right hand upholds me.

contents.verseText: But those who seek my life to destroy it will go into the depths of the earth.
contents: But those who seek my life to destroy it
will go into the depths of the earth.

contents.verseText: They will fall to the power of the sword; they will become a portion for foxes.
contents: They will fall to the power of the sword;
they will become a portion for foxes.

contents.verseText: But the king will rejoice in God; all who swear by Him will exult, for the mouths of liars will be shut.
contents: But the king will rejoice in God;
all who swear by Him will exult,
for the mouths of liars will be shut.

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: Hear, O God, my voice of complaint; preserve my life from dread of the enemy.
contents: Hear, O God, my voice of complaint;
preserve my life from dread of the enemy.

contents.verseText: Hide me from the scheming of the wicked, from the mob of workers of iniquity,
contents: Hide me from the scheming of the wicked,
from the mob of workers of iniquity,

contents.verseText: who sharpen their tongues like swords and aim their bitter words like arrows,
contents: who sharpen their tongues like swords
and aim their bitter words like arrows,

contents.verseText: ambushing the innocent in seclusion, shooting suddenly, without fear.
contents: ambushing the innocent in seclusion,
shooting suddenly, without fear.

contents.verseText: They hold fast to their evil purpose; they speak of hiding their snares. “Who will see them?” they say.
contents: They hold fast to their evil purpose;
they speak of hiding their snares.
“Who will see them?” they say.

contents.verseText: They devise injustice and say, “We have perfected a secret plan.” For the inner man and the heart are mysterious.
contents: They devise injustice and say,
“We have perfected a secret plan.”
For the inner man and the heart are mysterious.

contents.verseText: But God will shoot them with arrows; suddenly they will be wounded.
contents: But God will shoot them with arrows;
suddenly they will be wounded.

contents.verseText: They will be made to stumble, their own tongues turned against them. All who see will shake their heads.
contents: They will be made to stumble,
their own tongues turned against them.
All who see will shake their heads.

contents.verseText: Then all mankind will fear and proclaim the work of God; so they will ponder what He has done.
contents: Then all mankind will fear
and proclaim the work of God;
so they will ponder what He has done.

contents.verseText: Let the righteous rejoice in the LORD and take refuge in Him; let all the upright in heart exult.
contents: Let the righteous rejoice in the LORD
and take refuge in Him;
let all the upright in heart exult.

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David. A song.

contents.verseText: Praise awaits You, O God, in Zion; to You our vows will be fulfilled.
contents: Praise awaits You, O God, in Zion;
to You our vows will be fulfilled.

contents.verseText: O You who listen to prayer, all people will come to You.
contents: O You who listen to prayer,
all people will come to You.

contents.verseText: When iniquities prevail against me, You atone for our transgressions.
contents: When iniquities prevail against me,
You atone for our transgressions.

contents.verseText: Blessed is the one You choose and bring near to dwell in Your courts! We are filled with the goodness of Your house, the holiness of Your temple.
contents: Blessed is the one You choose
and bring near to dwell in Your courts!
We are filled with the goodness of Your house,
the holiness of Your temple.

contents.verseText: With awesome deeds of righteousness You answer us, O God of our salvation, the hope of all the ends of the earth and of the farthest seas.
contents: With awesome deeds of righteousness You answer us,
O God of our salvation,
the hope of all the ends of the earth
and of the farthest seas.

contents.verseText: You formed the mountains by Your power, having girded Yourself with might.
contents: You formed the mountains by Your power,
having girded Yourself with might.

contents.verseText: You stilled the roaring of the seas, the pounding of their waves, and the tumult of the nations.
contents: You stilled the roaring of the seas,
the pounding of their waves,
and the tumult of the nations.

contents.verseText: Those who live far away fear Your wonders; You make the dawn and sunset shout for joy.
contents: Those who live far away fear Your wonders;
You make the dawn and sunset shout for joy.

footnote.ft: Or where morning dawns and evening fades You call forth songs of joy.

contents.verseText: You attend to the earth and water it; with abundance You enrich it. The streams of God are full of water, for You prepare our grain by providing for the earth.
contents: You attend to the earth and water it;

footnote.ft: Or and make it overflow

contents: with abundance You enrich it.
The streams of God are full of water,
for You prepare our grain
by providing for the earth.

footnote.ft: Or to provide the people with grain, for so You have ordained it

contents.verseText: You soak its furrows and level its ridges; You soften it with showers and bless its growth.
contents: You soak its furrows and level its ridges;
You soften it with showers and bless its growth.

contents.verseText: You crown the year with Your bounty, and Your paths overflow with plenty.
contents: You crown the year with Your bounty,
and Your paths overflow with plenty.

contents.verseText: The pastures of the wilderness overflow; the hills are robed with joy.
contents: The pastures of the wilderness overflow;
the hills are robed with joy.

contents.verseText: The pastures are clothed with flocks, and the valleys are decked with grain. They shout in triumph; indeed, they sing.
contents: The pastures are clothed with flocks,
and the valleys are decked with grain.
They shout in triumph;
indeed, they sing.

d: For the choirmaster. A song. A Psalm.

contents.verseText: Make a joyful noise to God, all the earth!
contents: Make a joyful noise to God,
all the earth!

contents.verseText: Sing the glory of His name; make His praise glorious.
contents: Sing the glory of His name;
make His praise glorious.

contents.verseText: Say to God, “How awesome are Your deeds! So great is Your power that Your enemies cower before You.
contents: Say to God, “How awesome are Your deeds!
So great is Your power
that Your enemies cower before You.

contents.verseText: All the earth bows down to You; they sing praise to You; they sing praise to Your name.” Selah
contents: All the earth bows down to You;
they sing praise to You;
they sing praise to Your name.”
Selah

contents.verseText: Come and see the works of God; how awesome are His deeds toward mankind.
contents: Come and see the works of God;
how awesome are His deeds toward mankind.

contents.verseText: He turned the sea into dry land; they passed through the waters on foot; there we rejoiced in Him.
contents: He turned the sea into dry land;
they passed through the waters on foot;
there we rejoiced in Him.

contents.verseText: He rules forever by His power; His eyes watch the nations. Do not let the rebellious exalt themselves. Selah
contents: He rules forever by His power;
His eyes watch the nations.
Do not let the rebellious exalt themselves.
Selah

contents.verseText: Bless our God, O peoples; let the sound of His praise be heard.
contents: Bless our God, O peoples;
let the sound of His praise be heard.

contents.verseText: He preserves our lives and keeps our feet from slipping.
contents: He preserves our lives
and keeps our feet from slipping.

contents.verseText: For You, O God, have tested us; You have refined us like silver.
contents: For You, O God, have tested us;
You have refined us like silver.

contents.verseText: You led us into the net; You laid burdens on our backs.
contents: You led us into the net;
You laid burdens on our backs.

contents.verseText: You let men ride over our heads; we went through fire and water, but You brought us into abundance.
contents: You let men ride over our heads;
we went through fire and water,
but You brought us into abundance.

contents.verseText: I will enter Your house with burnt offerings; I will fulfill my vows to You—
contents: I will enter Your house with burnt offerings;
I will fulfill my vows to You—

contents.verseText: the vows that my lips promised and my mouth spoke in my distress.
contents: the vows that my lips promised
and my mouth spoke in my distress.

contents.verseText: I will offer You fatlings as burnt offerings, with the fragrant smoke of rams; I will offer bulls and goats. Selah
contents: I will offer You fatlings as burnt offerings,
with the fragrant smoke of rams;
I will offer bulls and goats.
Selah

contents.verseText: Come and listen, all you who fear God, and I will declare what He has done for me.
contents: Come and listen, all you who fear God,
and I will declare what He has done for me.

contents.verseText: I cried out to Him with my mouth and praised Him with my tongue.
contents: I cried out to Him with my mouth
and praised Him with my tongue.

footnote.ft: Or and His praise was on my tongue

contents.verseText: If I had cherished iniquity in my heart, the Lord would not have listened.
contents: If I had cherished iniquity in my heart,
the Lord would not have listened.

contents.verseText: But God has surely heard; He has attended to the sound of my prayer.
contents: But God has surely heard;
He has attended to the sound of my prayer.

contents.verseText: Blessed be God, who has not rejected my prayer or withheld from me His loving devotion!
contents: Blessed be God, who has not rejected my prayer
or withheld from me His loving devotion!

s1: May God Cause His Face to Shine upon Us

d: For the choirmaster. With stringed instruments. A Psalm. A song.

contents.verseText: May God be gracious to us and bless us, and cause His face to shine upon us, Selah
contents: May God be gracious to us and bless us,
and cause His face to shine upon us,
Selah

contents.verseText: that Your ways may be known on earth, Your salvation among all nations.
contents: that Your ways may be known on earth,
Your salvation among all nations.

contents.verseText: Let the peoples praise You, O God; let all the peoples praise You.
contents: Let the peoples praise You, O God;
let all the peoples praise You.

contents.verseText: Let the nations be glad and sing for joy, for You judge the peoples justly and lead the nations of the earth. Selah
contents: Let the nations be glad and sing for joy,
for You judge the peoples justly
and lead the nations of the earth.
Selah

contents.verseText: Let the peoples praise You, O God; let all the peoples praise You.
contents: Let the peoples praise You, O God;
let all the peoples praise You.

contents.verseText: The earth has yielded its harvest; God, our God, blesses us.
contents: The earth has yielded its harvest;
God, our God, blesses us.

contents.verseText: God blesses us, that all the ends of the earth shall fear Him.
contents: God blesses us,
that all the ends of the earth shall fear Him.

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David. A song.

contents.verseText: God arises. His enemies are scattered, and those who hate Him flee His presence.
contents: God arises. His enemies are scattered,
and those who hate Him flee His presence.

contents.verseText: As smoke is blown away, You will drive them out; as wax melts before the fire, the wicked will perish in the presence of God.
contents: As smoke is blown away,
You will drive them out;
as wax melts before the fire,
the wicked will perish in the presence of God.

contents.verseText: But the righteous will be glad and rejoice before God; they will celebrate with joy.
contents: But the righteous will be glad
and rejoice before God;
they will celebrate with joy.

contents.verseText: Sing to God! Sing praises to His name. Exalt Him who rides on the clouds—His name is the LORD—and rejoice before Him.
contents: Sing to God!
Sing praises to His name.
Exalt Him who rides on the clouds

footnote.ft: Or rides through the deserts

contents: His name is the LORD—
and rejoice before Him.

contents.verseText: A father of the fatherless, and a defender of the widows, is God in His holy habitation.
contents: A father of the fatherless,
and a defender of the widows,
is God in His holy habitation.

contents.verseText: God settles the lonely in families; He leads the prisoners out to prosperity, but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.
contents: God settles the lonely in families;
He leads the prisoners out to prosperity,
but the rebellious dwell in a sun-scorched land.

contents.verseText: O God, when You went out before Your people, when You marched through the wasteland, Selah
contents: O God, when You went out before Your people,
when You marched through the wasteland,
Selah

contents.verseText: the earth shook and the heavens poured down rain before God, the One on Sinai, before God, the God of Israel.
contents: the earth shook and the heavens poured down rain
before God, the One on Sinai,
before God, the God of Israel.

contents.verseText: You sent abundant rain, O God; You refreshed Your weary inheritance.
contents: You sent abundant rain, O God;
You refreshed Your weary inheritance.

contents.verseText: Your flock settled therein; O God, from Your bounty You provided for the poor.
contents: Your flock settled therein;
O God, from Your bounty You provided for the poor.

contents.verseText: The Lord gives the command; a great company of women proclaim it:
contents: The Lord gives the command;
a great company of women proclaim it:

contents.verseText: “Kings and their armies flee in haste; she who waits at home divides the plunder.
contents: “Kings and their armies flee in haste;
she who waits at home divides the plunder.

contents.verseText: Though you lie down among the sheepfolds, the wings of the dove are covered with silver, and her feathers with shimmering gold.”
contents: Though you lie down among the sheepfolds,
the wings of the dove are covered with silver,
and her feathers with shimmering gold.”

contents.verseText: When the Almighty scattered the kings in the land, it was like the snow falling on Zalmon.
contents: When the Almighty

footnote.ft: Hebrew Shaddai

contents: scattered the kings in the land,
it was like the snow falling on Zalmon.

contents.verseText: A mountain of God is Mount Bashan; a mountain of many peaks is Mount Bashan.
contents: A mountain of God is Mount Bashan;
a mountain of many peaks is Mount Bashan.

contents.verseText: Why do you gaze in envy, O mountains of many peaks? This is the mountain God chose for His dwelling, where the LORD will surely dwell forever.
contents: Why do you gaze in envy, O mountains of many peaks?
This is the mountain God chose for His dwelling,
where the LORD will surely dwell forever.

contents.verseText: The chariots of God are tens of thousands—thousands of thousands are they; the Lord is in His sanctuary as He was at Sinai.
contents: The chariots of God are tens of thousands—
thousands of thousands are they;
the Lord is in His sanctuary
as He was at Sinai.

footnote.ft: Or the Lord has come from Sinai in His holiness

contents.verseText: You have ascended on high; You have led captives away. You have received gifts from men, even from the rebellious, that the LORD God may dwell there.
contents: You have ascended on high;
You have led captives away.
You have received gifts from men,

footnote.ft: Cited in Ephesians 4:8

contents: even from the rebellious,
that the LORD God may dwell there.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the Lord, who daily bears our burden, the God of our salvation. Selah
contents: Blessed be the Lord,
who daily bears our burden,
the God of our salvation.
Selah

contents.verseText: Our God is a God of deliverance; the Lord GOD is our rescuer from death.
contents: Our God is a God of deliverance;
the Lord GOD is our rescuer from death.

contents.verseText: Surely God will crush the heads of His enemies, the hairy crowns of those who persist in guilty ways.
contents: Surely God will crush the heads of His enemies,
the hairy crowns of those who persist in guilty ways.

contents.verseText: The Lord said, “I will retrieve them from Bashan, I will bring them up from the depths of the sea,
contents: The Lord said, “I will retrieve them from Bashan,
I will bring them up from the depths of the sea,

contents.verseText: that your foot may be dipped in the blood of your foes—the tongues of your dogs in the same.”
contents: that your foot may be dipped
in the blood of your foes—
the tongues of your dogs in the same.”

contents.verseText: They have seen Your procession, O God—the march of my God and King into the sanctuary.
contents: They have seen Your procession, O God—
the march of my God and King into the sanctuary.

contents.verseText: The singers lead the way, the musicians follow after, among the maidens playing tambourines.
contents: The singers lead the way,
the musicians follow after,
among the maidens playing tambourines.

contents.verseText: Bless God in the great congregation; bless the LORD from the fountain of Israel.
contents: Bless God in the great congregation;
bless the LORD from the fountain of Israel.

contents.verseText: There is Benjamin, the youngest, ruling them, the princes of Judah in their company, the princes of Zebulun and of Naphtali.
contents: There is Benjamin, the youngest, ruling them,
the princes of Judah in their company,
the princes of Zebulun and of Naphtali.

contents.verseText: Summon Your power, O God; show Your strength, O God, which You have exerted on our behalf.
contents: Summon Your power, O God;

footnote.ft: LXX and Syriac; most Hebrew manuscripts Your God has summoned your power

contents: show Your strength, O God,
which You have exerted on our behalf.

contents.verseText: Because of Your temple at Jerusalem kings will bring You gifts.
contents: Because of Your temple at Jerusalem
kings will bring You gifts.

contents.verseText: Rebuke the beast in the reeds, the herd of bulls among the calves of the nations, until it submits, bringing bars of silver. Scatter the nations who delight in war.
contents: Rebuke the beast in the reeds,
the herd of bulls among the calves of the nations,
until it submits, bringing bars of silver.
Scatter the nations who delight in war.

contents.verseText: Envoys will arrive from Egypt; Cush will stretch out her hands to God.
contents: Envoys will arrive from Egypt;
Cush

footnote.ft: That is, the upper Nile region

contents: will stretch out her hands to God.

contents.verseText: Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth; sing praises to the Lord—Selah
contents: Sing to God, O kingdoms of the earth;
sing praises to the Lord—
Selah

contents.verseText: to Him who rides upon the highest heavens of old; behold, His mighty voice resounds.
contents: to Him who rides upon the highest heavens of old;
behold, His mighty voice resounds.

contents.verseText: Ascribe the power to God, whose majesty is over Israel, whose strength is in the skies.
contents: Ascribe the power to God,
whose majesty is over Israel,
whose strength is in the skies.

contents.verseText: O God, You are awesome in Your sanctuary; the God of Israel Himself gives strength and power to His people. Blessed be God!
contents: O God, You are awesome in Your sanctuary;
the God of Israel Himself
gives strength and power to His people.
Blessed be God!

s1: The Waters Are up to My Neck

d: For the choirmaster. To the tune of “Lilies.” Of David.

contents.verseText: Save me, O God, for the waters are up to my neck.
contents: Save me, O God,
for the waters are up to my neck.

contents.verseText: I have sunk into the miry depths, where there is no footing; I have drifted into deep waters, where the flood engulfs me.
contents: I have sunk into the miry depths,
where there is no footing;
I have drifted into deep waters,
where the flood engulfs me.

contents.verseText: I am weary from my crying; my throat is parched. My eyes fail, looking for my God.
contents: I am weary from my crying;
my throat is parched.
My eyes fail,
looking for my God.

contents.verseText: Those who hate me without cause outnumber the hairs of my head; many are those who would destroy me—my enemies for no reason. Though I did not steal, I must repay.
contents: Those who hate me without cause
outnumber the hairs of my head;
many are those who would destroy me—
my enemies for no reason.

footnote.ft: See John 15:25

contents: Though I did not steal,
I must repay.

contents.verseText: You know my folly, O God, and my guilt is not hidden from You.
contents: You know my folly, O God,
and my guilt is not hidden from You.

contents.verseText: May those who hope in You not be ashamed through me, O Lord GOD of Hosts; may those who seek You not be dishonored through me, O God of Israel.
contents: May those who hope in You not be ashamed through me,
O Lord GOD of Hosts;
may those who seek You not be dishonored through me,
O God of Israel.

contents.verseText: For I have endured scorn for Your sake, and shame has covered my face.
contents: For I have endured scorn for Your sake,
and shame has covered my face.

contents.verseText: I have become a stranger to my brothers and a foreigner to my mother’s sons,
contents: I have become a stranger to my brothers
and a foreigner to my mother’s sons,

contents.verseText: because zeal for Your house has consumed me, and the insults of those who insult You have fallen on me.
contents: because zeal for Your house has consumed me,

footnote.ft: Cited in John 2:17

contents: and the insults of those who insult You have fallen on me.

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 15:3

contents.verseText: I wept and fasted, but it brought me reproach.
contents: I wept and fasted,
but it brought me reproach.

contents.verseText: I made sackcloth my clothing, and I was sport to them.
contents: I made sackcloth my clothing,
and I was sport to them.

contents.verseText: Those who sit at the gate mock me, and I am the song of drunkards.
contents: Those who sit at the gate mock me,
and I am the song of drunkards.

contents.verseText: But my prayer to You, O LORD, is for a time of favor. In Your abundant loving devotion, O God, answer me with Your sure salvation.
contents: But my prayer to You, O LORD,
is for a time of favor.
In Your abundant loving devotion, O God,
answer me with Your sure salvation.

contents.verseText: Rescue me from the mire and do not let me sink; deliver me from my foes and out of the deep waters.
contents: Rescue me from the mire
and do not let me sink;
deliver me from my foes
and out of the deep waters.

contents.verseText: Do not let the floods engulf me or the depths swallow me up; let not the Pit close its mouth over me.
contents: Do not let the floods engulf me
or the depths swallow me up;
let not the Pit close its mouth over me.

contents.verseText: Answer me, O LORD, for Your loving devotion is good; turn to me in keeping with Your great compassion.
contents: Answer me, O LORD,
for Your loving devotion is good;
turn to me in keeping with Your great compassion.

contents.verseText: Hide not Your face from Your servant, for I am in distress. Answer me quickly!
contents: Hide not Your face from Your servant,
for I am in distress.
Answer me quickly!

contents.verseText: Draw near to my soul and redeem me; ransom me because of my foes.
contents: Draw near to my soul and redeem me;
ransom me because of my foes.

contents.verseText: You know my reproach, my shame and disgrace. All my adversaries are before You.
contents: You know my reproach, my shame and disgrace.
All my adversaries are before You.

contents.verseText: Insults have broken my heart, and I am in despair. I looked for sympathy, but there was none, for comforters, but I found no one.
contents: Insults have broken my heart,
and I am in despair.
I looked for sympathy, but there was none,
for comforters, but I found no one.

contents.verseText: They poisoned my food with gall and gave me vinegar to quench my thirst.
contents: They poisoned my food with gall
and gave me vinegar to quench my thirst.

contents.verseText: May their table become a snare; may it be a retribution and a trap.
contents: May their table become a snare;
may it be a retribution and a trap.

footnote.ft: A slight revocalization of the Hebrew (see also LXX, Syriac, and Vulgate); literally may their prosperity be a trap; cited in Romans 11:9

contents.verseText: May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see, and their backs be bent forever.
contents: May their eyes be darkened so they cannot see,
and their backs be bent forever.

footnote.ft: LXX; Hebrew and may their loins tremble continually; cited in Romans 11:10

contents.verseText: Pour out Your wrath upon them, and let Your burning anger overtake them.
contents: Pour out Your wrath upon them,
and let Your burning anger overtake them.

contents.verseText: May their place be deserted; let there be no one to dwell in their tents.
contents: May their place be deserted;
let there be no one to dwell in their tents.

footnote.ft: Cited in Acts 1:20

contents.verseText: For they persecute the one You struck and recount the pain of those You wounded.
contents: For they persecute the one You struck
and recount the pain of those You wounded.

contents.verseText: Add iniquity to their iniquity; let them not share in Your righteousness.
contents: Add iniquity to their iniquity;
let them not share in Your righteousness.

contents.verseText: May they be blotted out of the Book of Life and not listed with the righteous.
contents: May they be blotted out of the Book of Life
and not listed with the righteous.

contents.verseText: But I am in pain and distress; let Your salvation protect me, O God.
contents: But I am in pain and distress;
let Your salvation protect me, O God.

contents.verseText: I will praise God’s name in song and exalt Him with thanksgiving.
contents: I will praise God’s name in song
and exalt Him with thanksgiving.

contents.verseText: And this will please the LORD more than an ox, more than a bull with horns and hooves.
contents: And this will please the LORD more than an ox,
more than a bull with horns and hooves.

contents.verseText: The humble will see and rejoice. You who seek God, let your hearts be revived!
contents: The humble will see and rejoice.
You who seek God, let your hearts be revived!

contents.verseText: For the LORD listens to the needy and does not despise His captive people.
contents: For the LORD listens to the needy
and does not despise His captive people.

contents.verseText: Let heaven and earth praise Him, the seas and everything that moves in them.
contents: Let heaven and earth praise Him,
the seas and everything that moves in them.

contents.verseText: For God will save Zion and rebuild the cities of Judah, that they may dwell there and possess it.
contents: For God will save Zion
and rebuild the cities of Judah,
that they may dwell there and possess it.

contents.verseText: The descendants of His servants will inherit it, and those who love His name will settle in it.
contents: The descendants of His servants will inherit it,
and those who love His name will settle in it.

s1: Hurry, O LORD, to Help Me!

d: For the choirmaster. Of David. To bring remembrance.

contents.verseText: Make haste, O God, to deliver me! Hurry, O LORD, to help me!
contents: Make haste, O God, to deliver me!
Hurry, O LORD, to help me!

contents.verseText: May those who seek my life be ashamed and confounded; may those who wish me harm be repelled and humiliated.
contents: May those who seek my life
be ashamed and confounded;
may those who wish me harm
be repelled and humiliated.

contents.verseText: May those who say, “Aha, aha!” retreat because of their shame.
contents: May those who say, “Aha, aha!”
retreat because of their shame.

contents.verseText: May all who seek You rejoice and be glad in You; may those who love Your salvation always say, “Let God be magnified!”
contents: May all who seek You
rejoice and be glad in You;
may those who love Your salvation always say,
“Let God be magnified!”

contents.verseText: But I am poor and needy; hurry to me, O God. You are my help and my deliverer; O LORD, do not delay.
contents: But I am poor and needy;
hurry to me, O God.
You are my help and my deliverer;
O LORD, do not delay.

contents.verseText: In You, O LORD, I have taken refuge; let me never be put to shame.
contents: In You, O LORD, I have taken refuge;
let me never be put to shame.

contents.verseText: In Your justice, rescue and deliver me; incline Your ear and save me.
contents: In Your justice, rescue and deliver me;
incline Your ear and save me.

contents.verseText: Be my rock of refuge, where I can always go. Give the command to save me, for You are my rock and my fortress.
contents: Be my rock of refuge,
where I can always go.
Give the command to save me,
for You are my rock and my fortress.

contents.verseText: Deliver me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked, from the grasp of the unjust and ruthless.
contents: Deliver me, O my God, from the hand of the wicked,
from the grasp of the unjust and ruthless.

contents.verseText: For You are my hope, O Lord GOD, my confidence from my youth.
contents: For You are my hope, O Lord GOD,
my confidence from my youth.

contents.verseText: I have leaned on You since birth; You pulled me from my mother’s womb. My praise is always for You.
contents: I have leaned on You since birth;
You pulled me from my mother’s womb.
My praise is always for You.

contents.verseText: I have become a portent to many, but You are my strong refuge.
contents: I have become a portent to many,
but You are my strong refuge.

contents.verseText: My mouth is filled with Your praise and with Your splendor all day long.
contents: My mouth is filled with Your praise
and with Your splendor all day long.

contents.verseText: Do not discard me in my old age; do not forsake me when my strength fails.
contents: Do not discard me in my old age;
do not forsake me when my strength fails.

contents.verseText: For my enemies speak against me, and those who lie in wait for my life conspire,
contents: For my enemies speak against me,
and those who lie in wait for my life conspire,

contents.verseText: saying, “God has forsaken him; pursue him and seize him, for there is no one to rescue him.”
contents: saying, “God has forsaken him;
pursue him and seize him,
for there is no one to rescue him.”

contents.verseText: Be not far from me, O God. Hurry, O my God, to help me.
contents: Be not far from me, O God.
Hurry, O my God, to help me.

contents.verseText: May the accusers of my soul be ashamed and consumed; may those who seek my harm be covered with scorn and disgrace.
contents: May the accusers of my soul
be ashamed and consumed;
may those who seek my harm
be covered with scorn and disgrace.

contents.verseText: But I will always hope and will praise You more and more.
contents: But I will always hope
and will praise You more and more.

contents.verseText: My mouth will declare Your righteousness and Your salvation all day long, though I cannot know their full measure.
contents: My mouth will declare Your righteousness
and Your salvation all day long,
though I cannot know their full measure.

contents.verseText: I will enter in the strength of the Lord GOD; I will proclaim Your righteousness—Yours alone.
contents: I will enter in the strength of the Lord GOD;
I will proclaim Your righteousness—Yours alone.

contents.verseText: O God, You have taught me from my youth, and to this day I proclaim Your marvelous deeds.
contents: O God, You have taught me from my youth,
and to this day I proclaim Your marvelous deeds.

contents.verseText: Even when I am old and gray, do not forsake me, O God, until I proclaim Your power to the next generation, Your might to all who are to come.
contents: Even when I am old and gray,
do not forsake me, O God,
until I proclaim Your power to the next generation,
Your might to all who are to come.

contents.verseText: Your righteousness reaches to the heavens, O God, You who have done great things. Who, O God, is like You?
contents: Your righteousness reaches to the heavens, O God,
You who have done great things.
Who, O God, is like You?

contents.verseText: Though You have shown me many troubles and misfortunes, You will revive me once again. Even from the depths of the earth You will bring me back up.
contents: Though You have shown me many troubles and misfortunes,
You will revive me once again.
Even from the depths of the earth
You will bring me back up.

contents.verseText: You will increase my honor and comfort me once again.
contents: You will increase my honor
and comfort me once again.

contents.verseText: So I will praise You with the harp for Your faithfulness, O my God; I will sing praise to You with the lyre, O Holy One of Israel.
contents: So I will praise You with the harp
for Your faithfulness, O my God;
I will sing praise to You with the lyre,
O Holy One of Israel.

contents.verseText: When I sing praise to You my lips will shout for joy, along with my soul, which You have redeemed.
contents: When I sing praise to You
my lips will shout for joy,
along with my soul,
which You have redeemed.

contents.verseText: My tongue will indeed proclaim Your righteousness all day long, for those who seek my harm are disgraced and confounded.
contents: My tongue will indeed proclaim
Your righteousness all day long,
for those who seek my harm
are disgraced and confounded.

s1: Endow the King with Your Justice

d: Of Solomon.

contents.verseText: Endow the king with Your justice, O God, and the son of the king with Your righteousness.
contents: Endow the king with Your justice, O God,
and the son of the king with Your righteousness.

contents.verseText: May he judge Your people with righteousness and Your afflicted with justice.
contents: May he judge Your people with righteousness
and Your afflicted with justice.

contents.verseText: May the mountains bring peace to the people, and the hills bring righteousness.
contents: May the mountains bring peace to the people,
and the hills bring righteousness.

contents.verseText: May he vindicate the afflicted among the people; may he save the children of the needy and crush the oppressor.
contents: May he vindicate the afflicted among the people;
may he save the children of the needy
and crush the oppressor.

contents.verseText: May they fear him as long as the sun shines, as long as the moon remains, through all generations.
contents: May they fear him

footnote.ft: LXX He shall endure

contents: as long as the sun shines,
as long as the moon remains,
through all generations.

contents.verseText: May he be like rain that falls on freshly cut grass, like spring showers that water the earth.
contents: May he be like rain that falls on freshly cut grass,
like spring showers that water the earth.

contents.verseText: May the righteous flourish in his days and prosperity abound, until the moon is no more.
contents: May the righteous flourish in his days
and prosperity abound,
until the moon is no more.

contents.verseText: May he rule from sea to sea, and from the Euphrates to the ends of the earth.
contents: May he rule from sea to sea,
and from the Euphrates

footnote.ft: Hebrew the River

contents: to the ends of the earth.

contents.verseText: May the nomads bow before him, and his enemies lick the dust.
contents: May the nomads bow before him,
and his enemies lick the dust.

contents.verseText: May the kings of Tarshish and distant shores bring tribute; may the kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.
contents: May the kings of Tarshish and distant shores bring tribute;
may the kings of Sheba and Seba offer gifts.

contents.verseText: May all kings bow down to him and all nations serve him.
contents: May all kings bow down to him
and all nations serve him.

contents.verseText: For he will deliver the needy who cry out and the afflicted who have no helper.
contents: For he will deliver the needy who cry out
and the afflicted who have no helper.

contents.verseText: He will take pity on the poor and needy and save the lives of the oppressed.
contents: He will take pity on the poor and needy
and save the lives of the oppressed.

contents.verseText: He will redeem them from oppression and violence, for their blood is precious in his sight.
contents: He will redeem them from oppression and violence,
for their blood is precious in his sight.

contents.verseText: Long may he live! May gold from Sheba be given him. May people ever pray for him; may they bless him all day long.
contents: Long may he live!
