May gold from Sheba be given him.
May people ever pray for him;
may they bless him all day long.

contents.verseText: May there be an abundance of grain in the land; may it sway atop the hills. May its fruit trees flourish like the forests of Lebanon, and its people like the grass of the field.
contents: May there be an abundance of grain in the land;
may it sway atop the hills.
May its fruit trees flourish like the forests of Lebanon,
and its people like the grass of the field.

contents.verseText: May his name endure forever; may his name continue as long as the sun shines. In him may all nations be blessed; may they call him blessed.
contents: May his name endure forever;
may his name continue

footnote.ft: Or increase

contents: as long as the sun shines.
In him may all nations be blessed;
may they call him blessed.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel, who alone does marvelous deeds.
contents: Blessed be the LORD God, the God of Israel,
who alone does marvelous deeds.

contents.verseText: And blessed be His glorious name forever; may all the earth be filled with His glory. Amen and amen.
contents: And blessed be His glorious name forever;
may all the earth be filled with His glory.
Amen and amen.

contents.verseText: Thus conclude the prayers of David son of Jesse.
contents: Thus conclude the prayers of David son of Jesse.

s1: Surely God Is Good to Israel

d: A Psalm of Asaph.

contents.verseText: Surely God is good to Israel, to those who are pure in heart.
contents: Surely God is good to Israel,
to those who are pure in heart.

contents.verseText: But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled; my steps had nearly slipped.
contents: But as for me, my feet had almost stumbled;
my steps had nearly slipped.

contents.verseText: For I envied the arrogant when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.
contents: For I envied the arrogant
when I saw the prosperity of the wicked.

contents.verseText: They have no struggle in their death; their bodies are well-fed.
contents: They have no struggle in their death;
their bodies are well-fed.

contents.verseText: They are free of the burdens others carry; they are not afflicted like other men.
contents: They are free of the burdens others carry;
they are not afflicted like other men.

contents.verseText: Therefore pride is their necklace; a garment of violence covers them.
contents: Therefore pride is their necklace;
a garment of violence covers them.

contents.verseText: From their prosperity proceeds iniquity; the imaginations of their hearts run wild.
contents: From their prosperity proceeds iniquity;

footnote.ft: Literally Their eye bulges with fatness; Syriac From their callous heart proceeds iniquity

contents: the imaginations of their hearts run wild.

contents.verseText: They mock and speak with malice; with arrogance they threaten oppression.
contents: They mock and speak with malice;
with arrogance they threaten oppression.

contents.verseText: They set their mouths against the heavens, and their tongues strut across the earth.
contents: They set their mouths against the heavens,
and their tongues strut across the earth.

contents.verseText: So their people return to this place and drink up waters in abundance.
contents: So their people

footnote.ft: Or His people

contents: return to this place
and drink up waters in abundance.

contents.verseText: The wicked say, “How can God know? Does the Most High have knowledge?”
contents: The wicked say, “How can God know?
Does the Most High have knowledge?”

contents.verseText: Behold, these are the wicked—always carefree as they increase their wealth.
contents: Behold, these are the wicked—
always carefree as they increase their wealth.

contents.verseText: Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure; in innocence I have washed my hands.
contents: Surely in vain I have kept my heart pure;
in innocence I have washed my hands.

contents.verseText: For I am afflicted all day long and punished every morning.
contents: For I am afflicted all day long
and punished every morning.

contents.verseText: If I had said, “I will speak this way,” then I would have betrayed Your children.
contents: If I had said, “I will speak this way,”
then I would have betrayed Your children.

contents.verseText: When I tried to understand all this, it was troublesome in my sight
contents: When I tried to understand all this,
it was troublesome in my sight

contents.verseText: until I entered God’s sanctuary; then I discerned their end.
contents: until I entered God’s sanctuary;
then I discerned their end.

contents.verseText: Surely You set them on slick ground; You cast them down into ruin.
contents: Surely You set them on slick ground;
You cast them down into ruin.

contents.verseText: How suddenly they are laid waste, completely swept away by terrors!
contents: How suddenly they are laid waste,
completely swept away by terrors!

contents.verseText: Like one waking from a dream, so You, O Lord, awaken and despise their form.
contents: Like one waking from a dream,
so You, O Lord, awaken and despise their form.

contents.verseText: When my heart was grieved and I was pierced within,
contents: When my heart was grieved
and I was pierced within,

contents.verseText: I was senseless and ignorant; I was a brute beast before You.
contents: I was senseless and ignorant;
I was a brute beast before You.

contents.verseText: Yet I am always with You; You hold my right hand.
contents: Yet I am always with You;
You hold my right hand.

contents.verseText: You guide me with Your counsel, and later receive me in glory.
contents: You guide me with Your counsel,
and later receive me in glory.

contents.verseText: Whom have I in heaven but You? And on earth I desire no one besides You.
contents: Whom have I in heaven but You?
And on earth I desire no one besides You.

contents.verseText: My flesh and my heart may fail, but God is the strength of my heart and my portion forever.
contents: My flesh and my heart may fail,
but God is the strength

footnote.ft: Hebrew rock

contents: of my heart
and my portion forever.

contents.verseText: Those far from You will surely perish; You destroy all who are unfaithful to You.
contents: Those far from You will surely perish;
You destroy all who are unfaithful to You.

contents.verseText: But as for me, it is good to draw near to God. I have made the Lord GOD my refuge, that I may proclaim all Your works.
contents: But as for me, it is good to draw near to God.
I have made the Lord GOD my refuge,
that I may proclaim all Your works.

s1: Why Have You Rejected Us Forever?

d: A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of Asaph.

contents.verseText: Why have You rejected us forever, O God? Why does Your anger smolder against the sheep of Your pasture?
contents: Why have You rejected us forever, O God?
Why does Your anger smolder
against the sheep of Your pasture?

contents.verseText: Remember Your congregation, which You purchased long ago and redeemed as the tribe of Your inheritance—Mount Zion where You dwell.
contents: Remember Your congregation,
which You purchased long ago
and redeemed as the tribe of Your inheritance—
Mount Zion where You dwell.

contents.verseText: Turn Your steps to the everlasting ruins, to everything in the sanctuary the enemy has destroyed.
contents: Turn Your steps to the everlasting ruins,
to everything in the sanctuary the enemy has destroyed.

contents.verseText: Your foes have roared within Your meeting place; they have unfurled their banners as signs,
contents: Your foes have roared within Your meeting place;
they have unfurled their banners as signs,

contents.verseText: like men wielding axes in a thicket of trees
contents: like men wielding axes in a thicket of trees

contents.verseText: and smashing all the carvings with hatchets and picks.
contents: and smashing all the carvings with hatchets and picks.

contents.verseText: They have burned Your sanctuary to the ground; they have defiled the dwelling place of Your Name.
contents: They have burned Your sanctuary to the ground;
they have defiled the dwelling place of Your Name.

contents.verseText: They said in their hearts, “We will crush them completely.” They burned down every place where God met us in the land.
contents: They said in their hearts,
“We will crush them completely.”
They burned down every place
where God met us in the land.

contents.verseText: There are no signs for us to see. There is no longer any prophet. And none of us knows how long this will last.
contents: There are no signs for us to see.
There is no longer any prophet.
And none of us knows how long this will last.

contents.verseText: How long, O God, will the enemy taunt You? Will the foe revile Your name forever?
contents: How long, O God, will the enemy taunt You?
Will the foe revile Your name forever?

contents.verseText: Why do You withdraw Your strong right hand? Stretch it out to destroy them!
contents: Why do You withdraw Your strong right hand?
Stretch it out to destroy them!

footnote.ft: Literally From the midst of Your bosom destroy them! or From the midst of Your bosom remove it!

contents.verseText: Yet God is my King from ancient times, working salvation on the earth.
contents: Yet God is my King from ancient times,
working salvation on the earth.

contents.verseText: You divided the sea by Your strength; You smashed the heads of the dragons of the sea;
contents: You divided the sea by Your strength;
You smashed the heads of the dragons of the sea;

contents.verseText: You crushed the heads of Leviathan; You fed him to the creatures of the desert.
contents: You crushed the heads of Leviathan;
You fed him to the creatures of the desert.

contents.verseText: You broke open the fountain and the flood; You dried up the ever-flowing rivers.
contents: You broke open the fountain and the flood;
You dried up the ever-flowing rivers.

contents.verseText: The day is Yours, and also the night; You established the moon and the sun.
contents: The day is Yours, and also the night;
You established the moon

footnote.ft: Literally the light

contents: and the sun.

contents.verseText: You set all the boundaries of the earth; You made the summer and winter.
contents: You set all the boundaries of the earth;
You made the summer and winter.

contents.verseText: Remember how the enemy has mocked You, O LORD, how a foolish people has spurned Your name.
contents: Remember how the enemy has mocked You, O LORD,
how a foolish people has spurned Your name.

contents.verseText: Do not deliver the soul of Your dove to beasts; do not forget the lives of Your afflicted forever.
contents: Do not deliver the soul of Your dove to beasts;
do not forget the lives of Your afflicted forever.

contents.verseText: Consider Your covenant, for haunts of violence fill the dark places of the land.
contents: Consider Your covenant,
for haunts of violence fill the dark places of the land.

contents.verseText: Do not let the oppressed retreat in shame; may the poor and needy praise Your name.
contents: Do not let the oppressed retreat in shame;
may the poor and needy praise Your name.

contents.verseText: Rise up, O God; defend Your cause! Remember how the fool mocks You all day long.
contents: Rise up, O God; defend Your cause!
Remember how the fool mocks You all day long.

contents.verseText: Do not disregard the clamor of Your adversaries, the uproar of Your enemies that ascends continually.
contents: Do not disregard the clamor of Your adversaries,
the uproar of Your enemies that ascends continually.

d: For the choirmaster: To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” A Psalm of Asaph. A song.

contents.verseText: We give thanks to You, O God; we give thanks, for Your Name is near. The people declare Your wondrous works.
contents: We give thanks to You, O God;
we give thanks, for Your Name is near.
The people declare Your wondrous works.

contents.verseText: “When I choose a time, I will judge fairly.
contents: “When I choose a time,
I will judge fairly.

contents.verseText: When the earth and all its dwellers quake, it is I who bear up its pillars. Selah
contents: When the earth and all its dwellers quake,
it is I who bear up its pillars.
Selah

contents.verseText: I say to the proud, ‘Do not boast,’ and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horn.
contents: I say to the proud, ‘Do not boast,’
and to the wicked, ‘Do not lift up your horn.

contents.verseText: Do not lift up your horn against heaven or speak with an outstretched neck.’”
contents: Do not lift up your horn against heaven
or speak with an outstretched neck.’”

contents.verseText: For exaltation comes neither from east nor west, nor out of the desert,
contents: For exaltation comes neither from east nor west,
nor out of the desert,

contents.verseText: but it is God who judges; He brings down one and exalts another.
contents: but it is God who judges;
He brings down one and exalts another.

contents.verseText: For a cup is in the hand of the LORD, full of foaming wine mixed with spices. He pours from His cup, and all the wicked of the earth drink it down to the dregs.
contents: For a cup is in the hand of the LORD,
full of foaming wine mixed with spices.
He pours from His cup,
and all the wicked of the earth
drink it down to the dregs.

contents.verseText: But I will proclaim Him forever; I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.
contents: But I will proclaim Him

footnote.ft: Or proclaim it

contents: forever;
I will sing praise to the God of Jacob.

contents.verseText: “All the horns of the wicked I will cut off, but the horns of the righteous will be exalted.”
contents: “All the horns of the wicked I will cut off,
but the horns of the righteous will be exalted.”

s1: God’s Name Is Great in Israel

d: For the choirmaster. With stringed instruments. A Psalm of Asaph. A song.

contents.verseText: God is known in Judah; His name is great in Israel.
contents: God is known in Judah;
His name is great in Israel.

contents.verseText: His tent is in Salem, His dwelling place in Zion.
contents: His tent is in Salem,

footnote.ft: That is, Jerusalem

contents: His dwelling place in Zion.

contents.verseText: There He shattered the flaming arrows, the shield and sword and weapons of war. Selah
contents: There He shattered the flaming arrows,
the shield and sword and weapons of war.
Selah

contents.verseText: You are resplendent with light, more majestic than mountains filled with game.
contents: You are resplendent with light,
more majestic than mountains filled with game.

contents.verseText: The valiant lie plundered; they sleep their last sleep. No men of might could lift a hand.
contents: The valiant lie plundered; they sleep their last sleep.
No men of might could lift a hand.

contents.verseText: At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob, both horse and rider lie stunned.
contents: At Your rebuke, O God of Jacob,
both horse and rider lie stunned.

contents.verseText: You alone are to be feared. When You are angry, who can stand before You?
contents: You alone are to be feared.
When You are angry, who can stand before You?

contents.verseText: From heaven You pronounced judgment, and the earth feared and was still
contents: From heaven You pronounced judgment,
and the earth feared and was still

contents.verseText: when God rose up to judge, to save all the lowly of the earth. Selah
contents: when God rose up to judge,
to save all the lowly of the earth.
Selah

contents.verseText: Even the wrath of man shall praise You; with the survivors of wrath You will clothe Yourself.
contents: Even the wrath of man shall praise You;
with the survivors of wrath You will clothe Yourself.

footnote.ft: Or Surely Your wrath against men brings You praise, and the survivors of Your wrath will be restrained.

contents.verseText: Make and fulfill your vows to the LORD your God; let all the neighboring lands bring tribute to Him who is to be feared.
contents: Make and fulfill your vows to the LORD your God;
let all the neighboring lands bring tribute
to Him who is to be feared.

contents.verseText: He breaks the spirits of princes; He is feared by the kings of the earth.
contents: He breaks the spirits of princes;
He is feared by the kings of the earth.

s1: In the Day of Trouble I Sought the LORD

d: For the choirmaster. According to Jeduthun. A Psalm of Asaph.

contents.verseText: I cried out to God; I cried aloud to God to hear me.
contents: I cried out to God;
I cried aloud to God to hear me.

contents.verseText: In the day of trouble I sought the Lord; through the night my outstretched hands did not grow weary; my soul refused to be comforted.
contents: In the day of trouble I sought the Lord;
through the night my outstretched hands did not grow weary;
my soul refused to be comforted.

contents.verseText: I remembered You, O God, and I groaned; I mused and my spirit grew faint. Selah
contents: I remembered You, O God, and I groaned;
I mused and my spirit grew faint.
Selah

contents.verseText: You have kept my eyes from closing; I am too troubled to speak.
contents: You have kept my eyes from closing;
I am too troubled to speak.

contents.verseText: I considered the days of old, the years long in the past.
contents: I considered the days of old,
the years long in the past.

contents.verseText: At night I remembered my song; in my heart I mused, and my spirit pondered:
contents: At night I remembered my song;
in my heart I mused, and my spirit pondered:

contents.verseText: “Will the Lord spurn us forever and never show His favor again?
contents: “Will the Lord spurn us forever
and never show His favor again?

contents.verseText: Is His loving devotion gone forever? Has His promise failed for all time?
contents: Is His loving devotion gone forever?
Has His promise failed for all time?

contents.verseText: Has God forgotten to be gracious? Has His anger shut off His compassion?” Selah
contents: Has God forgotten to be gracious?
Has His anger shut off His compassion?”
Selah

contents.verseText: So I said, “I am grieved that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”
contents: So I said, “I am grieved
that the right hand of the Most High has changed.”

footnote.ft: Or “To this I will appeal: to the years of the right hand of the Most High.”

contents.verseText: I will remember the works of the LORD; yes, I will remember Your wonders of old.
contents: I will remember the works of the LORD;
yes, I will remember Your wonders of old.

contents.verseText: I will reflect on all You have done and ponder Your mighty deeds.
contents: I will reflect on all You have done
and ponder Your mighty deeds.

contents.verseText: Your way, O God, is holy. What god is so great as our God?
contents: Your way, O God, is holy.
What god is so great as our God?

contents.verseText: You are the God who works wonders; You display Your strength among the peoples.
contents: You are the God who works wonders;
You display Your strength among the peoples.

contents.verseText: With power You redeemed Your people, the sons of Jacob and Joseph. Selah
contents: With power You redeemed Your people,
the sons of Jacob and Joseph.
Selah

contents.verseText: The waters saw You, O God; the waters saw You and swirled; even the depths were shaken.
contents: The waters saw You, O God;
the waters saw You and swirled;
even the depths were shaken.

contents.verseText: The clouds poured down water; the skies resounded with thunder; Your arrows flashed back and forth.
contents: The clouds poured down water;
the skies resounded with thunder;
Your arrows flashed back and forth.

contents.verseText: Your thunder resounded in the whirlwind; the lightning lit up the world; the earth trembled and quaked.
contents: Your thunder resounded in the whirlwind;
the lightning lit up the world;
the earth trembled and quaked.

contents.verseText: Your path led through the sea, Your way through the mighty waters, but Your footprints were not to be found.
contents: Your path led through the sea,
Your way through the mighty waters,
but Your footprints were not to be found.

footnote.ft: Or were unknown

contents.verseText: You led Your people like a flock by the hand of Moses and Aaron.
contents: You led Your people like a flock
by the hand of Moses and Aaron.

s1: I Will Open My Mouth in Parables

d: A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of Asaph.

contents.verseText: Give ear, O my people, to my instruction; listen to the words of my mouth.
contents: Give ear, O my people, to my instruction;
listen to the words of my mouth.

contents.verseText: I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from the beginning,
contents: I will open my mouth in parables;
I will utter things hidden from the beginning,

footnote.ft: Or from ancient times; see also LXX; cited in Matthew 13:35

contents.verseText: that we have heard and known and our fathers have relayed to us.
contents: that we have heard and known
and our fathers have relayed to us.

contents.verseText: We will not hide them from their children, but will declare to the next generation the praises of the LORD and His might, and the wonders He has performed.
contents: We will not hide them from their children,
but will declare to the next generation
the praises of the LORD and His might,
and the wonders He has performed.

contents.verseText: For He established a testimony in Jacob and appointed a law in Israel, which He commanded our fathers to teach to their children,
contents: For He established a testimony in Jacob
and appointed a law in Israel,
which He commanded our fathers
to teach to their children,

contents.verseText: that the coming generation would know them—even children yet to be born—to arise and tell their own children
contents: that the coming generation would know them—
even children yet to be born—
to arise and tell their own children

contents.verseText: that they should put their confidence in God, not forgetting His works, but keeping His commandments.
contents: that they should put their confidence in God,
not forgetting His works,
but keeping His commandments.

contents.verseText: Then they will not be like their fathers, a stubborn and rebellious generation, whose heart was not loyal, whose spirit was not faithful to God.
contents: Then they will not be like their fathers,
a stubborn and rebellious generation,
whose heart was not loyal,
whose spirit was not faithful to God.

contents.verseText: The archers of Ephraim turned back on the day of battle.
contents: The archers of Ephraim
turned back on the day of battle.

contents.verseText: They failed to keep God’s covenant and refused to live by His law.
contents: They failed to keep God’s covenant
and refused to live by His law.

contents.verseText: They forgot what He had done, the wonders He had shown them.
contents: They forgot what He had done,
the wonders He had shown them.

contents.verseText: He worked wonders before their fathers in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.
contents: He worked wonders before their fathers
in the land of Egypt, in the region of Zoan.

contents.verseText: He split the sea and brought them through; He set the waters upright like a wall.
contents: He split the sea and brought them through;
He set the waters upright like a wall.

contents.verseText: He led them with a cloud by day and with a light of fire all night.
contents: He led them with a cloud by day
and with a light of fire all night.

contents.verseText: He split the rocks in the wilderness and gave them drink as abundant as the seas.
contents: He split the rocks in the wilderness
and gave them drink as abundant as the seas.

contents.verseText: He brought streams from the stone and made water flow down like rivers.
contents: He brought streams from the stone
and made water flow down like rivers.

contents.verseText: But they continued to sin against Him, rebelling in the desert against the Most High.
contents: But they continued to sin against Him,
rebelling in the desert against the Most High.

contents.verseText: They willfully tested God by demanding the food they craved.
contents: They willfully tested God
by demanding the food they craved.

contents.verseText: They spoke against God, saying, “Can God really prepare a table in the wilderness?
contents: They spoke against God, saying,
“Can God really prepare a table in the wilderness?

contents.verseText: When He struck the rock, water gushed out and torrents raged. But can He also give bread or supply His people with meat?”
contents: When He struck the rock, water gushed out
and torrents raged.
But can He also give bread
or supply His people with meat?”

contents.verseText: Therefore the LORD heard and was filled with wrath; so a fire was kindled against Jacob, and His anger flared against Israel,
contents: Therefore the LORD heard
and was filled with wrath;
so a fire was kindled against Jacob,
and His anger flared against Israel,

contents.verseText: because they did not believe God or rely on His salvation.
contents: because they did not believe God
or rely on His salvation.

contents.verseText: Yet He commanded the clouds above and opened the doors of the heavens.
contents: Yet He commanded the clouds above
and opened the doors of the heavens.

contents.verseText: He rained down manna for them to eat; He gave them grain from heaven.
contents: He rained down manna for them to eat;
He gave them grain from heaven.

footnote.ft: Cited in John 6:31

contents.verseText: Man ate the bread of angels; He sent them food in abundance.
contents: Man ate the bread of angels;
He sent them food in abundance.

contents.verseText: He stirred the east wind from the heavens and drove the south wind by His might.
contents: He stirred the east wind from the heavens
and drove the south wind by His might.

contents.verseText: He rained meat on them like dust, and winged birds like the sand of the sea.
contents: He rained meat on them like dust,
and winged birds like the sand of the sea.

contents.verseText: He felled them in the midst of their camp, all around their dwellings.
contents: He felled them in the midst of their camp,
all around their dwellings.

contents.verseText: So they ate and were well filled, for He gave them what they craved.
contents: So they ate and were well filled,
for He gave them what they craved.

contents.verseText: Yet before they had filled their desire, with the food still in their mouths,
contents: Yet before they had filled their desire,
with the food still in their mouths,

contents.verseText: God’s anger flared against them, and He put to death their strongest and subdued the young men of Israel.
contents: God’s anger flared against them,
and He put to death their strongest
and subdued the young men of Israel.

contents.verseText: In spite of all this, they kept on sinning; despite His wonderful works, they did not believe.
contents: In spite of all this, they kept on sinning;
despite His wonderful works, they did not believe.

contents.verseText: So He ended their days in futility, and their years in sudden terror.
contents: So He ended their days in futility,

footnote.ft: Or in vapor

contents: and their years in sudden terror.

contents.verseText: When He slew them, they would seek Him; they repented and searched for God.
contents: When He slew them, they would seek Him;
they repented and searched for God.

contents.verseText: And they remembered that God was their Rock, that God Most High was their Redeemer.
contents: And they remembered that God was their Rock,
that God Most High

footnote.ft: Hebrew El-Elyon

contents: was their Redeemer.

contents.verseText: But they deceived Him with their mouths, and lied to Him with their tongues.
contents: But they deceived Him with their mouths,
and lied to Him with their tongues.

contents.verseText: Their hearts were disloyal to Him, and they were unfaithful to His covenant.
contents: Their hearts were disloyal to Him,
and they were unfaithful to His covenant.

contents.verseText: And yet He was compassionate; He forgave their iniquity and did not destroy them. He often restrained His anger and did not unleash His full wrath.
contents: And yet He was compassionate;
He forgave their iniquity and did not destroy them.
He often restrained His anger
and did not unleash His full wrath.

contents.verseText: He remembered that they were but flesh, a passing breeze that does not return.
contents: He remembered that they were but flesh,
a passing breeze that does not return.

contents.verseText: How often they disobeyed Him in the wilderness and grieved Him in the desert!
contents: How often they disobeyed Him in the wilderness
and grieved Him in the desert!

contents.verseText: Again and again they tested God and provoked the Holy One of Israel.
contents: Again and again they tested God
and provoked the Holy One of Israel.

contents.verseText: They did not remember His power—the day He redeemed them from the adversary,
contents: They did not remember His power

footnote.ft: Or His hand

contents: the day He redeemed them from the adversary,

contents.verseText: when He performed His signs in Egypt and His wonders in the fields of Zoan.
contents: when He performed His signs in Egypt
and His wonders in the fields of Zoan.

contents.verseText: He turned their rivers to blood, and from their streams they could not drink.
contents: He turned their rivers to blood,
and from their streams they could not drink.

contents.verseText: He sent swarms of flies that devoured them, and frogs that devastated them.
contents: He sent swarms of flies that devoured them,
and frogs that devastated them.

contents.verseText: He gave their crops to the grasshopper, the fruit of their labor to the locust.
contents: He gave their crops to the grasshopper,
the fruit of their labor to the locust.

contents.verseText: He killed their vines with hailstones and their sycamore-figs with sleet.
contents: He killed their vines with hailstones
and their sycamore-figs with sleet.

footnote.ft: Or frost or driving rain

contents.verseText: He abandoned their cattle to the hail and their livestock to bolts of lightning.
contents: He abandoned their cattle to the hail
and their livestock to bolts of lightning.

contents.verseText: He unleashed His fury against them, wrath, indignation, and calamity—a band of destroying angels.
contents: He unleashed His fury against them,
wrath, indignation, and calamity—
a band of destroying angels.

contents.verseText: He cleared a path for His anger; He did not spare them from death but delivered their lives to the plague.
contents: He cleared a path for His anger;
He did not spare them from death
but delivered their lives to the plague.

contents.verseText: He struck all the firstborn of Egypt, the virility in the tents of Ham.
contents: He struck all the firstborn of Egypt,
the virility in the tents of Ham.

contents.verseText: He led out His people like sheep and guided them like a flock in the wilderness.
contents: He led out His people like sheep
and guided them like a flock in the wilderness.

contents.verseText: He led them safely, so they did not fear, but the sea engulfed their enemies.
contents: He led them safely, so they did not fear,
but the sea engulfed their enemies.

contents.verseText: He brought them to His holy land, to the mountain His right hand had acquired.
contents: He brought them to His holy land,
to the mountain His right hand had acquired.

contents.verseText: He drove out nations before them and apportioned their inheritance; He settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.
contents: He drove out nations before them
and apportioned their inheritance;
He settled the tribes of Israel in their tents.

contents.verseText: But they tested and disobeyed God Most High, for they did not keep His decrees.
contents: But they tested and disobeyed God Most High,
for they did not keep His decrees.

contents.verseText: They turned back and were faithless like their fathers, twisted like a faulty bow.
contents: They turned back and were faithless like their fathers,
twisted like a faulty bow.

contents.verseText: They enraged Him with their high places and provoked His jealousy with their idols.
contents: They enraged Him with their high places
and provoked His jealousy with their idols.

contents.verseText: On hearing it, God was furious and rejected Israel completely.
contents: On hearing it, God was furious
and rejected Israel completely.

contents.verseText: He abandoned the tabernacle of Shiloh, the tent He had pitched among men.
contents: He abandoned the tabernacle of Shiloh,
the tent He had pitched among men.

contents.verseText: He delivered His strength to captivity, and His splendor to the hand of the adversary.
contents: He delivered His strength to captivity,
and His splendor to the hand of the adversary.

contents.verseText: He surrendered His people to the sword because He was enraged by His heritage.
contents: He surrendered His people to the sword
because He was enraged by His heritage.

contents.verseText: Fire consumed His young men, and their maidens were left without wedding songs.
contents: Fire consumed His young men,
and their maidens were left without wedding songs.

contents.verseText: His priests fell by the sword, but their widows could not lament.
contents: His priests fell by the sword,
but their widows could not lament.

contents.verseText: Then the Lord awoke as from sleep, like a mighty warrior overcome by wine.
contents: Then the Lord awoke as from sleep,
like a mighty warrior overcome by wine.

contents.verseText: He beat back His foes; He put them to everlasting shame.
contents: He beat back His foes;
He put them to everlasting shame.

contents.verseText: He rejected the tent of Joseph and refused the tribe of Ephraim.
contents: He rejected the tent of Joseph
and refused the tribe of Ephraim.

contents.verseText: But He chose the tribe of Judah, Mount Zion, which He loved.
contents: But He chose the tribe of Judah,
Mount Zion, which He loved.

contents.verseText: He built His sanctuary like the heights, like the earth He has established forever.
contents: He built His sanctuary like the heights,
like the earth He has established forever.

contents.verseText: He chose David His servant and took him from the sheepfolds;
contents: He chose David His servant
and took him from the sheepfolds;

contents.verseText: from tending the ewes He brought him to be shepherd of His people Jacob, of Israel His inheritance.
contents: from tending the ewes He brought him
to be shepherd of His people Jacob,
of Israel His inheritance.

contents.verseText: So David shepherded them with integrity of heart and guided them with skillful hands.
contents: So David shepherded them with integrity of heart
and guided them with skillful hands.

d: A Psalm of Asaph.

contents.verseText: The nations, O God, have invaded Your inheritance; they have defiled Your holy temple and reduced Jerusalem to rubble.
contents: The nations, O God, have invaded Your inheritance;
they have defiled Your holy temple
and reduced Jerusalem to rubble.

contents.verseText: They have given the corpses of Your servants as food to the birds of the air, the flesh of Your saints to the beasts of the earth.
contents: They have given the corpses of Your servants
as food to the birds of the air,
the flesh of Your saints to the beasts of the earth.

contents.verseText: They have poured out their blood like water all around Jerusalem, and there is no one to bury the dead.
contents: They have poured out their blood like water
all around Jerusalem,
and there is no one to bury the dead.

contents.verseText: We have become a reproach to our neighbors, a scorn and derision to those around us.
contents: We have become a reproach to our neighbors,
a scorn and derision to those around us.

contents.verseText: How long, O LORD? Will You be angry forever? Will Your jealousy burn like fire?
contents: How long, O LORD?
Will You be angry forever?
Will Your jealousy burn like fire?

contents.verseText: Pour out Your wrath on the nations that do not acknowledge You, on the kingdoms that refuse to call on Your name,
contents: Pour out Your wrath on the nations
that do not acknowledge You,
on the kingdoms
that refuse to call on Your name,

contents.verseText: for they have devoured Jacob and devastated his homeland.
contents: for they have devoured Jacob
and devastated his homeland.

contents.verseText: Do not hold past sins against us; let Your compassion come quickly, for we are brought low.
contents: Do not hold past sins against us;
let Your compassion come quickly,
for we are brought low.

contents.verseText: Help us, O God of our salvation, for the glory of Your name; deliver us and atone for our sins, for the sake of Your name.
contents: Help us, O God of our salvation,
for the glory of Your name;
deliver us and atone for our sins,
for the sake of Your name.

contents.verseText: Why should the nations ask, “Where is their God?” Before our eyes, make known among the nations Your vengeance for the bloodshed of Your servants.
contents: Why should the nations ask,
“Where is their God?”
Before our eyes, make known among the nations
Your vengeance for the bloodshed of Your servants.

contents.verseText: May the groans of the captives reach You; by the strength of Your arm preserve those condemned to death.
contents: May the groans of the captives reach You;
by the strength of Your arm preserve those condemned to death.

contents.verseText: Pay back into the laps of our neighbors sevenfold the reproach they hurled at You, O Lord.
contents: Pay back into the laps of our neighbors
sevenfold the reproach they hurled at You, O Lord.

contents.verseText: Then we Your people, the sheep of Your pasture, will thank You forever; from generation to generation we will declare Your praise.
contents: Then we Your people, the sheep of Your pasture,
will thank You forever;
from generation to generation
we will declare Your praise.

s1: Hear Us, O Shepherd of Israel

d: For the choirmaster. To the tune of “The Lilies of the Covenant.” A Psalm of Asaph.

contents.verseText: Hear us, O Shepherd of Israel, who leads Joseph like a flock; You who sit enthroned between the cherubim, shine forth
contents: Hear us, O Shepherd of Israel,
who leads Joseph like a flock;
You who sit enthroned between the cherubim,
shine forth

contents.verseText: before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh. Rally Your mighty power and come to save us.
contents: before Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh.
Rally Your mighty power
and come to save us.

contents.verseText: Restore us, O God, and cause Your face to shine upon us, that we may be saved.
contents: Restore us, O God,
and cause Your face to shine upon us,
that we may be saved.

contents.verseText: O LORD God of Hosts, how long will Your anger smolder against the prayers of Your people?
contents: O LORD God of Hosts,
how long will Your anger smolder
against the prayers of Your people?

contents.verseText: You fed them with the bread of tears and made them drink the full measure of their tears.
contents: You fed them with the bread of tears
and made them drink the full measure of their tears.

contents.verseText: You make us contend with our neighbors; our enemies mock us.
contents: You make us contend with our neighbors;
our enemies mock us.

contents.verseText: Restore us, O God of Hosts, and cause Your face to shine upon us, that we may be saved.
contents: Restore us, O God of Hosts,
and cause Your face to shine upon us,
that we may be saved.

contents.verseText: You uprooted a vine from Egypt; You drove out the nations and transplanted it.
contents: You uprooted a vine from Egypt;
You drove out the nations and transplanted it.

contents.verseText: You cleared the ground for it, and it took root and filled the land.
contents: You cleared the ground for it,
and it took root and filled the land.

contents.verseText: The mountains were covered by its shade, and the mighty cedars with its branches.
contents: The mountains were covered by its shade,
and the mighty cedars with its branches.

contents.verseText: It sent out its branches to the Sea, and its shoots toward the River.
contents: It sent out its branches to the Sea,

footnote.ft: That is, the Mediterranean Sea, also called the Great Sea

contents: and its shoots toward the River.

footnote.ft: That is, the Euphrates

contents.verseText: Why have You broken down its walls, so that all who pass by pick its fruit?
contents: Why have You broken down its walls,
so that all who pass by pick its fruit?

contents.verseText: The boar from the forest ravages it, and the creatures of the field feed upon it.
contents: The boar from the forest ravages it,
and the creatures of the field feed upon it.

contents.verseText: Return, O God of Hosts, we pray! Look down from heaven and see! Attend to this vine—
contents: Return, O God of Hosts, we pray!
Look down from heaven and see!
Attend to this vine—

contents.verseText: the root Your right hand has planted, the son You have raised up for Yourself.
contents: the root Your right hand has planted,
the son You have raised up for Yourself.

contents.verseText: Your vine has been cut down and burned; they perish at the rebuke of Your countenance.
contents: Your vine has been cut down and burned;
they perish at the rebuke of Your countenance.

contents.verseText: Let Your hand be upon the man at Your right hand, on the son of man You have raised up for Yourself.
contents: Let Your hand be upon the man at Your right hand,
on the son of man You have raised up for Yourself.

contents.verseText: Then we will not turn away from You; revive us, and we will call on Your name.
contents: Then we will not turn away from You;
revive us, and we will call on Your name.

contents.verseText: Restore us, O LORD God of Hosts; cause Your face to shine upon us, that we may be saved.
contents: Restore us, O LORD God of Hosts;
cause Your face to shine upon us,
that we may be saved.

s1: Sing for Joy to God Our Strength

d: For the choirmaster. According to Gittith.

footnote.ft: Gittith is probably a musical or liturgical term; here and in Psalms 8 and 84.

d: Of Asaph.

contents.verseText: Sing for joy to God our strength; make a joyful noise to the God of Jacob.
contents: Sing for joy to God our strength;
make a joyful noise to the God of Jacob.

contents.verseText: Lift up a song, strike the tambourine, play the sweet-sounding harp and lyre.
contents: Lift up a song, strike the tambourine,
play the sweet-sounding harp and lyre.

contents.verseText: Sound the ram’s horn at the New Moon, and at the full moon on the day of our Feast.
contents: Sound the ram’s horn at the New Moon,
and at the full moon on the day of our Feast.

contents.verseText: For this is a statute for Israel, an ordinance of the God of Jacob.
contents: For this is a statute for Israel,
an ordinance of the God of Jacob.

contents.verseText: He ordained it as a testimony for Joseph when he went out over the land of Egypt, where I heard an unfamiliar language:
contents: He ordained it as a testimony for Joseph

footnote.ft: Or in Joseph

contents: when he went out over the land of Egypt,
where I heard an unfamiliar language:

contents.verseText: “I relieved his shoulder of the burden; his hands were freed from the basket.
contents: “I relieved his shoulder of the burden;
his hands were freed from the basket.

contents.verseText: You called out in distress, and I rescued you; I answered you from the cloud of thunder; I tested you at the waters of Meribah. Selah
contents: You called out in distress, and I rescued you;
I answered you from the cloud of thunder;
I tested you at the waters of Meribah.

footnote.ft: Meribah means quarreling; see Exodus 17:7.

contents: Selah

contents.verseText: Hear, O My people, and I will warn you: O Israel, if only you would listen to Me!
contents: Hear, O My people, and I will warn you:
O Israel, if only you would listen to Me!

contents.verseText: There must be no strange god among you, nor shall you bow to a foreign god.
contents: There must be no strange god among you,
nor shall you bow to a foreign god.

contents.verseText: I am the LORD your God, who brought you up out of Egypt. Open wide your mouth, and I will fill it.
contents: I am the LORD your God,
who brought you up out of Egypt.
Open wide your mouth,
and I will fill it.

contents.verseText: But My people would not listen to Me, and Israel would not obey Me.
contents: But My people would not listen to Me,
and Israel would not obey Me.

contents.verseText: So I gave them up to their stubborn hearts to follow their own devices.
contents: So I gave them up to their stubborn hearts
to follow their own devices.

contents.verseText: If only My people would listen to Me, if Israel would follow My ways,
contents: If only My people would listen to Me,
if Israel would follow My ways,

contents.verseText: how soon I would subdue their enemies and turn My hand against their foes!
contents: how soon I would subdue their enemies
and turn My hand against their foes!

contents.verseText: Those who hate the LORD would feign obedience, and their doom would last forever.
contents: Those who hate the LORD would feign obedience,
and their doom would last forever.

contents.verseText: But I would feed you the finest wheat; with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.”
contents: But I would feed you the finest wheat;
with honey from the rock I would satisfy you.”

s1: God Presides in the Divine Assembly

d: A Psalm of Asaph.

contents.verseText: God presides in the divine assembly; He renders judgment among the gods:
contents: God presides in the divine assembly;
He renders judgment among the gods:

contents.verseText: “How long will you judge unjustly and show partiality to the wicked? Selah
contents: “How long will you judge unjustly

footnote.ft: Or How long will you defend the unjust

contents: and show partiality to the wicked?
Selah

contents.verseText: Defend the cause of the weak and fatherless; uphold the rights of the afflicted and oppressed.
contents: Defend the cause of the weak and fatherless;
uphold the rights of the afflicted and oppressed.

contents.verseText: Rescue the weak and needy; save them from the hand of the wicked.
contents: Rescue the weak and needy;
save them from the hand of the wicked.

contents.verseText: They do not know or understand; they wander in the darkness; all the foundations of the earth are shaken.
contents: They do not know or understand;
they wander in the darkness;
all the foundations of the earth are shaken.

contents.verseText: I have said, ‘You are gods; you are all sons of the Most High.’
contents: I have said, ‘You are gods;
you are all sons of the Most High.’

footnote.ft: Cited in John 10:34

contents.verseText: But like mortals you will die, and like rulers you will fall.”
contents: But like mortals you will die,
and like rulers you will fall.”

contents.verseText: Arise, O God, judge the earth, for all the nations are Your inheritance.
contents: Arise, O God, judge the earth,
for all the nations are Your inheritance.

d: A song. A Psalm of Asaph.

contents.verseText: O God, be not silent; be not speechless; be not still, O God.
contents: O God, be not silent; be not speechless;

footnote.ft: Or deaf

contents: be not still, O God.

contents.verseText: See how Your enemies rage, how Your foes have reared their heads.
contents: See how Your enemies rage,
how Your foes have reared their heads.

contents.verseText: With cunning they scheme against Your people and conspire against those You cherish,
contents: With cunning they scheme against Your people
and conspire against those You cherish,

contents.verseText: saying, “Come, let us erase them as a nation; may the name of Israel be remembered no more.”
contents: saying, “Come, let us erase them as a nation;
may the name of Israel be remembered no more.”

contents.verseText: For with one mind they plot together, they form an alliance against You—
contents: For with one mind they plot together,
they form an alliance against You—

contents.verseText: the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites, of Moab and the Hagrites,
contents: the tents of Edom and the Ishmaelites,
of Moab and the Hagrites,

contents.verseText: of Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek, of Philistia with the people of Tyre.
contents: of Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek,
of Philistia with the people of Tyre.

contents.verseText: Even Assyria has joined them, lending strength to the sons of Lot. Selah
contents: Even Assyria has joined them,
lending strength to the sons of Lot.
Selah

contents.verseText: Do to them as You did to Midian, as to Sisera and Jabin at the River Kishon,
contents: Do to them as You did to Midian,
as to Sisera and Jabin at the River Kishon,

contents.verseText: who perished at Endor and became like dung on the ground.
contents: who perished at Endor
and became like dung on the ground.

contents.verseText: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb, and all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,
contents: Make their nobles like Oreb and Zeeb,
and all their princes like Zebah and Zalmunna,

contents.verseText: who said, “Let us possess for ourselves the pastures of God.”
contents: who said, “Let us possess for ourselves
the pastures of God.”

contents.verseText: Make them like tumbleweed, O my God, like chaff before the wind.
contents: Make them like tumbleweed, O my God,
like chaff before the wind.

contents.verseText: As fire consumes a forest, as a flame sets the mountains ablaze,
contents: As fire consumes a forest,
as a flame sets the mountains ablaze,

contents.verseText: so pursue them with Your tempest, and terrify them with Your storm.
contents: so pursue them with Your tempest,
and terrify them with Your storm.

contents.verseText: Cover their faces with shame, that they may seek Your name, O LORD.
contents: Cover their faces with shame,
that they may seek Your name, O LORD.

contents.verseText: May they be ever ashamed and terrified; may they perish in disgrace.
contents: May they be ever ashamed and terrified;
may they perish in disgrace.

contents.verseText: May they know that You alone, whose name is the LORD, are Most High over all the earth.
contents: May they know that You alone,
whose name is the LORD,
are Most High over all the earth.

s1: Better Is One Day in Your Courts

d: For the choirmaster. According to Gittith.

footnote.ft: Gittith is probably a musical or liturgical term; here and in Psalms 8 and 81.

d: A Psalm of the sons of Korah.

contents.verseText: How lovely is Your dwelling place, O LORD of Hosts!
contents: How lovely is Your dwelling place,
O LORD of Hosts!

contents.verseText: My soul longs, even faints, for the courts of the LORD; my heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.
contents: My soul longs, even faints,
for the courts of the LORD;
my heart and my flesh cry out
for the living God.

contents.verseText: Even the sparrow has found a home, and the swallow a nest for herself, where she places her young near Your altars, O LORD of Hosts, my King and my God.
contents: Even the sparrow has found a home,
and the swallow a nest for herself,
where she places her young near Your altars,
O LORD of Hosts, my King and my God.

contents.verseText: How blessed are those who dwell in Your house! They are ever praising You. Selah
contents: How blessed are those who dwell in Your house!
They are ever praising You.
Selah

contents.verseText: Blessed are those whose strength is in You, whose hearts are set on pilgrimage.
contents: Blessed are those whose strength is in You,
whose hearts are set on pilgrimage.

contents.verseText: As they pass through the Valley of Baca, they make it a place of springs; even the autumn rain covers it with pools.
contents: As they pass through the Valley of Baca,

footnote.ft: Or Valley of Poplars

contents: they make it a place of springs;
even the autumn rain covers it with pools.

footnote.ft: Or with blessings

contents.verseText: They go from strength to strength, until each appears before God in Zion.
contents: They go from strength to strength,
until each appears before God in Zion.

contents.verseText: O LORD God of Hosts, hear my prayer; give ear, O God of Jacob. Selah
contents: O LORD God of Hosts, hear my prayer;
give ear, O God of Jacob.
Selah

contents.verseText: Take notice of our shield, O God, and look with favor on the face of Your anointed.
contents: Take notice of our shield, O God,
and look with favor on the face of Your anointed.

contents.verseText: For better is one day in Your courts than a thousand elsewhere. I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God than dwell in the tents of the wicked.
contents: For better is one day in Your courts
than a thousand elsewhere.
I would rather be a doorkeeper in the house of my God
than dwell in the tents of the wicked.

contents.verseText: For the LORD God is a sun and a shield; the LORD gives grace and glory; He withholds no good thing from those who walk with integrity.
contents: For the LORD God is a sun and a shield;
the LORD gives grace and glory;
He withholds no good thing
from those who walk with integrity.

contents.verseText: O LORD of Hosts, how blessed is the man who trusts in You!
contents: O LORD of Hosts,
how blessed is the man who trusts in You!

s1: You Showed Favor to Your Land

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of the sons of Korah.

contents.verseText: You showed favor to Your land, O LORD; You restored Jacob from captivity.
contents: You showed favor to Your land, O LORD;
You restored Jacob from captivity.

footnote.ft: Or restored the fortunes of Jacob

contents.verseText: You forgave the iniquity of Your people; You covered all their sin. Selah
contents: You forgave the iniquity of Your people;
You covered all their sin.
Selah

contents.verseText: You withheld all Your fury; You turned from Your burning anger.
contents: You withheld all Your fury;
You turned from Your burning anger.

contents.verseText: Restore us, O God of our salvation, and put away Your displeasure toward us.
contents: Restore us, O God of our salvation,
and put away Your displeasure toward us.

contents.verseText: Will You be angry with us forever? Will You draw out Your anger to all generations?
contents: Will You be angry with us forever?
Will You draw out Your anger to all generations?

contents.verseText: Will You not revive us again, that Your people may rejoice in You?
contents: Will You not revive us again,
that Your people may rejoice in You?

contents.verseText: Show us Your loving devotion, O LORD, and grant us Your salvation.
contents: Show us Your loving devotion, O LORD,
and grant us Your salvation.

contents.verseText: I will listen to what God the LORD will say; for He will surely speak peace to His people and His saints; He will not let them return to folly.
contents: I will listen to what God the LORD will say;
for He will surely speak peace to His people and His saints;
He will not let them return to folly.

contents.verseText: Surely His salvation is near to those who fear Him, that His glory may dwell in our land.
contents: Surely His salvation is near to those who fear Him,
that His glory may dwell in our land.

contents.verseText: Loving devotion and faithfulness have joined together; righteousness and peace have kissed.
contents: Loving devotion and faithfulness have joined together;
righteousness and peace have kissed.

contents.verseText: Faithfulness sprouts from the earth, and righteousness looks down from heaven.
contents: Faithfulness sprouts from the earth,
and righteousness looks down from heaven.

contents.verseText: The LORD will indeed provide what is good, and our land will yield its increase.
contents: The LORD will indeed provide what is good,
and our land will yield its increase.

contents.verseText: Righteousness will go before Him to prepare the way for His steps.
contents: Righteousness will go before Him
to prepare the way for His steps.

d: A prayer of David.

contents.verseText: Incline Your ear, O LORD, and answer me, for I am poor and needy.
contents: Incline Your ear, O LORD, and answer me,
for I am poor and needy.

contents.verseText: Preserve my soul, for I am godly. You are my God; save Your servant who trusts in You.
contents: Preserve my soul, for I am godly.
You are my God; save Your servant who trusts in You.

contents.verseText: Be merciful to me, O Lord, for I call to You all day long.
contents: Be merciful to me, O Lord,
for I call to You all day long.

contents.verseText: Bring joy to Your servant, for to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul.
contents: Bring joy to Your servant,
for to You, O Lord, I lift up my soul.

contents.verseText: For You, O Lord, are kind and forgiving, rich in loving devotion to all who call on You.
contents: For You, O Lord, are kind and forgiving,
rich in loving devotion to all who call on You.

contents.verseText: Hear my prayer, O LORD, and attend to my plea for mercy.
contents: Hear my prayer, O LORD,
and attend to my plea for mercy.

contents.verseText: In the day of my distress I call on You, because You answer me.
contents: In the day of my distress I call on You,
because You answer me.

contents.verseText: O Lord, there is none like You among the gods, nor any works like Yours.
contents: O Lord, there is none like You among the gods,
nor any works like Yours.

contents.verseText: All the nations You have made will come and bow before You, O Lord, and they will glorify Your name.
contents: All the nations You have made
will come and bow before You, O Lord,
and they will glorify Your name.

contents.verseText: For You are great and perform wonders; You alone are God.
contents: For You are great and perform wonders;
You alone are God.

contents.verseText: Teach me Your way, O LORD, that I may walk in Your truth. Give me an undivided heart, that I may fear Your name.
contents: Teach me Your way, O LORD,
that I may walk in Your truth.
Give me an undivided heart,
that I may fear Your name.

contents.verseText: I will praise You, O Lord my God, with all my heart; I will glorify Your name forever.
contents: I will praise You, O Lord my God, with all my heart;
I will glorify Your name forever.

contents.verseText: For great is Your loving devotion to me; You have delivered me from the depths of Sheol.
contents: For great is Your loving devotion to me;
You have delivered me from the depths of Sheol.

contents.verseText: The arrogant rise against me, O God; a band of ruthless men seeks my life, with no regard for You.
contents: The arrogant rise against me, O God;
a band of ruthless men seeks my life,
with no regard for You.

contents.verseText: But You, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God, slow to anger, abounding in loving devotion and faithfulness.
contents: But You, O Lord, are a compassionate and gracious God,
slow to anger, abounding in loving devotion and faithfulness.

contents.verseText: Turn to me and have mercy; grant Your strength to Your servant; save the son of Your maidservant.
contents: Turn to me and have mercy;
grant Your strength to Your servant;
save the son of Your maidservant.

contents.verseText: Show me a sign of Your goodness, that my enemies may see and be ashamed; for You, O LORD, have helped me and comforted me.
contents: Show me a sign of Your goodness,
that my enemies may see and be ashamed;
for You, O LORD, have helped me and comforted me.

s1: The LORD Loves the Gates of Zion

d: A Psalm of the sons of Korah. A song.

contents.verseText: He has founded His city on the holy mountains.
contents: He has founded His city
on the holy mountains.

footnote.ft: Literally His foundation is on the holy mountains

contents.verseText: The LORD loves the gates of Zion more than all the dwellings of Jacob.
contents: The LORD loves the gates of Zion
more than all the dwellings of Jacob.

contents.verseText: Glorious things are ascribed to you, O city of God. Selah
contents: Glorious things are ascribed to you,
O city of God.
Selah

contents.verseText: “I will mention Rahab and Babylon among those who know Me—along with Philistia, Tyre, and Cush—when I say, ‘This one was born in Zion.’”
contents: “I will mention Rahab

footnote.ft: Rahab is a poetic name for Egypt.

contents: and Babylon
among those who know Me—
along with Philistia, Tyre, and Cush

footnote.ft: That is, the upper Nile region

contents: when I say, ‘This one was born in Zion.’”

contents.verseText: And it will be said of Zion: “This one and that one were born in her, and the Most High Himself will establish her.”
contents: And it will be said of Zion:
“This one and that one were born in her,
and the Most High Himself will establish her.”

contents.verseText: The LORD will record in the register of the peoples: “This one was born in Zion.” Selah
contents: The LORD will record in the register of the peoples:
“This one was born in Zion.”
Selah

contents.verseText: Singers and pipers will proclaim, “All my springs of joy are in You.”
contents: Singers and pipers will proclaim,
“All my springs of joy are in You.”

d: A song. A Psalm of the sons of Korah. For the choirmaster. According to Mahalath Leannoth.

footnote.ft: Mahalath Leannoth is probably a musical or liturgical term; see also Psalm 53:1.

d: A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of Heman the Ezrahite.

contents.verseText: O LORD, the God of my salvation, day and night I cry out before You.
contents: O LORD, the God of my salvation,
day and night I cry out before You.

contents.verseText: May my prayer come before You; incline Your ear to my cry.
contents: May my prayer come before You;
incline Your ear to my cry.

contents.verseText: For my soul is full of troubles, and my life draws near to Sheol.
contents: For my soul is full of troubles,
and my life draws near to Sheol.

contents.verseText: I am counted among those descending to the Pit. I am like a man without strength.
contents: I am counted among those descending to the Pit.
I am like a man without strength.

contents.verseText: I am forsaken among the dead, like the slain who lie in the grave, whom You remember no more, who are cut off from Your care.
contents: I am forsaken among the dead,
like the slain who lie in the grave,
whom You remember no more,
who are cut off from Your care.

contents.verseText: You have laid me in the lowest Pit, in the darkest of the depths.
contents: You have laid me in the lowest Pit,
in the darkest of the depths.

contents.verseText: Your wrath weighs heavily upon me; all Your waves have submerged me. Selah
contents: Your wrath weighs heavily upon me;
all Your waves have submerged me.
Selah

contents.verseText: You have removed my friends from me; You have made me repulsive to them; I am confined and cannot escape.
contents: You have removed my friends from me;
You have made me repulsive to them;
I am confined and cannot escape.

contents.verseText: My eyes grow dim with grief. I call to You daily, O LORD; I spread out my hands to You.
contents: My eyes grow dim with grief.
I call to You daily, O LORD;
I spread out my hands to You.

contents.verseText: Do You work wonders for the dead? Do departed spirits rise up to praise You? Selah
contents: Do You work wonders for the dead?
Do departed spirits rise up to praise You?
Selah

contents.verseText: Can Your loving devotion be proclaimed in the grave, Your faithfulness in Abaddon?
contents: Can Your loving devotion be proclaimed in the grave,
Your faithfulness in Abaddon

footnote.ft: Abaddon means Destruction.

contents.verseText: Will Your wonders be known in the darkness, or Your righteousness in the land of oblivion?
contents: Will Your wonders be known in the darkness,
or Your righteousness in the land of oblivion?

contents.verseText: But to You, O LORD, I cry for help; in the morning my prayer comes before You.
contents: But to You, O LORD, I cry for help;
in the morning my prayer comes before You.

contents.verseText: Why, O LORD, do You reject me? Why do You hide Your face from me?
contents: Why, O LORD, do You reject me?
Why do You hide Your face from me?

contents.verseText: From my youth I was afflicted and near death. I have borne Your terrors; I am in despair.
contents: From my youth I was afflicted and near death.
I have borne Your terrors; I am in despair.

contents.verseText: Your wrath has swept over me; Your terrors have destroyed me.
contents: Your wrath has swept over me;
Your terrors have destroyed me.

contents.verseText: All day long they engulf me like water; they enclose me on every side.
contents: All day long they engulf me like water;
they enclose me on every side.

contents.verseText: You have removed my beloved and my friend; darkness is my closest companion.
contents: You have removed my beloved and my friend;
darkness is my closest companion.

s1: I Will Sing of His Love Forever

d: A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of Ethan the Ezrahite.

contents.verseText: I will sing of the loving devotion of the LORD forever; with my mouth I will proclaim Your faithfulness to all generations.
contents: I will sing of the loving devotion of the LORD forever;
with my mouth I will proclaim Your faithfulness to all generations.

contents.verseText: For I have said, “Loving devotion is built up forever; in the heavens You establish Your faithfulness.”
contents: For I have said, “Loving devotion is built up forever;
in the heavens You establish Your faithfulness.”

contents.verseText: You said, “I have made a covenant with My chosen one, I have sworn to David My servant:
contents: You said, “I have made a covenant with My chosen one,
I have sworn to David My servant:

contents.verseText: ‘I will establish your offspring forever and build up your throne for all generations.’” Selah
contents: ‘I will establish your offspring forever
and build up your throne for all generations.’”
Selah

contents.verseText: The heavens praise Your wonders, O LORD—Your faithfulness as well—in the assembly of the holy ones.
contents: The heavens praise Your wonders, O LORD—
Your faithfulness as well—
in the assembly of the holy ones.

contents.verseText: For who in the skies can compare with the LORD? Who among the heavenly beings is like the LORD?
contents: For who in the skies can compare with the LORD?
Who among the heavenly beings

footnote.ft: Or the sons of God or the sons of might

contents: is like the LORD?

contents.verseText: In the council of the holy ones, God is greatly feared, and awesome above all who surround Him.
contents: In the council of the holy ones, God is greatly feared,
and awesome above all who surround Him.

contents.verseText: O LORD God of Hosts, who is like You? O mighty LORD, Your faithfulness surrounds You.
contents: O LORD God of Hosts, who is like You?
O mighty LORD, Your faithfulness surrounds You.

contents.verseText: You rule the raging sea; when its waves mount up, You still them.
contents: You rule the raging sea;
when its waves mount up, You still them.

contents.verseText: You crushed Rahab like a carcass; You scattered Your enemies with Your mighty arm.
contents: You crushed Rahab like a carcass;
You scattered Your enemies with Your mighty arm.

contents.verseText: The heavens are Yours, and also the earth. The earth and its fullness You founded.
contents: The heavens are Yours, and also the earth.
The earth and its fullness You founded.

contents.verseText: North and south You created; Tabor and Hermon shout for joy at Your name.
contents: North and south You created;
Tabor and Hermon shout for joy at Your name.

contents.verseText: Mighty is Your arm; strong is Your hand. Your right hand is exalted.
contents: Mighty is Your arm; strong is Your hand.
Your right hand is exalted.

contents.verseText: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne; loving devotion and faithfulness go before You.
contents: Righteousness and justice are the foundation of Your throne;
loving devotion and faithfulness go before You.

contents.verseText: Blessed are those who know the joyful sound, who walk, O LORD, in the light of Your presence.
contents: Blessed are those who know the joyful sound,
who walk, O LORD, in the light of Your presence.

contents.verseText: They rejoice in Your name all day long, and in Your righteousness they exult.
contents: They rejoice in Your name all day long,
and in Your righteousness they exult.

contents.verseText: For You are the glory of their strength, and by Your favor our horn is exalted.
contents: For You are the glory of their strength,
and by Your favor our horn is exalted.

contents.verseText: Surely our shield belongs to the LORD, and our king to the Holy One of Israel.
contents: Surely our shield belongs to the LORD,
and our king to the Holy One of Israel.

contents.verseText: You once spoke in a vision; to Your godly ones You said, “I have bestowed help on a warrior; I have exalted one chosen from the people.
contents: You once spoke in a vision;
to Your godly ones You said,
“I have bestowed help on a warrior;
I have exalted one chosen from the people.

contents.verseText: I have found My servant David; with My sacred oil I have anointed him.
contents: I have found My servant David;
with My sacred oil I have anointed him.

contents.verseText: My hand will sustain him; surely My arm will strengthen him.
contents: My hand will sustain him;
surely My arm will strengthen him.

contents.verseText: No enemy will exact tribute; no wicked man will oppress him.
contents: No enemy will exact tribute;
no wicked man will oppress him.

contents.verseText: I will crush his foes before him and strike down those who hate him.
contents: I will crush his foes before him
and strike down those who hate him.

contents.verseText: My faithfulness and loving devotion will be with him, and through My name his horn will be exalted.
contents: My faithfulness and loving devotion will be with him,
and through My name his horn will be exalted.

contents.verseText: I will set his hand over the sea, and his right hand upon the rivers.
contents: I will set his hand over the sea,
and his right hand upon the rivers.

contents.verseText: He will call to Me, ‘You are my Father, my God, the Rock of my salvation.’
contents: He will call to Me, ‘You are my Father,
my God, the Rock of my salvation.’

contents.verseText: I will indeed appoint him as My firstborn, the highest of the kings of the earth.
contents: I will indeed appoint him as My firstborn,
the highest of the kings of the earth.

contents.verseText: I will forever preserve My loving devotion for him, and My covenant with him will stand fast.
contents: I will forever preserve My loving devotion for him,
and My covenant with him will stand fast.

contents.verseText: I will establish his line forever, his throne as long as the heavens endure.
contents: I will establish his line forever,
his throne as long as the heavens endure.

contents.verseText: If his sons forsake My law and do not walk in My judgments,
contents: If his sons forsake My law
and do not walk in My judgments,

contents.verseText: if they violate My statutes and fail to keep My commandments,
contents: if they violate My statutes
and fail to keep My commandments,

contents.verseText: I will attend to their transgression with the rod, and to their iniquity with stripes.
contents: I will attend to their transgression with the rod,
and to their iniquity with stripes.

contents.verseText: But I will not withdraw My loving devotion from him, nor ever betray My faithfulness.
contents: But I will not withdraw My loving devotion from him,
nor ever betray My faithfulness.

contents.verseText: I will not violate My covenant or alter the utterance of My lips.
contents: I will not violate My covenant
or alter the utterance of My lips.

contents.verseText: Once and for all I have sworn by My holiness—I will not lie to David—
contents: Once and for all I have sworn by My holiness—
I will not lie to David—

contents.verseText: his offspring shall endure forever, and his throne before Me like the sun,
contents: his offspring shall endure forever,
and his throne before Me like the sun,

contents.verseText: like the moon, established forever, a faithful witness in the sky.” Selah
contents: like the moon, established forever,
a faithful witness in the sky.”
Selah

contents.verseText: Now, however, You have spurned and rejected him; You are enraged by Your anointed one.
contents: Now, however, You have spurned and rejected him;
You are enraged by Your anointed one.

contents.verseText: You have renounced the covenant with Your servant and sullied his crown in the dust.
contents: You have renounced the covenant with Your servant
and sullied his crown in the dust.

contents.verseText: You have broken down all his walls; You have reduced his strongholds to rubble.
contents: You have broken down all his walls;
You have reduced his strongholds to rubble.

contents.verseText: All who pass by plunder him; he has become a reproach to his neighbors.
contents: All who pass by plunder him;
he has become a reproach to his neighbors.

contents.verseText: You have exalted the right hand of his foes; You have made all his enemies rejoice.
contents: You have exalted the right hand of his foes;
You have made all his enemies rejoice.

contents.verseText: You have bent the edge of his sword and have not sustained him in battle.
contents: You have bent the edge of his sword
and have not sustained him in battle.

contents.verseText: You have ended his splendor and cast his throne to the ground.
contents: You have ended his splendor
and cast his throne to the ground.

contents.verseText: You have cut short the days of his youth; You have covered him with shame. Selah
contents: You have cut short the days of his youth;
You have covered him with shame.
Selah

contents.verseText: How long, O LORD? Will You hide Yourself forever? Will Your wrath keep burning like fire?
contents: How long, O LORD?
Will You hide Yourself forever?
Will Your wrath keep burning like fire?

contents.verseText: Remember the briefness of my lifespan! For what futility You have created all men!
contents: Remember the briefness of my lifespan!
For what futility You have created all men!

contents.verseText: What man can live and never see death? Can he deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah
contents: What man can live and never see death?
Can he deliver his soul from the power of Sheol?
Selah

contents.verseText: Where, O Lord, is Your loving devotion of old, which You faithfully swore to David?
contents: Where, O Lord, is Your loving devotion of old,
which You faithfully swore to David?

contents.verseText: Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Your servants, which I bear in my heart from so many people—
contents: Remember, O Lord, the reproach of Your servants,
which I bear in my heart from so many people—

contents.verseText: how Your enemies have taunted, O LORD, and have mocked every step of Your anointed one!
contents: how Your enemies have taunted, O LORD,
and have mocked every step of Your anointed one!

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD forever! Amen and amen.
contents: Blessed be the LORD forever!
Amen and amen.

d: A prayer of Moses the man of God.

contents.verseText: Lord, You have been our dwelling place through all generations.
contents: Lord, You have been our dwelling place
through all generations.

contents.verseText: Before the mountains were born or You brought forth the earth and the world, from everlasting to everlasting You are God.
contents: Before the mountains were born
or You brought forth the earth and the world,
from everlasting to everlasting
You are God.

contents.verseText: You return man to dust, saying, “Return, O sons of mortals.”
contents: You return man to dust,
saying, “Return, O sons of mortals.”

contents.verseText: For in Your sight a thousand years are but a day that passes, or a watch of the night.
contents: For in Your sight a thousand years
are but a day that passes,

footnote.ft: See 2 Peter 3:8.

contents: or a watch of the night.

contents.verseText: You whisk them away in their sleep; they are like the new grass of the morning—
contents: You whisk them away in their sleep;
they are like the new grass of the morning—

contents.verseText: in the morning it springs up new, but by evening it fades and withers.
contents: in the morning it springs up new,
but by evening it fades and withers.

contents.verseText: For we are consumed by Your anger and terrified by Your wrath.
contents: For we are consumed by Your anger
and terrified by Your wrath.

contents.verseText: You have set our iniquities before You, our secret sins in the light of Your presence.
contents: You have set our iniquities before You,
our secret sins in the light of Your presence.

contents.verseText: For all our days decline in Your fury; we finish our years with a sigh.
contents: For all our days decline in Your fury;
we finish our years with a sigh.

contents.verseText: The length of our days is seventy years—or eighty if we are strong—yet their pride is but labor and sorrow, for they quickly pass, and we fly away.
contents: The length of our days is seventy years—
or eighty if we are strong—
yet their pride is but labor and sorrow,
for they quickly pass, and we fly away.

contents.verseText: Who knows the power of Your anger? Your wrath matches the fear You are due.
contents: Who knows the power of Your anger?
Your wrath matches the fear You are due.

contents.verseText: So teach us to number our days, that we may present a heart of wisdom.
contents: So teach us to number our days,
that we may present a heart of wisdom.

contents.verseText: Return, O LORD! How long will it be? Have compassion on Your servants.
contents: Return, O LORD! How long will it be?
Have compassion on Your servants.

contents.verseText: Satisfy us in the morning with Your loving devotion, that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.
contents: Satisfy us in the morning with Your loving devotion,
that we may sing for joy and be glad all our days.

contents.verseText: Make us glad for as many days as You have afflicted us, for as many years as we have seen evil.
contents: Make us glad for as many days as You have afflicted us,
for as many years as we have seen evil.

contents.verseText: May Your work be shown to Your servants, and Your splendor to their children.
contents: May Your work be shown to Your servants,
and Your splendor to their children.

contents.verseText: May the favor of the Lord our God rest upon us; establish for us the work of our hands—yes, establish the work of our hands!
contents: May the favor

footnote.ft: Or beauty

contents: of the Lord our God rest upon us;
establish for us the work of our hands—
yes, establish the work of our hands!

s1: You Are My Refuge and My Fortress

contents.verseText: He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High will abide in the shadow of the Almighty.
contents: He who dwells in the shelter of the Most High
will abide in the shadow of the Almighty.

footnote.ft: Hebrew Shaddai

contents.verseText: I will say to the LORD, “You are my refuge and my fortress, my God, in whom I trust.”
contents: I will say to the LORD, “You are my refuge and my fortress,
my God, in whom I trust.”

contents.verseText: Surely He will deliver you from the snare of the fowler, and from the deadly plague.
contents: Surely He will deliver you
from the snare of the fowler,
and from the deadly plague.

contents.verseText: He will cover you with His feathers; under His wings you will find refuge; His faithfulness is a shield and rampart.
contents: He will cover you with His feathers;
