under His wings you will find refuge;
His faithfulness is a shield and rampart.

contents.verseText: You will not fear the terror of the night, nor the arrow that flies by day,
contents: You will not fear the terror of the night,
nor the arrow that flies by day,

contents.verseText: nor the pestilence that stalks in the darkness, nor the calamity that destroys at noon.
contents: nor the pestilence that stalks in the darkness,
nor the calamity that destroys at noon.

contents.verseText: Though a thousand may fall at your side, and ten thousand at your right hand, no harm will come near you.
contents: Though a thousand may fall at your side,
and ten thousand at your right hand,
no harm will come near you.

contents.verseText: You will only see it with your eyes and witness the punishment of the wicked.
contents: You will only see it with your eyes
and witness the punishment of the wicked.

contents.verseText: Because you have made the LORD your dwelling—my refuge, the Most High—
contents: Because you have made the LORD your dwelling—
my refuge, the Most High—

contents.verseText: no evil will befall you, no plague will approach your tent.
contents: no evil will befall you,
no plague will approach your tent.

contents.verseText: For He will command His angels concerning you to guard you in all your ways.
contents: For He will command His angels concerning you
to guard you in all your ways.

contents.verseText: They will lift you up in their hands, so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.
contents: They will lift you up in their hands,
so that you will not strike your foot against a stone.

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 4:6 and Luke 4:10–11

contents.verseText: You will tread on the lion and cobra; you will trample the young lion and serpent.
contents: You will tread on the lion and cobra;
you will trample the young lion and serpent.

contents.verseText: “Because he loves Me, I will deliver him; because he knows My name, I will protect him.
contents: “Because he loves Me, I will deliver him;
because he knows My name, I will protect him.

contents.verseText: When he calls out to Me, I will answer him; I will be with him in trouble. I will deliver him and honor him.
contents: When he calls out to Me,
I will answer him;
I will be with him in trouble.
I will deliver him and honor him.

contents.verseText: With long life I will satisfy him and show him My salvation.”
contents: With long life I will satisfy him
and show him My salvation.”

d: A Psalm. A song for the Sabbath day.

contents.verseText: It is good to praise the LORD, and to sing praises to Your name, O Most High,
contents: It is good to praise the LORD,
and to sing praises to Your name, O Most High,

contents.verseText: to proclaim Your loving devotion in the morning and Your faithfulness at night
contents: to proclaim Your loving devotion in the morning
and Your faithfulness at night

contents.verseText: with the ten-stringed harp and the melody of the lyre.
contents: with the ten-stringed harp
and the melody of the lyre.

contents.verseText: For You, O LORD, have made me glad by Your deeds; I sing for joy at the works of Your hands.
contents: For You, O LORD, have made me glad by Your deeds;
I sing for joy at the works of Your hands.

contents.verseText: How great are Your works, O LORD, how deep are Your thoughts!
contents: How great are Your works, O LORD,
how deep are Your thoughts!

contents.verseText: A senseless man does not know, and a fool does not understand,
contents: A senseless man does not know,
and a fool does not understand,

contents.verseText: that though the wicked sprout like grass, and all evildoers flourish, they will be forever destroyed.
contents: that though the wicked sprout like grass,
and all evildoers flourish,
they will be forever destroyed.

contents.verseText: But You, O LORD, are exalted forever!
contents: But You, O LORD, are exalted forever!

contents.verseText: For surely Your enemies, O LORD, surely Your enemies will perish; all evildoers will be scattered.
contents: For surely Your enemies, O LORD,
surely Your enemies will perish;
all evildoers will be scattered.

contents.verseText: But You have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox; with fine oil I have been anointed.
contents: But You have exalted my horn like that of a wild ox;
with fine oil I have been anointed.

contents.verseText: My eyes see the downfall of my enemies; my ears hear the wailing of my wicked foes.
contents: My eyes see the downfall of my enemies;
my ears hear the wailing of my wicked foes.

footnote.ft: Or my ears hear evildoers when they rise against me

contents.verseText: The righteous will flourish like a palm tree, and grow like a cedar in Lebanon.
contents: The righteous will flourish like a palm tree,
and grow like a cedar in Lebanon.

contents.verseText: Planted in the house of the LORD, they will flourish in the courts of our God.
contents: Planted in the house of the LORD,
they will flourish in the courts of our God.

contents.verseText: In old age they will still bear fruit; healthy and green they will remain,
contents: In old age they will still bear fruit;
healthy and green they will remain,

contents.verseText: to proclaim, “The LORD is upright; He is my Rock, and in Him there is no unrighteousness.”
contents: to proclaim, “The LORD is upright; He is my Rock,
and in Him there is no unrighteousness.”

contents.verseText: The LORD reigns! He is robed in majesty; the LORD has clothed and armed Himself with strength. The world indeed is firmly established; it cannot be moved.
contents: The LORD reigns! He is robed in majesty;
the LORD has clothed and armed Himself with strength.
The world indeed is firmly established;
it cannot be moved.

contents.verseText: Your throne was established long ago; You are from all eternity.
contents: Your throne was established long ago;
You are from all eternity.

contents.verseText: The floodwaters have risen, O LORD; the rivers have raised their voice; the seas lift up their pounding waves.
contents: The floodwaters have risen, O LORD;
the rivers have raised their voice;
the seas lift up their pounding waves.

contents.verseText: Above the roar of many waters—the mighty breakers of the sea—the LORD on high is majestic.
contents: Above the roar of many waters—
the mighty breakers of the sea—
the LORD on high is majestic.

contents.verseText: Your testimonies are fully confirmed; holiness adorns Your house, O LORD, for all the days to come.
contents: Your testimonies are fully confirmed;
holiness adorns Your house, O LORD,
for all the days to come.

s1: The LORD Will Not Forget His People

contents.verseText: O LORD, God of vengeance, O God of vengeance, shine forth.
contents: O LORD, God of vengeance,
O God of vengeance, shine forth.

contents.verseText: Rise up, O Judge of the earth; render a reward to the proud.
contents: Rise up, O Judge of the earth;
render a reward to the proud.

contents.verseText: How long will the wicked, O LORD, how long will the wicked exult?
contents: How long will the wicked, O LORD,
how long will the wicked exult?

contents.verseText: They pour out arrogant words; all workers of iniquity boast.
contents: They pour out arrogant words;
all workers of iniquity boast.

contents.verseText: They crush Your people, O LORD; they oppress Your heritage.
contents: They crush Your people, O LORD;
they oppress Your heritage.

contents.verseText: They kill the widow and the foreigner; they murder the fatherless.
contents: They kill the widow and the foreigner;
they murder the fatherless.

contents.verseText: They say, “The LORD does not see; the God of Jacob pays no heed.”
contents: They say, “The LORD does not see;
the God of Jacob pays no heed.”

contents.verseText: Take notice, O senseless among the people! O fools, when will you be wise?
contents: Take notice, O senseless among the people!
O fools, when will you be wise?

contents.verseText: He who affixed the ear, can He not hear? He who formed the eye, can He not see?
contents: He who affixed the ear, can He not hear?
He who formed the eye, can He not see?

contents.verseText: He who admonishes the nations, does He not discipline? He who teaches man, does He lack knowledge?
contents: He who admonishes the nations, does He not discipline?
He who teaches man, does He lack knowledge?

contents.verseText: The LORD knows the thoughts of man, that they are futile.
contents: The LORD knows the thoughts of man,
that they are futile.

footnote.ft: Cited in 1 Corinthians 3:20

contents.verseText: Blessed is the man You discipline, O LORD, and teach from Your law,
contents: Blessed is the man You discipline, O LORD,
and teach from Your law,

contents.verseText: to grant him relief from days of trouble, until a pit is dug for the wicked.
contents: to grant him relief from days of trouble,
until a pit is dug for the wicked.

contents.verseText: For the LORD will not forsake His people; He will never abandon His heritage.
contents: For the LORD will not forsake His people;
He will never abandon His heritage.

contents.verseText: Surely judgment will again be righteous, and all the upright in heart will follow it.
contents: Surely judgment will again be righteous,
and all the upright in heart will follow it.

contents.verseText: Who will rise up for me against the wicked? Who will stand for me against the workers of iniquity?
contents: Who will rise up for me against the wicked?
Who will stand for me against the workers of iniquity?

contents.verseText: Unless the LORD had been my helper, I would soon have dwelt in the abode of silence.
contents: Unless the LORD had been my helper,
I would soon have dwelt in the abode of silence.

contents.verseText: If I say, “My foot is slipping,” Your loving devotion, O LORD, supports me.
contents: If I say, “My foot is slipping,”
Your loving devotion, O LORD, supports me.

contents.verseText: When anxiety overwhelms me, Your consolation delights my soul.
contents: When anxiety overwhelms me,
Your consolation delights my soul.

contents.verseText: Can a corrupt throne be Your ally—one devising mischief by decree?
contents: Can a corrupt throne be Your ally—
one devising mischief by decree?

contents.verseText: They band together against the righteous and condemn the innocent to death.
contents: They band together against the righteous
and condemn the innocent to death.

footnote.ft: Or condemn innocent blood

contents.verseText: But the LORD has been my stronghold, and my God is my rock of refuge.
contents: But the LORD has been my stronghold,
and my God is my rock of refuge.

contents.verseText: He will bring upon them their own iniquity and destroy them for their wickedness. The LORD our God will destroy them.
contents: He will bring upon them their own iniquity
and destroy them for their wickedness.
The LORD our God will destroy them.

contents.verseText: Come, let us sing for joy to the LORD; let us shout to the Rock of our salvation!
contents: Come, let us sing for joy to the LORD;
let us shout to the Rock of our salvation!

contents.verseText: Let us enter His presence with thanksgiving; let us make a joyful noise to Him in song.
contents: Let us enter His presence with thanksgiving;
let us make a joyful noise to Him in song.

contents.verseText: For the LORD is a great God, a great King above all gods.
contents: For the LORD is a great God,
a great King above all gods.

contents.verseText: In His hand are the depths of the earth, and the mountain peaks belong to Him.
contents: In His hand are the depths of the earth,
and the mountain peaks belong to Him.

contents.verseText: The sea is His, for He made it, and His hands formed the dry land.
contents: The sea is His, for He made it,
and His hands formed the dry land.

contents.verseText: O come, let us worship and bow down; let us kneel before the LORD our Maker.
contents: O come, let us worship and bow down;
let us kneel before the LORD our Maker.

contents.verseText: For He is our God, and we are the people of His pasture, the sheep under His care. Today, if you hear His voice,
contents: For He is our God,
and we are the people of His pasture,
the sheep under His care.
Today, if you hear His voice,

contents.verseText: do not harden your hearts as you did at Meribah, in the day at Massah in the wilderness,
contents: do not harden your hearts
as you did at Meribah,

footnote.ft: LXX as you did in the rebellion; Meribah means quarreling; see Exodus 17:7; cited in Hebrews 3:15 and Hebrews 4:7.

contents: in the day at Massah in the wilderness,

footnote.ft: LXX in the day of testing in the wilderness; Massah means testing; see Exodus 17:7.

contents.verseText: where your fathers tested and tried Me, though they had seen My work.
contents: where your fathers tested and tried Me,
though they had seen My work.

contents.verseText: For forty years I was angry with that generation, and I said, “They are a people whose hearts go astray, and they have not known My ways.”
contents: For forty years I was angry with that generation,
and I said, “They are a people whose hearts go astray,

footnote.ft: LXX They always go astray in the heart

contents: and they have not known My ways.”

contents.verseText: So I swore on oath in My anger, “They shall never enter My rest.”
contents: So I swore on oath in My anger,
“They shall never enter My rest.”

footnote.ft: Cited in Hebrews 3:7–11, Hebrews 4:3, and Hebrews 4:5

s1: Sing to the LORD, All the Earth

contents.verseText: Sing to the LORD a new song; sing to the LORD, all the earth.
contents: Sing to the LORD a new song;
sing to the LORD, all the earth.

contents.verseText: Sing to the LORD, bless His name; proclaim His salvation day after day.
contents: Sing to the LORD, bless His name;
proclaim His salvation day after day.

contents.verseText: Declare His glory among the nations, His wonderful deeds among all peoples.
contents: Declare His glory among the nations,
His wonderful deeds among all peoples.

contents.verseText: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised; He is to be feared above all gods.
contents: For great is the LORD, and greatly to be praised;
He is to be feared above all gods.

contents.verseText: For all the gods of the nations are idols, but it is the LORD who made the heavens.
contents: For all the gods of the nations are idols,
but it is the LORD who made the heavens.

contents.verseText: Splendor and majesty are before Him; strength and beauty fill His sanctuary.
contents: Splendor and majesty are before Him;
strength and beauty fill His sanctuary.

contents.verseText: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the nations, ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.
contents: Ascribe to the LORD, O families of the nations,
ascribe to the LORD glory and strength.

contents.verseText: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name; bring an offering and enter His courts.
contents: Ascribe to the LORD the glory due His name;
bring an offering and enter His courts.

contents.verseText: Worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness; tremble before Him, all the earth.
contents: Worship the LORD in the splendor of His holiness;
tremble before Him, all the earth.

contents.verseText: Declare among the nations: “The LORD reigns!” The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved; He will judge the peoples with equity.
contents: Declare among the nations: “The LORD reigns!”
The world is firmly established; it cannot be moved;
He will judge the peoples with equity.

contents.verseText: Let the heavens be glad and the earth rejoice; let the sea resound, and all that fills it.
contents: Let the heavens be glad
and the earth rejoice;
let the sea resound,
and all that fills it.

contents.verseText: Let the fields exult, and all that is in them. Then all the trees of the forest will sing for joy
contents: Let the fields exult,
and all that is in them.
Then all the trees of the forest
will sing for joy

contents.verseText: before the LORD, for He is coming—He is coming to judge the earth. He will judge the world in righteousness and the peoples in His faithfulness.
contents: before the LORD,
for He is coming—
He is coming to judge the earth.
He will judge the world in righteousness
and the peoples in His faithfulness.

contents.verseText: The LORD reigns, let the earth rejoice; let the distant shores be glad.
contents: The LORD reigns, let the earth rejoice;
let the distant shores be glad.

contents.verseText: Clouds and darkness surround Him; righteousness and justice are His throne’s foundation.
contents: Clouds and darkness surround Him;
righteousness and justice are His throne’s foundation.

contents.verseText: Fire goes before Him and consumes His foes on every side.
contents: Fire goes before Him
and consumes His foes on every side.

contents.verseText: His lightning illuminates the world; the earth sees and trembles.
contents: His lightning illuminates the world;
the earth sees and trembles.

contents.verseText: The mountains melt like wax at the presence of the LORD, before the Lord of all the earth.
contents: The mountains melt like wax
at the presence of the LORD,
before the Lord of all the earth.

contents.verseText: The heavens proclaim His righteousness; all the peoples see His glory.
contents: The heavens proclaim His righteousness;
all the peoples see His glory.

contents.verseText: All worshipers of images are put to shame—those who boast in idols. Worship Him, all you gods!
contents: All worshipers of images are put to shame—
those who boast in idols.
Worship Him, all you gods!

contents.verseText: Zion hears and rejoices, and the towns of Judah exult because of Your judgments, O LORD.
contents: Zion hears and rejoices,
and the towns of Judah exult
because of Your judgments, O LORD.

contents.verseText: For You, O LORD, are Most High over all the earth; You are exalted far above all gods.
contents: For You, O LORD, are Most High over all the earth;
You are exalted far above all gods.

contents.verseText: Hate evil, O you who love the LORD! He preserves the souls of His saints; He delivers them from the hand of the wicked.
contents: Hate evil, O you who love the LORD!
He preserves the souls of His saints;
He delivers them from the hand of the wicked.

contents.verseText: Light shines on the righteous, gladness on the upright in heart.
contents: Light shines

footnote.ft: One Hebrew manuscript, LXX, Syriac, and Vulgate; most Hebrew manuscripts Light is sown

contents: on the righteous,
gladness on the upright in heart.

contents.verseText: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous ones, and praise His holy name.
contents: Rejoice in the LORD, you righteous ones,
and praise His holy name.

s1: Sing to the LORD a New Song

d: A Psalm.

contents.verseText: Sing to the LORD a new song, for He has done wonders; His right hand and holy arm have gained Him the victory.
contents: Sing to the LORD a new song,
for He has done wonders;
His right hand and holy arm
have gained Him the victory.

contents.verseText: The LORD has proclaimed His salvation and revealed His righteousness to the nations.
contents: The LORD has proclaimed His salvation
and revealed His righteousness to the nations.

contents.verseText: He has remembered His love and faithfulness to the house of Israel; all the ends of the earth have seen the salvation of our God.
contents: He has remembered His love and faithfulness
to the house of Israel;
all the ends of the earth
have seen the salvation of our God.

contents.verseText: Make a joyful noise to the LORD, all the earth; break forth—let your cry ring out, and sing praises!
contents: Make a joyful noise to the LORD, all the earth;
break forth—let your cry ring out, and sing praises!

contents.verseText: Sing praises to the LORD with the lyre, in melodious song with the harp.
contents: Sing praises to the LORD with the lyre,
in melodious song with the harp.

contents.verseText: With trumpets and the blast of the ram’s horn shout for joy before the LORD, the King.
contents: With trumpets and the blast of the ram’s horn
shout for joy before the LORD, the King.

contents.verseText: Let the sea resound, and all that fills it, the world, and all who dwell in it.
contents: Let the sea resound, and all that fills it,
the world, and all who dwell in it.

contents.verseText: Let the rivers clap their hands, let the mountains sing together for joy
contents: Let the rivers clap their hands,
let the mountains sing together for joy

contents.verseText: before the LORD, for He comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness and the peoples with equity.
contents: before the LORD,
for He comes to judge the earth.
He will judge the world with righteousness
and the peoples with equity.

contents.verseText: The LORD reigns; let the nations tremble! He is enthroned above the cherubim; let the earth quake!
contents: The LORD reigns;
let the nations tremble!
He is enthroned above the cherubim;
let the earth quake!

contents.verseText: Great is the LORD in Zion; He is exalted above all the peoples.
contents: Great is the LORD in Zion;
He is exalted above all the peoples.

contents.verseText: Let them praise Your great and awesome name—He is holy!
contents: Let them praise Your great and awesome name—
He is holy!

footnote.ft: Or it is holy!

contents.verseText: The mighty King loves justice. You have established equity; You have exercised justice and righteousness in Jacob.
contents: The mighty King loves justice.

footnote.ft: Or The might of the King loves justice.

contents: You have established equity;
You have exercised justice
and righteousness in Jacob.

contents.verseText: Exalt the LORD our God, and worship at His footstool; He is holy!
contents: Exalt the LORD our God,
and worship at His footstool;
He is holy!

contents.verseText: Moses and Aaron were among His priests; Samuel was among those who called on His name. They called to the LORD and He answered.
contents: Moses and Aaron were among His priests;
Samuel was among those who called on His name.
They called to the LORD and He answered.

contents.verseText: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud; they kept His decrees and the statutes He gave them.
contents: He spoke to them from the pillar of cloud;
they kept His decrees and the statutes He gave them.

contents.verseText: O LORD our God, You answered them. You were a forgiving God to them, yet an avenger of their misdeeds.
contents: O LORD our God, You answered them.
You were a forgiving God to them,
yet an avenger of their misdeeds.

contents.verseText: Exalt the LORD our God and worship at His holy mountain, for the LORD our God is holy.
contents: Exalt the LORD our God
and worship at His holy mountain,
for the LORD our God is holy.

d: A Psalm of thanksgiving.

contents.verseText: Make a joyful noise to the LORD, all the earth.
contents: Make a joyful noise to the LORD,
all the earth.

contents.verseText: Serve the LORD with gladness; come into His presence with joyful songs.
contents: Serve the LORD with gladness;
come into His presence with joyful songs.

contents.verseText: Know that the LORD is God. It is He who made us, and we are His; we are His people, and the sheep of His pasture.
contents: Know that the LORD is God.
It is He who made us, and we are His;

footnote.ft: Or and not we ourselves

contents: we are His people, and the sheep of His pasture.

contents.verseText: Enter His gates with thanksgiving and His courts with praise; give thanks to Him and bless His name.
contents: Enter His gates with thanksgiving
and His courts with praise;
give thanks to Him and bless His name.

contents.verseText: For the LORD is good, and His loving devotion endures forever; His faithfulness continues to all generations.
contents: For the LORD is good,
and His loving devotion endures forever;
His faithfulness continues to all generations.

s1: I Will Set No Worthless Thing before My Eyes

d: A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: I will sing of Your loving devotion and justice; to You, O LORD, I will sing praises.
contents: I will sing of Your loving devotion and justice;
to You, O LORD, I will sing praises.

contents.verseText: I will ponder the way that is blameless—when will You come to me? I will walk in my house with integrity of heart.
contents: I will ponder the way that is blameless—
when will You come to me?
I will walk in my house
with integrity of heart.

contents.verseText: I will set no worthless thing before my eyes. I hate the work of those who fall away; it shall not cling to me.
contents: I will set no worthless thing
before my eyes.
I hate the work of those who fall away;
it shall not cling to me.

contents.verseText: A perverse heart shall depart from me; I will know nothing of evil.
contents: A perverse heart shall depart from me;
I will know nothing of evil.

contents.verseText: Whoever slanders his neighbor in secret, I will put to silence; the one with haughty eyes and a proud heart, I will not endure.
contents: Whoever slanders his neighbor in secret,
I will put to silence;
the one with haughty eyes and a proud heart,
I will not endure.

contents.verseText: My eyes favor the faithful of the land, that they may dwell with me; he who walks in the way of integrity shall minister to me.
contents: My eyes favor the faithful of the land,
that they may dwell with me;
he who walks in the way of integrity
shall minister to me.

contents.verseText: No one who practices deceit shall dwell in my house; no one who tells lies shall stand in my presence.
contents: No one who practices deceit
shall dwell in my house;
no one who tells lies
shall stand in my presence.

contents.verseText: Every morning I will remove all the wicked of the land, that I may cut off every evildoer from the city of the LORD.
contents: Every morning I will remove all the wicked of the land,
that I may cut off every evildoer from the city of the LORD.

d: A prayer of one who is afflicted, when he grows faint and pours out his lament before the LORD.

contents.verseText: Hear my prayer, O LORD; let my cry for help come before You.
contents: Hear my prayer, O LORD;
let my cry for help come before You.

contents.verseText: Do not hide Your face from me in my day of distress. Incline Your ear to me; answer me quickly when I call.
contents: Do not hide Your face from me
in my day of distress.
Incline Your ear to me;
answer me quickly when I call.

contents.verseText: For my days vanish like smoke, and my bones burn like glowing embers.
contents: For my days vanish like smoke,
and my bones burn like glowing embers.

contents.verseText: My heart is afflicted, and withered like grass; I even forget to eat my bread.
contents: My heart is afflicted, and withered like grass;
I even forget to eat my bread.

contents.verseText: Through my loud groaning my flesh clings to my bones.
contents: Through my loud groaning
my flesh clings to my bones.

contents.verseText: I am like a desert owl, like an owl among the ruins.
contents: I am like a desert owl,
like an owl among the ruins.

contents.verseText: I lie awake; I am like a lone bird on a housetop.
contents: I lie awake;
I am like a lone bird on a housetop.

contents.verseText: All day long my enemies taunt me; they ridicule me and curse me.
contents: All day long my enemies taunt me;
they ridicule me and curse me.

contents.verseText: For I have eaten ashes like bread and mixed my drink with tears
contents: For I have eaten ashes like bread
and mixed my drink with tears

contents.verseText: because of Your indignation and wrath, for You have picked me up and cast me aside.
contents: because of Your indignation and wrath,
for You have picked me up and cast me aside.

contents.verseText: My days are like lengthening shadows, and I wither away like grass.
contents: My days are like lengthening shadows,
and I wither away like grass.

contents.verseText: But You, O LORD, sit enthroned forever; Your renown endures to all generations.
contents: But You, O LORD, sit enthroned forever;
Your renown endures to all generations.

contents.verseText: You will rise up and have compassion on Zion, for it is time to show her favor—the appointed time has come.
contents: You will rise up and have compassion on Zion,
for it is time to show her favor—
the appointed time has come.

contents.verseText: For Your servants delight in her stones and take pity on her dust.
contents: For Your servants delight in her stones
and take pity on her dust.

contents.verseText: So the nations will fear the name of the LORD, and all the kings of the earth will fear Your glory.
contents: So the nations will fear the name of the LORD,
and all the kings of the earth will fear Your glory.

contents.verseText: For the LORD will rebuild Zion; He has appeared in His glory.
contents: For the LORD will rebuild Zion;
He has appeared in His glory.

contents.verseText: He will turn toward the prayer of the destitute; He will not despise their prayer.
contents: He will turn toward the prayer of the destitute;
He will not despise their prayer.

contents.verseText: Let this be written for the generation to come, so that a people not yet created may praise the LORD.
contents: Let this be written for the generation to come,
so that a people not yet created may praise the LORD.

contents.verseText: For He looked down from the heights of His sanctuary; the LORD gazed out from heaven to earth
contents: For He looked down from the heights of His sanctuary;
the LORD gazed out from heaven to earth

contents.verseText: to hear a prisoner’s groaning, to release those condemned to death,
contents: to hear a prisoner’s groaning,
to release those condemned to death,

contents.verseText: that they may proclaim the name of the LORD in Zion and praise Him in Jerusalem,
contents: that they may proclaim the name of the LORD in Zion
and praise Him in Jerusalem,

contents.verseText: when peoples and kingdoms assemble to serve the LORD.
contents: when peoples and kingdoms assemble
to serve the LORD.

contents.verseText: He has broken my strength on the way; He has cut short my days.
contents: He has broken my strength on the way;
He has cut short my days.

contents.verseText: I say: “O my God, do not take me in the midst of my days! Your years go on through all generations.
contents: I say: “O my God, do not take me in the midst of my days!
Your years go on through all generations.

contents.verseText: In the beginning You laid the foundations of the earth, and the heavens are the work of Your hands.
contents: In the beginning You laid the foundations of the earth,
and the heavens are the work of Your hands.

contents.verseText: They will perish, but You remain; they will all wear out like a garment. Like clothing You will change them, and they will be passed on.
contents: They will perish, but You remain;
they will all wear out like a garment.
Like clothing You will change them,
and they will be passed on.

contents.verseText: But You remain the same, and Your years will never end.
contents: But You remain the same,
and Your years will never end.

footnote.ft: Cited in Hebrews 1:10–12

contents.verseText: The children of Your servants will dwell securely, and their descendants will be established before You.”
contents: The children of Your servants will dwell securely,
and their descendants will be established before You.”

s1: Bless the LORD, O My Soul

d: Of David.

contents.verseText: Bless the LORD, O my soul; all that is within me, bless His holy name.
contents: Bless the LORD, O my soul;
all that is within me, bless His holy name.

contents.verseText: Bless the LORD, O my soul, and do not forget all His kind deeds—
contents: Bless the LORD, O my soul,
and do not forget all His kind deeds—

contents.verseText: He who forgives all your iniquities and heals all your diseases,
contents: He who forgives all your iniquities
and heals all your diseases,

contents.verseText: who redeems your life from the Pit and crowns you with loving devotion and compassion,
contents: who redeems your life from the Pit
and crowns you with loving devotion and compassion,

contents.verseText: who satisfies you with good things, so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.
contents: who satisfies you with good things,
so that your youth is renewed like the eagle’s.

contents.verseText: The LORD executes righteousness and justice for all the oppressed.
contents: The LORD executes righteousness
and justice for all the oppressed.

contents.verseText: He made known His ways to Moses, His deeds to the people of Israel.
contents: He made known His ways to Moses,
His deeds to the people of Israel.

contents.verseText: The LORD is compassionate and gracious, slow to anger, abounding in loving devotion.
contents: The LORD is compassionate and gracious,
slow to anger, abounding in loving devotion.

contents.verseText: He will not always accuse us, nor harbor His anger forever.
contents: He will not always accuse us,
nor harbor His anger forever.

contents.verseText: He has not dealt with us according to our sins or repaid us according to our iniquities.
contents: He has not dealt with us according to our sins
or repaid us according to our iniquities.

contents.verseText: For as high as the heavens are above the earth, so great is His loving devotion for those who fear Him.
contents: For as high as the heavens are above the earth,
so great is His loving devotion for those who fear Him.

contents.verseText: As far as the east is from the west, so far has He removed our transgressions from us.
contents: As far as the east is from the west,
so far has He removed our transgressions from us.

contents.verseText: As a father has compassion on his children, so the LORD has compassion on those who fear Him.
contents: As a father has compassion on his children,
so the LORD has compassion on those who fear Him.

contents.verseText: For He knows our frame; He is mindful that we are dust.
contents: For He knows our frame;
He is mindful that we are dust.

contents.verseText: As for man, his days are like grass—he blooms like a flower of the field;
contents: As for man, his days are like grass—
he blooms like a flower of the field;

contents.verseText: when the wind passes over, it vanishes, and its place remembers it no more.
contents: when the wind passes over, it vanishes,
and its place remembers it no more.

contents.verseText: But from everlasting to everlasting the loving devotion of the LORD extends to those who fear Him, and His righteousness to their children’s children—
contents: But from everlasting to everlasting
the loving devotion of the LORD
extends to those who fear Him,
and His righteousness to their children’s children—

contents.verseText: to those who keep His covenant and remember to obey His precepts.
contents: to those who keep His covenant
and remember to obey His precepts.

contents.verseText: The LORD has established His throne in heaven, and His kingdom rules over all.
contents: The LORD has established His throne in heaven,
and His kingdom rules over all.

contents.verseText: Bless the LORD, all His angels mighty in strength who carry out His word, who hearken to the voice of His command.
contents: Bless the LORD, all His angels mighty in strength
who carry out His word,
who hearken to the voice of His command.

contents.verseText: Bless the LORD, all His hosts, you servants who do His will.
contents: Bless the LORD, all His hosts,
you servants who do His will.

contents.verseText: Bless the LORD, all His works in all places of His dominion. Bless the LORD, O my soul!
contents: Bless the LORD, all His works
in all places of His dominion.
Bless the LORD, O my soul!

s1: How Many Are Your Works, O LORD!

contents.verseText: Bless the LORD, O my soul! O LORD my God, You are very great; You are clothed with splendor and majesty.
contents: Bless the LORD, O my soul!
O LORD my God, You are very great;
You are clothed with splendor and majesty.

contents.verseText: He wraps Himself in light as with a garment; He stretches out the heavens like a tent,
contents: He wraps Himself in light as with a garment;
He stretches out the heavens like a tent,

contents.verseText: laying the beams of His chambers in the waters above, making the clouds His chariot, walking on the wings of the wind.
contents: laying the beams of His chambers
in the waters above,
making the clouds His chariot,
walking on the wings of the wind.

contents.verseText: He makes the winds His messengers, flames of fire His servants.
contents: He makes the winds His messengers,
flames of fire His servants.

footnote.ft: LXX He makes His angels winds, His servants flames of fire. Cited in Hebrews 1:7

contents.verseText: He set the earth on its foundations, never to be moved.
contents: He set the earth on its foundations,
never to be moved.

contents.verseText: You covered it with the deep like a garment; the waters stood above the mountains.
contents: You covered it with the deep like a garment;
the waters stood above the mountains.

contents.verseText: At Your rebuke the waters fled; at the sound of Your thunder they hurried away—
contents: At Your rebuke the waters fled;
at the sound of Your thunder they hurried away—

contents.verseText: the mountains rose and the valleys sank to the place You assigned for them—
contents: the mountains rose and the valleys sank
to the place You assigned for them—

contents.verseText: You set a boundary they cannot cross, that they may never again cover the earth.
contents: You set a boundary they cannot cross,
that they may never again cover the earth.

contents.verseText: He sends forth springs in the valleys; they flow between the mountains.
contents: He sends forth springs in the valleys;
they flow between the mountains.

contents.verseText: They give drink to every beast of the field; the wild donkeys quench their thirst.
contents: They give drink to every beast of the field;
the wild donkeys quench their thirst.

contents.verseText: The birds of the air nest beside the springs; they sing among the branches.
contents: The birds of the air nest beside the springs;
they sing among the branches.

contents.verseText: He waters the mountains from His chambers; the earth is satisfied by the fruit of His works.
contents: He waters the mountains from His chambers;
the earth is satisfied by the fruit of His works.

contents.verseText: He makes the grass grow for the livestock and provides crops for man to cultivate, bringing forth food from the earth:
contents: He makes the grass grow for the livestock
and provides crops for man to cultivate,
bringing forth food from the earth:

contents.verseText: wine that gladdens the heart of man, oil that makes his face to shine, and bread that sustains his heart.
contents: wine that gladdens the heart of man,
oil that makes his face to shine,
and bread that sustains his heart.

contents.verseText: The trees of the LORD have their fill, the cedars of Lebanon that He planted,
contents: The trees of the LORD have their fill,
the cedars of Lebanon that He planted,

contents.verseText: where the birds build their nests; the stork makes her home in the cypresses.
contents: where the birds build their nests;
the stork makes her home in the cypresses.

footnote.ft: Or pines or junipers or firs

contents.verseText: The high mountains are for the wild goats, the cliffs a refuge for the rock badgers.
contents: The high mountains are for the wild goats,
the cliffs a refuge for the rock badgers.

footnote.ft: Or the coneys or the hyraxes

contents.verseText: He made the moon to mark the seasons; the sun knows when to set.
contents: He made the moon to mark the seasons;
the sun knows when to set.

contents.verseText: You bring darkness, and it becomes night, when all the beasts of the forest prowl.
contents: You bring darkness, and it becomes night,
when all the beasts of the forest prowl.

contents.verseText: The young lions roar for their prey and seek their food from God.
contents: The young lions roar for their prey
and seek their food from God.

contents.verseText: The sun rises, and they withdraw; they lie down in their dens.
contents: The sun rises, and they withdraw;
they lie down in their dens.

contents.verseText: Man goes forth to his work and to his labor until evening.
contents: Man goes forth to his work
and to his labor until evening.

contents.verseText: How many are Your works, O LORD! In wisdom You have made them all; the earth is full of Your creatures.
contents: How many are Your works, O LORD!
In wisdom You have made them all;
the earth is full of Your creatures.

contents.verseText: Here is the sea, vast and wide, teeming with creatures beyond number, living things both great and small.
contents: Here is the sea, vast and wide,
teeming with creatures beyond number,
living things both great and small.

contents.verseText: There the ships pass, and Leviathan, which You formed to frolic there.
contents: There the ships pass,
and Leviathan, which You formed to frolic there.

contents.verseText: All creatures look to You to give them their food in due season.
contents: All creatures look to You
to give them their food in due season.

contents.verseText: When You give it to them, they gather it up; when You open Your hand, they are satisfied with good things.
contents: When You give it to them,
they gather it up;
when You open Your hand,
they are satisfied with good things.

contents.verseText: When You hide Your face, they are terrified; when You take away their breath, they die and return to dust.
contents: When You hide Your face,
they are terrified;
when You take away their breath,
they die and return to dust.

contents.verseText: When You send Your Spirit, they are created, and You renew the face of the earth.
contents: When You send Your Spirit,

footnote.ft: Or breath

contents: they are created,
and You renew
the face of the earth.

contents.verseText: May the glory of the LORD endure forever; may the LORD rejoice in His works.
contents: May the glory of the LORD endure forever;
may the LORD rejoice in His works.

contents.verseText: He looks on the earth, and it trembles; He touches the mountains, and they smolder.
contents: He looks on the earth,
and it trembles;
He touches the mountains,
and they smolder.

contents.verseText: I will sing to the LORD all my life; I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.
contents: I will sing to the LORD all my life;
I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

contents.verseText: May my meditation be pleasing to Him, for I rejoice in the LORD.
contents: May my meditation be pleasing to Him,
for I rejoice in the LORD.

contents.verseText: May sinners vanish from the earth and the wicked be no more. Bless the LORD, O my soul. Hallelujah!
contents: May sinners vanish from the earth
and the wicked be no more.
Bless the LORD, O my soul.
Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the LORD, call upon His name; make known His deeds among the nations.
contents: Give thanks to the LORD, call upon His name;
make known His deeds among the nations.

contents.verseText: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him; tell of all His wonders.
contents: Sing to Him, sing praises to Him;
tell of all His wonders.

contents.verseText: Glory in His holy name; let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.
contents: Glory in His holy name;
let the hearts of those who seek the LORD rejoice.

contents.verseText: Seek out the LORD and His strength; seek His face always.
contents: Seek out the LORD and His strength;
seek His face always.

contents.verseText: Remember the wonders He has done, His marvels, and the judgments He has pronounced,
contents: Remember the wonders He has done,
His marvels, and the judgments He has pronounced,

contents.verseText: O offspring of His servant Abraham, O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.
contents: O offspring of His servant Abraham,
O sons of Jacob, His chosen ones.

contents.verseText: He is the LORD our God; His judgments carry throughout the earth.
contents: He is the LORD our God;
His judgments carry throughout the earth.

contents.verseText: He remembers His covenant forever, the word He ordained for a thousand generations—
contents: He remembers His covenant forever,
the word He ordained for a thousand generations—

contents.verseText: the covenant He made with Abraham, and the oath He swore to Isaac.
contents: the covenant He made with Abraham,
and the oath He swore to Isaac.

contents.verseText: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree, to Israel as an everlasting covenant:
contents: He confirmed it to Jacob as a decree,
to Israel as an everlasting covenant:

contents.verseText: “I will give you the land of Canaan as the portion of your inheritance.”
contents: “I will give you the land of Canaan
as the portion of your inheritance.”

contents.verseText: When they were few in number, few indeed, and strangers in the land,
contents: When they were few in number,
few indeed, and strangers in the land,

contents.verseText: they wandered from nation to nation, from one kingdom to another.
contents: they wandered from nation to nation,
from one kingdom to another.

contents.verseText: He let no man oppress them; He rebuked kings on their behalf:
contents: He let no man oppress them;
He rebuked kings on their behalf:

contents.verseText: “Do not touch My anointed ones! Do no harm to My prophets!”
contents: “Do not touch My anointed ones!
Do no harm to My prophets!”

contents.verseText: He called down famine on the land and cut off all their supplies of food.
contents: He called down famine on the land
and cut off all their supplies

footnote.ft: Hebrew staff

contents: of food.

contents.verseText: He sent a man before them—Joseph, sold as a slave.
contents: He sent a man before them—
Joseph, sold as a slave.

contents.verseText: They bruised his feet with shackles and placed his neck in irons,
contents: They bruised his feet with shackles
and placed his neck in irons,

contents.verseText: until his prediction came true and the word of the LORD proved him right.
contents: until his prediction came true
and the word of the LORD proved him right.

contents.verseText: The king sent and released him; the ruler of peoples set him free.
contents: The king sent and released him;
the ruler of peoples set him free.

contents.verseText: He made him master of his household, ruler over all his substance,
contents: He made him master of his household,
ruler over all his substance,

contents.verseText: to instruct his princes as he pleased and teach his elders wisdom.
contents: to instruct

footnote.ft: LXX and Syriac; MT to bind

contents: his princes as he pleased
and teach his elders wisdom.

contents.verseText: Then Israel entered Egypt; Jacob dwelt in the land of Ham.
contents: Then Israel entered Egypt;
Jacob dwelt in the land of Ham.

contents.verseText: And the LORD made His people very fruitful, more numerous than their foes,
contents: And the LORD made His people very fruitful,
more numerous than their foes,

contents.verseText: whose hearts He turned to hate His people, to conspire against His servants.
contents: whose hearts He turned to hate His people,
to conspire against His servants.

contents.verseText: He sent Moses His servant, and Aaron, whom He had chosen.
contents: He sent Moses His servant,
and Aaron, whom He had chosen.

contents.verseText: They performed His miraculous signs among them, and wonders in the land of Ham.
contents: They performed His miraculous signs among them,
and wonders in the land of Ham.

contents.verseText: He sent darkness, and it became dark—yet they defied His words.
contents: He sent darkness, and it became dark—
yet they defied His words.

footnote.ft: LXX and Syriac; Hebrew for had they not defied His words?

contents.verseText: He turned their waters to blood and caused their fish to die.
contents: He turned their waters to blood
and caused their fish to die.

contents.verseText: Their land teemed with frogs, even in their royal chambers.
contents: Their land teemed with frogs,
even in their royal chambers.

contents.verseText: He spoke, and insects swarmed—gnats throughout their country.
contents: He spoke, and insects swarmed—
gnats throughout their country.

contents.verseText: He gave them hail for rain, with lightning throughout their land.
contents: He gave them hail for rain,
with lightning throughout their land.

contents.verseText: He struck their vines and fig trees and shattered the trees of their country.
contents: He struck their vines and fig trees
and shattered the trees of their country.

contents.verseText: He spoke, and the locusts came—young locusts without number.
contents: He spoke, and the locusts came—
young locusts without number.

contents.verseText: They devoured every plant in their land and consumed the produce of their soil.
contents: They devoured every plant in their land
and consumed the produce of their soil.

contents.verseText: Then He struck all the firstborn in their land, the firstfruits of all their vigor.
contents: Then He struck all the firstborn in their land,
the firstfruits of all their vigor.

contents.verseText: He brought Israel out with silver and gold, and none among His tribes stumbled.
contents: He brought Israel out with silver and gold,
and none among His tribes stumbled.

contents.verseText: Egypt was glad when they departed, for the dread of Israel had fallen on them.
contents: Egypt was glad when they departed,
for the dread of Israel had fallen on them.

contents.verseText: He spread a cloud as a covering and a fire to light up the night.
contents: He spread a cloud as a covering
and a fire to light up the night.

contents.verseText: They asked, and He brought quail and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.
contents: They asked, and He brought quail
and satisfied them with the bread of heaven.

contents.verseText: He opened a rock, and water gushed out; it flowed like a river in the desert.
contents: He opened a rock, and water gushed out;
it flowed like a river in the desert.

contents.verseText: For He remembered His holy promise to Abraham His servant.
contents: For He remembered His holy promise
to Abraham His servant.

contents.verseText: He brought forth His people with rejoicing, His chosen with shouts of joy.
contents: He brought forth His people with rejoicing,
His chosen with shouts of joy.

contents.verseText: He gave them the lands of the nations, that they might inherit the fruit of others’ labor,
contents: He gave them the lands of the nations,
that they might inherit the fruit of others’ labor,

contents.verseText: that they might keep His statutes and obey His laws. Hallelujah!
contents: that they might keep His statutes
and obey His laws.
Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD

s1: Give Thanks to the LORD, for He Is Good

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verse 48

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good;
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: Who can describe the mighty acts of the LORD or fully proclaim His praise?
contents: Who can describe the mighty acts of the LORD
or fully proclaim His praise?

contents.verseText: Blessed are those who uphold justice, who practice righteousness at all times.
contents: Blessed are those who uphold justice,
who practice righteousness at all times.

contents.verseText: Remember me, O LORD, in Your favor to Your people; visit me with Your salvation,
contents: Remember me, O LORD, in Your favor to Your people;
visit me with Your salvation,

contents.verseText: that I may see the prosperity of Your chosen ones, and rejoice in the gladness of Your nation, and give glory with Your inheritance.
contents: that I may see the prosperity of Your chosen ones,
and rejoice in the gladness of Your nation,
and give glory with Your inheritance.

contents.verseText: We have sinned like our fathers; we have done wrong and acted wickedly.
contents: We have sinned like our fathers;
we have done wrong and acted wickedly.

contents.verseText: Our fathers in Egypt did not grasp Your wonders or remember Your abundant kindness; but they rebelled by the sea, there at the Red Sea.
contents: Our fathers in Egypt did not grasp Your wonders
or remember Your abundant kindness;
but they rebelled by the sea,
there at the Red Sea.

footnote.ft: Or the Sea of Reeds; also in verses 9 and 22

contents.verseText: Yet He saved them for the sake of His name, to make His power known.
contents: Yet He saved them for the sake of His name,
to make His power known.

contents.verseText: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up; He led them through the depths as through a desert.
contents: He rebuked the Red Sea, and it dried up;
He led them through the depths as through a desert.

contents.verseText: He saved them from the hand that hated them; He redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
contents: He saved them from the hand that hated them;
He redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

contents.verseText: The waters covered their foes; not one of them remained.
contents: The waters covered their foes;
not one of them remained.

contents.verseText: Then they believed His promises and sang His praise.
contents: Then they believed His promises
and sang His praise.

contents.verseText: Yet they soon forgot His works and failed to wait for His counsel.
contents: Yet they soon forgot His works
and failed to wait for His counsel.

contents.verseText: They craved intensely in the wilderness and tested God in the desert.
contents: They craved intensely in the wilderness
and tested God in the desert.

contents.verseText: So He granted their request, but sent a wasting disease upon them.
contents: So He granted their request,
but sent a wasting disease upon them.

contents.verseText: In the camp they envied Moses, as well as Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.
contents: In the camp they envied Moses,
as well as Aaron, the holy one of the LORD.

contents.verseText: The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan; it covered the assembly of Abiram.
contents: The earth opened up and swallowed Dathan;
it covered the assembly of Abiram.

contents.verseText: Then fire blazed through their company; flames consumed the wicked.
contents: Then fire blazed through their company;
flames consumed the wicked.

contents.verseText: At Horeb they made a calf and worshiped a molten image.
contents: At Horeb

footnote.ft: That is, Mount Sinai, or possibly a mountain in the range containing Mount Sinai

contents: they made a calf
and worshiped a molten image.

contents.verseText: They exchanged their Glory for the image of a grass-eating ox.
contents: They exchanged their Glory

footnote.ft: Or their glorious God

contents: for the image of a grass-eating ox.

contents.verseText: They forgot God their Savior, who did great things in Egypt,
contents: They forgot God their Savior,
who did great things in Egypt,

contents.verseText: wondrous works in the land of Ham, and awesome deeds by the Red Sea.
contents: wondrous works in the land of Ham,
and awesome deeds by the Red Sea.

contents.verseText: So He said He would destroy them—had not Moses His chosen one stood before Him in the breach to divert His wrath from destroying them.
contents: So He said He would destroy them—
had not Moses His chosen one
stood before Him in the breach
to divert His wrath from destroying them.

contents.verseText: They despised the pleasant land; they did not believe His promise.
contents: They despised the pleasant land;
they did not believe His promise.

contents.verseText: They grumbled in their tents and did not listen to the voice of the LORD.
contents: They grumbled in their tents
and did not listen to the voice of the LORD.

contents.verseText: So He raised His hand and swore to cast them down in the wilderness,
contents: So He raised His hand and swore
to cast them down in the wilderness,

contents.verseText: to disperse their offspring among the nations and scatter them throughout the lands.
contents: to disperse

footnote.ft: Or cast down or cause to fall

contents: their offspring among the nations
and scatter them throughout the lands.

contents.verseText: They yoked themselves to Baal of Peor and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods.
contents: They yoked themselves to Baal of Peor
and ate sacrifices offered to lifeless gods.

contents.verseText: So they provoked the LORD to anger with their deeds, and a plague broke out among them.
contents: So they provoked the LORD to anger with their deeds,
and a plague broke out among them.

contents.verseText: But Phinehas stood and intervened, and the plague was restrained.
contents: But Phinehas stood and intervened,
and the plague was restrained.

contents.verseText: It was credited to him as righteousness for endless generations to come.
contents: It was credited to him as righteousness
for endless generations to come.

contents.verseText: At the waters of Meribah they angered the LORD, and trouble came to Moses because of them.
contents: At the waters of Meribah

footnote.ft: Meribah means quarreling; see Exodus 17:7.

contents: they angered the LORD,
and trouble came to Moses because of them.

contents.verseText: For they rebelled against His Spirit, and Moses spoke rashly with his lips.
contents: For they rebelled against His Spirit,

footnote.ft: Or they provoked His Spirit

contents: and Moses spoke rashly with his lips.

contents.verseText: They did not destroy the peoples as the LORD had commanded them,
contents: They did not destroy the peoples
as the LORD had commanded them,

contents.verseText: but they mingled with the nations and adopted their customs.
contents: but they mingled with the nations
and adopted their customs.

contents.verseText: They worshiped their idols, which became a snare to them.
contents: They worshiped their idols,
which became a snare to them.

contents.verseText: They sacrificed their sons and their daughters to demons.
contents: They sacrificed their sons
and their daughters to demons.

contents.verseText: They shed innocent blood—the blood of their sons and daughters, whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan, and the land was polluted with blood.
contents: They shed innocent blood—
the blood of their sons and daughters,
whom they sacrificed to the idols of Canaan,
and the land was polluted with blood.

contents.verseText: They defiled themselves by their actions and prostituted themselves by their deeds.
contents: They defiled themselves by their actions
and prostituted themselves by their deeds.

contents.verseText: So the anger of the LORD burned against His people, and He abhorred His own inheritance.
contents: So the anger of the LORD burned against His people,
and He abhorred His own inheritance.

contents.verseText: He delivered them into the hand of the nations, and those who hated them ruled over them.
contents: He delivered them into the hand of the nations,
and those who hated them ruled over them.

contents.verseText: Their enemies oppressed them, and subdued them under their hand.
contents: Their enemies oppressed them,
and subdued them under their hand.

contents.verseText: Many times He rescued them, but they were bent on rebellion and sank down in their iniquity.
contents: Many times He rescued them,
but they were bent on rebellion
and sank down in their iniquity.

contents.verseText: Nevertheless He heard their cry; He took note of their distress.
contents: Nevertheless He heard their cry;
He took note of their distress.

contents.verseText: And He remembered His covenant with them, and relented by the abundance of His loving devotion.
contents: And He remembered His covenant with them,
and relented by the abundance of His loving devotion.

contents.verseText: He made them objects of compassion to all who held them captive.
contents: He made them objects of compassion
to all who held them captive.

contents.verseText: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from the nations, that we may give thanks to Your holy name, that we may glory in Your praise.
contents: Save us, O LORD our God,
and gather us from the nations,
that we may give thanks to Your holy name,
that we may glory in Your praise.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel, from everlasting to everlasting. Let all the people say, “Amen!” Hallelujah!
contents: Blessed be the LORD, the God of Israel,
from everlasting to everlasting.
Let all the people say, “Amen!”
Hallelujah!

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good;
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so, whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy
contents: Let the redeemed of the LORD say so,
whom He has redeemed from the hand of the enemy

contents.verseText: and gathered from the lands, from east and west, from north and south.
contents: and gathered from the lands,
from east and west, from north and south.

footnote.ft: Hebrew north and the sea

contents.verseText: Some wandered in desert wastelands, finding no path to a city in which to dwell.
contents: Some wandered in desert wastelands,
finding no path to a city in which to dwell.

contents.verseText: They were hungry and thirsty; their soul fainted within them.
contents: They were hungry and thirsty;
their soul fainted within them.

contents.verseText: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and He delivered them from their distress.
contents: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble,
and He delivered them from their distress.

contents.verseText: He led them on a straight path to reach a city where they could live.
contents: He led them on a straight path
to reach a city where they could live.

contents.verseText: Let them give thanks to the LORD for His loving devotion and His wonders to the sons of men.
contents: Let them give thanks to the LORD for His loving devotion
and His wonders to the sons of men.

contents.verseText: For He satisfies the thirsty and fills the hungry with good things.
contents: For He satisfies the thirsty
and fills the hungry with good things.

contents.verseText: Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death, prisoners in affliction and chains,
contents: Some sat in darkness and in the shadow of death,
prisoners in affliction and chains,

contents.verseText: because they rebelled against the words of God and despised the counsel of the Most High.
contents: because they rebelled against the words of God
and despised the counsel of the Most High.

contents.verseText: He humbled their hearts with hard labor; they stumbled, and there was no one to help.
contents: He humbled their hearts with hard labor;
they stumbled, and there was no one to help.

contents.verseText: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and He saved them from their distress.
contents: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble,
and He saved them from their distress.

contents.verseText: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death and broke away their chains.
contents: He brought them out of darkness and the shadow of death
and broke away their chains.

contents.verseText: Let them give thanks to the LORD for His loving devotion and His wonders to the sons of men.
contents: Let them give thanks to the LORD for His loving devotion
and His wonders to the sons of men.

contents.verseText: For He has broken down the gates of bronze and cut through the bars of iron.
contents: For He has broken down the gates of bronze
and cut through the bars of iron.

contents.verseText: Fools, in their rebellious ways, and through their iniquities, suffered affliction.
contents: Fools, in their rebellious ways,
and through their iniquities, suffered affliction.

contents.verseText: They loathed all food and drew near to the gates of death.
contents: They loathed all food
and drew near to the gates of death.

contents.verseText: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and He saved them from their distress.
contents: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble,
and He saved them from their distress.

contents.verseText: He sent forth His word and healed them; He rescued them from the Pit.
contents: He sent forth His word and healed them;
He rescued them from the Pit.

contents.verseText: Let them give thanks to the LORD for His loving devotion and His wonders to the sons of men.
contents: Let them give thanks to the LORD for His loving devotion
and His wonders to the sons of men.

contents.verseText: Let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving and declare His works with rejoicing.
contents: Let them offer sacrifices of thanksgiving
and declare His works with rejoicing.

contents.verseText: Others went out to sea in ships, conducting trade on the mighty waters.
contents: Others went out to sea in ships,
conducting trade on the mighty waters.

contents.verseText: They saw the works of the LORD, and His wonders in the deep.
contents: They saw the works of the LORD,
and His wonders in the deep.

contents.verseText: For He spoke and raised a tempest that lifted the waves of the sea.
contents: For He spoke and raised a tempest
that lifted the waves of the sea.

contents.verseText: They mounted up to the heavens, then sunk to the depths; their courage melted in their anguish.
contents: They mounted up to the heavens, then sunk to the depths;
their courage melted in their anguish.

contents.verseText: They reeled and staggered like drunkards, and all their skill was useless.
contents: They reeled and staggered like drunkards,
and all their skill was useless.

footnote.ft: Or and all their wisdom was swallowed up or and they were at their wits’ end

contents.verseText: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble, and He brought them out of their distress.
contents: Then they cried out to the LORD in their trouble,
and He brought them out of their distress.

contents.verseText: He calmed the storm to a whisper, and the waves of the sea were hushed.
contents: He calmed the storm to a whisper,
and the waves of the sea

footnote.ft: DSS; MT their waves

contents: were hushed.

contents.verseText: They rejoiced in the silence, and He guided them to the harbor they desired.
contents: They rejoiced in the silence,
and He guided them to the harbor they desired.

contents.verseText: Let them give thanks to the LORD for His loving devotion and His wonders to the sons of men.
contents: Let them give thanks to the LORD for His loving devotion
and His wonders to the sons of men.

contents.verseText: Let them exalt Him in the assembly of the people and praise Him in the council of the elders.
contents: Let them exalt Him in the assembly of the people
and praise Him in the council of the elders.

contents.verseText: He turns rivers into deserts, springs of water into thirsty ground,
contents: He turns rivers into deserts,
springs of water into thirsty ground,

contents.verseText: and fruitful land into fields of salt, because of the wickedness of its dwellers.
contents: and fruitful land into fields of salt,
because of the wickedness of its dwellers.

contents.verseText: He turns a desert into pools of water and a dry land into flowing springs.
contents: He turns a desert into pools of water
and a dry land into flowing springs.

contents.verseText: He causes the hungry to settle there, that they may establish a city in which to dwell.
contents: He causes the hungry to settle there,
that they may establish a city in which to dwell.

contents.verseText: They sow fields and plant vineyards that yield a fruitful harvest.
contents: They sow fields and plant vineyards
that yield a fruitful harvest.

contents.verseText: He blesses them, and they multiply greatly; He does not let their herds diminish.
contents: He blesses them, and they multiply greatly;
He does not let their herds diminish.

contents.verseText: When they are decreased and humbled by oppression, evil, and sorrow,
contents: When they are decreased and humbled
by oppression, evil, and sorrow,

contents.verseText: He pours out contempt on the nobles and makes them wander in a trackless wasteland.
contents: He pours out contempt on the nobles
and makes them wander in a trackless wasteland.

contents.verseText: But He lifts the needy from affliction and increases their families like flocks.
contents: But He lifts the needy from affliction
and increases their families like flocks.

contents.verseText: The upright see and rejoice, and all iniquity shuts its mouth.
contents: The upright see and rejoice,
and all iniquity shuts its mouth.

contents.verseText: Let him who is wise pay heed to these things and consider the loving devotion of the LORD.
contents: Let him who is wise pay heed to these things
and consider the loving devotion of the LORD.

d: A song. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: My heart is steadfast, O God; I will sing and make music with all my being.
contents: My heart is steadfast, O God;
I will sing and make music with all my being.

footnote.ft: Or with my glory

contents.verseText: Awake, O harp and lyre! I will awaken the dawn.
contents: Awake, O harp and lyre!
I will awaken the dawn.

contents.verseText: I will praise You, O LORD, among the nations; I will sing Your praises among the peoples.
contents: I will praise You, O LORD, among the nations;
I will sing Your praises among the peoples.

contents.verseText: For Your loving devotion extends beyond the heavens, and Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.
contents: For Your loving devotion extends beyond the heavens,
and Your faithfulness reaches to the clouds.

contents.verseText: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens; may Your glory cover all the earth.
contents: Be exalted, O God, above the heavens;
may Your glory cover all the earth.

contents.verseText: Respond and save us with Your right hand, that Your beloved may be delivered.
contents: Respond and save us with Your right hand,
that Your beloved may be delivered.

contents.verseText: God has spoken from His sanctuary: “I will triumph! I will parcel out Shechem and apportion the Valley of Succoth.
contents: God has spoken from His sanctuary:

footnote.ft: Or in His holiness

contents: “I will triumph!
I will parcel out Shechem
and apportion the Valley of Succoth.

contents.verseText: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine; Ephraim is My helmet, Judah is My scepter.
contents: Gilead is Mine, and Manasseh is Mine;
Ephraim is My helmet, Judah is My scepter.

contents.verseText: Moab is My washbasin; upon Edom I toss My sandal; over Philistia I shout in triumph.”
contents: Moab is My washbasin;
upon Edom I toss My sandal;
over Philistia I shout in triumph.”

contents.verseText: Who will bring me to the fortified city? Who will lead me to Edom?
contents: Who will bring me to the fortified city?
Who will lead me to Edom?

contents.verseText: Have You not rejected us, O God? Will You no longer march out, O God, with our armies?
contents: Have You not rejected us, O God?
Will You no longer march out, O God, with our armies?

contents.verseText: Give us aid against the enemy, for the help of man is worthless.
contents: Give us aid against the enemy,
for the help of man is worthless.

contents.verseText: With God we will perform with valor, and He will trample our enemies.
contents: With God we will perform with valor,
and He will trample our enemies.

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: O God of my praise, be not silent.
contents: O God of my praise,
be not silent.

contents.verseText: For wicked and deceitful mouths open against me; they speak against me with lying tongues.
contents: For wicked and deceitful mouths open against me;
they speak against me with lying tongues.

contents.verseText: They surround me with hateful words and attack me without cause.
contents: They surround me with hateful words
and attack me without cause.

contents.verseText: In return for my love they accuse me, but I am a man of prayer.
contents: In return for my love they accuse me,
but I am a man of prayer.

contents.verseText: They repay me evil for good, and hatred for my love.
contents: They repay me evil for good,
and hatred for my love.

contents.verseText: Set over him a wicked man; let an accuser stand at his right hand.
contents: Set over him a wicked man;
let an accuser stand at his right hand.

contents.verseText: When he is tried, let him be found guilty, and may his prayer be regarded as sin.
contents: When he is tried, let him be found guilty,
and may his prayer be regarded as sin.

contents.verseText: May his days be few; may another take his position.
contents: May his days be few;
may another take his position.

footnote.ft: Cited in Acts 1:20

contents.verseText: May his children be fatherless and his wife a widow.
contents: May his children be fatherless
and his wife a widow.

contents.verseText: May his children wander as beggars, seeking sustenance far from their ruined homes.
contents: May his children wander as beggars,
seeking sustenance

footnote.ft: Hebrew; LXX may they be driven

contents: far from their ruined homes.

contents.verseText: May the creditor seize all he owns, and strangers plunder the fruits of his labor.
contents: May the creditor seize all he owns,
and strangers plunder the fruits of his labor.

contents.verseText: May there be no one to extend kindness to him, and no one to favor his fatherless children.
contents: May there be no one to extend kindness to him,
and no one to favor his fatherless children.

contents.verseText: May his descendants be cut off; may their name be blotted out from the next generation.
contents: May his descendants be cut off;
may their name be blotted out from the next generation.

contents.verseText: May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the LORD, and the sin of his mother never be blotted out.
contents: May the iniquity of his fathers be remembered before the LORD,
and the sin of his mother never be blotted out.

contents.verseText: May their sins always remain before the LORD, that He may cut off their memory from the earth.
contents: May their sins always remain before the LORD,
that He may cut off their memory from the earth.

contents.verseText: For he never thought to show kindness, but pursued the poor and needy and brokenhearted, even to their death.
contents: For he never thought to show kindness,
but pursued the poor and needy and brokenhearted,
even to their death.

contents.verseText: The cursing that he loved, may it fall on him; the blessing in which he refused to delight, may it be far from him.
contents: The cursing that he loved,
may it fall on him;
the blessing in which he refused to delight,
may it be far from him.

contents.verseText: The cursing that he wore like a coat, may it soak into his body like water, and into his bones like oil.
contents: The cursing that he wore like a coat,
may it soak into his body like water,
and into his bones like oil.

contents.verseText: May it be like a robe wrapped about him, like a belt tied forever around him.
contents: May it be like a robe wrapped about him,
like a belt tied forever around him.

contents.verseText: May this be the LORD’s reward to my accusers, to those who speak evil against me.
contents: May this be the LORD’s reward to my accusers,
to those who speak evil against me.

contents.verseText: But You, O GOD, the Lord, deal kindly with me for the sake of Your name; deliver me by the goodness of Your loving devotion.
contents: But You, O GOD, the Lord,
deal kindly with me for the sake of Your name;
deliver me by the goodness of Your loving devotion.

contents.verseText: For I am poor and needy; my heart is wounded within me.
contents: For I am poor and needy;
my heart is wounded within me.

contents.verseText: I am fading away like a lengthening shadow; I am shaken off like a locust.
contents: I am fading away like a lengthening shadow;
I am shaken off like a locust.

contents.verseText: My knees are weak from fasting, and my body grows lean and gaunt.
contents: My knees are weak from fasting,
and my body grows lean and gaunt.

contents.verseText: I am an object of scorn to my accusers; when they see me, they shake their heads.
contents: I am an object of scorn to my accusers;
when they see me, they shake their heads.

contents.verseText: Help me, O LORD my God; save me according to Your loving devotion.
contents: Help me, O LORD my God;
save me according to Your loving devotion.

contents.verseText: Let them know that this is Your hand, that You, O LORD, have done it.
contents: Let them know that this is Your hand,
that You, O LORD, have done it.

contents.verseText: Though they curse, You will bless. When they rise up, they will be put to shame, but Your servant will rejoice.
contents: Though they curse, You will bless.
When they rise up, they will be put to shame,
but Your servant will rejoice.

contents.verseText: May my accusers be clothed with disgrace; may they wear their shame like a robe.
contents: May my accusers be clothed with disgrace;
may they wear their shame like a robe.

contents.verseText: With my mouth I will thank the LORD profusely; I will praise Him in the presence of many.
contents: With my mouth I will thank the LORD profusely;
I will praise Him in the presence of many.

contents.verseText: For He stands at the right hand of the needy one, to save him from the condemners of his soul.
contents: For He stands at the right hand of the needy one,
to save him from the condemners of his soul.

d: A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: The LORD said to my Lord: “Sit at My right hand until I make Your enemies a footstool for Your feet.”
contents: The LORD said to my Lord:
“Sit at My right hand
until I make Your enemies
a footstool for Your feet.”

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 22:44, Mark 12:36; Luke 20:42–43, Acts 2:34–35, and Hebrews 1:13

contents.verseText: The LORD extends Your mighty scepter from Zion: “Rule in the midst of Your enemies.”
contents: The LORD extends Your mighty scepter from Zion:
“Rule in the midst of Your enemies.”

contents.verseText: Your people shall be willing on Your day of battle. Arrayed in holy splendor, from the womb of the dawn, to You belongs the dew of Your youth.
contents: Your people shall be willing
on Your day of battle.
Arrayed in holy splendor, from the womb of the dawn,
to You belongs the dew of Your youth.

contents.verseText: The LORD has sworn and will not change His mind: “You are a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.”
contents: The LORD has sworn
and will not change His mind:
“You are a priest forever
in the order of Melchizedek.”

footnote.ft: Cited in Hebrews 5:6, Hebrews 7:17, and Hebrews 7:21

contents.verseText: The Lord is at Your right hand; He will crush kings in the day of His wrath.
contents: The Lord is at Your right hand;
He will crush kings in the day of His wrath.

contents.verseText: He will judge the nations, heaping up the dead; He will crush the leaders far and wide.
contents: He will judge the nations, heaping up the dead;
He will crush the leaders far and wide.

contents.verseText: He will drink from the brook by the road; therefore He will lift up His head.
contents: He will drink from the brook by the road;
therefore He will lift up His head.

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD. This psalm is an acrostic poem, each line beginning with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet.

contents.verseText: I will give thanks to the LORD with all my heart in the council of the upright and in the assembly.
contents: I will give thanks to the LORD with all my heart
in the council of the upright and in the assembly.

contents.verseText: Great are the works of the LORD; they are pondered by all who delight in them.
contents: Great are the works of the LORD;
