they are pondered by all who delight in them.

contents.verseText: Splendid and majestic is His work; His righteousness endures forever.
contents: Splendid and majestic is His work;
His righteousness endures forever.

contents.verseText: He has caused His wonders to be remembered; the LORD is gracious and compassionate.
contents: He has caused His wonders to be remembered;
the LORD is gracious and compassionate.

contents.verseText: He provides food for those who fear Him; He remembers His covenant forever.
contents: He provides food for those who fear Him;
He remembers His covenant forever.

contents.verseText: He has shown His people the power of His works by giving them the inheritance of the nations.
contents: He has shown His people the power of His works
by giving them the inheritance of the nations.

contents.verseText: The works of His hands are truth and justice; all His precepts are trustworthy.
contents: The works of His hands are truth and justice;
all His precepts are trustworthy.

contents.verseText: They are upheld forever and ever, enacted in truth and uprightness.
contents: They are upheld forever and ever,
enacted in truth and uprightness.

contents.verseText: He has sent redemption to His people; He has ordained His covenant forever; holy and awesome is His name.
contents: He has sent redemption to His people;
He has ordained His covenant forever;
holy and awesome is His name.

contents.verseText: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom; all who follow His precepts gain rich understanding. His praise endures forever!
contents: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of wisdom;
all who follow His precepts gain rich understanding.
His praise endures forever!

s1: The Blessed Fear of the LORD

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD. This psalm is an acrostic poem, each line beginning with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet.

contents.verseText: Blessed is the man who fears the LORD, who greatly delights in His commandments.
contents: Blessed is the man who fears the LORD,
who greatly delights in His commandments.

contents.verseText: His descendants will be mighty in the land; the generation of the upright will be blessed.
contents: His descendants will be mighty in the land;
the generation of the upright will be blessed.

contents.verseText: Wealth and riches are in his house, and his righteousness endures forever.
contents: Wealth and riches are in his house,
and his righteousness endures forever.

contents.verseText: Light dawns in the darkness for the upright—for the gracious, compassionate, and righteous.
contents: Light dawns in the darkness for the upright—
for the gracious, compassionate, and righteous.

contents.verseText: It is well with the man who is generous and lends freely, whose affairs are guided by justice.
contents: It is well with the man who is generous and lends freely,
whose affairs are guided by justice.

contents.verseText: Surely he will never be shaken; the righteous man will be remembered forever.
contents: Surely he will never be shaken;
the righteous man will be remembered forever.

contents.verseText: He does not fear bad news; his heart is steadfast, trusting in the LORD.
contents: He does not fear bad news;
his heart is steadfast, trusting in the LORD.

contents.verseText: His heart is assured; he does not fear, until he looks in triumph on his foes.
contents: His heart is assured; he does not fear,
until he looks in triumph on his foes.

contents.verseText: He has scattered abroad his gifts to the poor; his righteousness endures forever; his horn will be lifted high in honor.
contents: He has scattered abroad his gifts to the poor;
his righteousness endures forever;

footnote.ft: Cited in 2 Corinthians 9:9

contents: his horn will be lifted high in honor.

contents.verseText: The wicked man will see and be grieved; he will gnash his teeth and waste away; the desires of the wicked will perish.
contents: The wicked man will see and be grieved;
he will gnash his teeth and waste away;
the desires of the wicked will perish.

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verse 9

contents.verseText: Give praise, O servants of the LORD; praise the name of the LORD.
contents: Give praise, O servants of the LORD;
praise the name of the LORD.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the name of the LORD both now and forevermore.
contents: Blessed be the name of the LORD
both now and forevermore.

contents.verseText: From where the sun rises to where it sets, the name of the LORD is praised.
contents: From where the sun rises to where it sets,
the name of the LORD is praised.

contents.verseText: The LORD is exalted over all the nations, His glory above the heavens.
contents: The LORD is exalted over all the nations,
His glory above the heavens.

contents.verseText: Who is like the LORD our God, the One enthroned on high?
contents: Who is like the LORD our God,
the One enthroned on high?

contents.verseText: He humbles Himself to behold the heavens and the earth.
contents: He humbles Himself to behold
the heavens and the earth.

contents.verseText: He raises the poor from the dust and lifts the needy from the dump
contents: He raises the poor from the dust
and lifts the needy from the dump

contents.verseText: to seat them with nobles, with the princes of His people.
contents: to seat them with nobles,
with the princes of His people.

contents.verseText: He settles the barren woman in her home as a joyful mother to her children. Hallelujah!
contents: He settles the barren woman in her home
as a joyful mother to her children.
Hallelujah!

contents.verseText: When Israel departed from Egypt, the house of Jacob from a people of foreign tongue,
contents: When Israel departed from Egypt,
the house of Jacob from a people of foreign tongue,

contents.verseText: Judah became God’s sanctuary, and Israel His dominion.
contents: Judah became God’s sanctuary,
and Israel His dominion.

contents.verseText: The sea observed and fled; the Jordan turned back;
contents: The sea observed and fled;
the Jordan turned back;

contents.verseText: the mountains skipped like rams, the hills like lambs.
contents: the mountains skipped like rams,
the hills like lambs.

contents.verseText: Why was it, O sea, that you fled, O Jordan, that you turned back,
contents: Why was it, O sea, that you fled,
O Jordan, that you turned back,

contents.verseText: O mountains, that you skipped like rams, O hills, like lambs?
contents: O mountains, that you skipped like rams,
O hills, like lambs?

contents.verseText: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord, at the presence of the God of Jacob,
contents: Tremble, O earth, at the presence of the Lord,
at the presence of the God of Jacob,

contents.verseText: who turned the rock into a pool, the flint into a fountain of water!
contents: who turned the rock into a pool,
the flint into a fountain of water!

s1: To Your Name Be the Glory

contents.verseText: Not to us, O LORD, not to us, but to Your name be the glory, because of Your loving devotion, because of Your faithfulness.
contents: Not to us, O LORD, not to us,
but to Your name be the glory,
because of Your loving devotion,
because of Your faithfulness.

contents.verseText: Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?”
contents: Why should the nations say,
“Where is their God?”

contents.verseText: Our God is in heaven; He does as He pleases.
contents: Our God is in heaven;
He does as He pleases.

contents.verseText: Their idols are silver and gold, made by the hands of men.
contents: Their idols are silver and gold,
made by the hands of men.

contents.verseText: They have mouths, but cannot speak; they have eyes, but cannot see;
contents: They have mouths, but cannot speak;
they have eyes, but cannot see;

contents.verseText: they have ears, but cannot hear; they have noses, but cannot smell;
contents: they have ears, but cannot hear;
they have noses, but cannot smell;

contents.verseText: they have hands, but cannot feel; they have feet, but cannot walk; they cannot even clear their throats.
contents: they have hands, but cannot feel;
they have feet, but cannot walk;
they cannot even clear their throats.

footnote.ft: Literally they cannot utter with their throat

contents.verseText: Those who make them become like them, as do all who trust in them.
contents: Those who make them become like them,
as do all who trust in them.

contents.verseText: O Israel, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield.
contents: O Israel,

footnote.ft: MT; many Hebrew manuscripts, LXX, and Syriac O house of Israel

contents: trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.

contents.verseText: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield.
contents: O house of Aaron, trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.

contents.verseText: You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD! He is their help and shield.
contents: You who fear the LORD, trust in the LORD!
He is their help and shield.

contents.verseText: The LORD is mindful of us; He will bless us. He will bless the house of Israel; He will bless the house of Aaron;
contents: The LORD is mindful of us;
He will bless us.
He will bless the house of Israel;
He will bless the house of Aaron;

contents.verseText: He will bless those who fear the LORD—small and great alike.
contents: He will bless those who fear the LORD—
small and great alike.

contents.verseText: May the LORD give you increase, both you and your children.
contents: May the LORD give you increase,
both you and your children.

contents.verseText: May you be blessed by the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.
contents: May you be blessed by the LORD,
the Maker of heaven and earth.

contents.verseText: The highest heavens belong to the LORD, but the earth He has given to mankind.
contents: The highest heavens belong to the LORD,
but the earth He has given to mankind.

contents.verseText: It is not the dead who praise the LORD, nor any who descend into silence.
contents: It is not the dead who praise the LORD,
nor any who descend into silence.

contents.verseText: But it is we who will bless the LORD, both now and forevermore. Hallelujah!
contents: But it is we who will bless the LORD,
both now and forevermore.
Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD

s1: The LORD Has Heard My Voice

contents.verseText: I love the LORD, for He has heard my voice—my appeal for mercy.
contents: I love the LORD, for He has heard my voice—
my appeal for mercy.

contents.verseText: Because He has inclined His ear to me, I will call on Him as long as I live.
contents: Because He has inclined His ear to me,
I will call on Him as long as I live.

contents.verseText: The ropes of death entangled me; the anguish of Sheol overcame me; I was confronted by trouble and sorrow.
contents: The ropes of death entangled me;
the anguish of Sheol overcame me;
I was confronted by trouble and sorrow.

contents.verseText: Then I called on the name of the LORD: “O LORD, deliver my soul!”
contents: Then I called on the name of the LORD:
“O LORD, deliver my soul!”

contents.verseText: The LORD is gracious and righteous; our God is full of compassion.
contents: The LORD is gracious and righteous;
our God is full of compassion.

contents.verseText: The LORD preserves the simplehearted; I was helpless, and He saved me.
contents: The LORD preserves the simplehearted;
I was helpless, and He saved me.

contents.verseText: Return to your rest, O my soul, for the LORD has been good to you.
contents: Return to your rest, O my soul,
for the LORD has been good to you.

contents.verseText: For You have delivered my soul from death, my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.
contents: For You have delivered my soul from death,
my eyes from tears, my feet from stumbling.

contents.verseText: I will walk before the LORD in the land of the living.
contents: I will walk before the LORD
in the land of the living.

contents.verseText: I believed, therefore I said, “I am greatly afflicted.”
contents: I believed, therefore I said,

footnote.ft: LXX therefore I have spoken; cited in 2 Corinthians 4:13

contents: “I am greatly afflicted.”

contents.verseText: In my alarm I said, “All men are liars!”
contents: In my alarm I said,
“All men are liars!”

contents.verseText: How can I repay the LORD for all His goodness to me?
contents: How can I repay the LORD
for all His goodness to me?

contents.verseText: I will lift the cup of salvation and call on the name of the LORD.
contents: I will lift the cup of salvation
and call on the name of the LORD.

contents.verseText: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all His people.
contents: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD
in the presence of all His people.

contents.verseText: Precious in the sight of the LORD is the death of His saints.
contents: Precious in the sight of the LORD
is the death of His saints.

contents.verseText: Truly, O LORD, I am Your servant; I am Your servant, the son of Your maidservant; You have broken my bonds.
contents: Truly, O LORD, I am Your servant;
I am Your servant, the son of Your maidservant;
You have broken my bonds.

contents.verseText: I will offer to You a sacrifice of thanksgiving and call on the name of the LORD.
contents: I will offer to You a sacrifice of thanksgiving
and call on the name of the LORD.

contents.verseText: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD in the presence of all His people,
contents: I will fulfill my vows to the LORD
in the presence of all His people,

contents.verseText: in the courts of the LORD’s house, in your midst, O Jerusalem. Hallelujah!
contents: in the courts of the LORD’s house,
in your midst, O Jerusalem.
Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD

contents.verseText: Praise the LORD, all you nations! Extol Him, all you peoples!
contents: Praise the LORD, all you nations!
Extol Him, all you peoples!

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 15:11

contents.verseText: For great is His loving devotion toward us, and the faithfulness of the LORD endures forever. Hallelujah!
contents: For great is His loving devotion toward us,
and the faithfulness of the LORD endures forever.
Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD

s1: The LORD Is on My Side

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good;
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: Let Israel say, “His loving devotion endures forever.”
contents: Let Israel

footnote.ft: LXX the house of Israel

contents: say,
“His loving devotion endures forever.”

contents.verseText: Let the house of Aaron say, “His loving devotion endures forever.”
contents: Let the house of Aaron say,
“His loving devotion endures forever.”

contents.verseText: Let those who fear the LORD say, “His loving devotion endures forever.”
contents: Let those who fear the LORD say,
“His loving devotion endures forever.”

contents.verseText: In my distress I called to the LORD, and He answered and set me free.
contents: In my distress I called to the LORD,
and He answered and set me free.

contents.verseText: The LORD is on my side; I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?
contents: The LORD is on my side;

footnote.ft: Or The LORD is with me; also in verse 7; LXX The Lord is my helper

contents: I will not be afraid.
What can man do to me?

footnote.ft: Cited in Hebrews 13:6

contents.verseText: The LORD is on my side; He is my helper. Therefore I will look in triumph on those who hate me.
contents: The LORD is on my side; He is my helper.
Therefore I will look in triumph on those who hate me.

contents.verseText: It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in man.
contents: It is better to take refuge in the LORD
than to trust in man.

contents.verseText: It is better to take refuge in the LORD than to trust in princes.
contents: It is better to take refuge in the LORD
than to trust in princes.

contents.verseText: All the nations surrounded me, but in the name of the LORD I cut them off.
contents: All the nations surrounded me,
but in the name of the LORD I cut them off.

contents.verseText: They surrounded me on every side, but in the name of the LORD I cut them off.
contents: They surrounded me on every side,
but in the name of the LORD I cut them off.

contents.verseText: They swarmed around me like bees, but they were extinguished like burning thorns; in the name of the LORD I cut them off.
contents: They swarmed around me like bees,
but they were extinguished like burning thorns;
in the name of the LORD I cut them off.

contents.verseText: I was pushed so hard I was falling, but the LORD helped me.
contents: I was pushed so hard I was falling,
but the LORD helped me.

contents.verseText: The LORD is my strength and my song, and He has become my salvation.
contents: The LORD is my strength and my song,
and He has become my salvation.

contents.verseText: Shouts of joy and salvation resound in the tents of the righteous: “The right hand of the LORD performs with valor!
contents: Shouts of joy and salvation resound in the tents of the righteous:
“The right hand of the LORD performs with valor!

contents.verseText: The right hand of the LORD is exalted! The right hand of the LORD performs with valor!”
contents: The right hand of the LORD is exalted!
The right hand of the LORD performs with valor!”

contents.verseText: I will not die, but I will live and proclaim what the LORD has done.
contents: I will not die, but I will live
and proclaim what the LORD has done.

contents.verseText: The LORD disciplined me severely, but He has not given me over to death.
contents: The LORD disciplined me severely,
but He has not given me over to death.

contents.verseText: Open to me the gates of righteousness, that I may enter and give thanks to the LORD.
contents: Open to me the gates of righteousness,
that I may enter and give thanks to the LORD.

contents.verseText: This is the gate of the LORD; the righteous shall enter through it.
contents: This is the gate of the LORD;
the righteous shall enter through it.

contents.verseText: I will give You thanks, for You have answered me, and You have become my salvation.
contents: I will give You thanks, for You have answered me,
and You have become my salvation.

contents.verseText: The stone the builders rejected has become the cornerstone.
contents: The stone the builders rejected
has become the cornerstone.

footnote.ft: Hebrew the head of the corner; cited in Matthew 21:42, Mark 12:10, Luke 20:17, Acts 4:11, and 1 Peter 2:7

contents.verseText: This is from the LORD, and it is marvelous in our eyes.
contents: This is from the LORD,
and it is marvelous in our eyes.

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 21:42 and Mark 12:11

contents.verseText: This is the day that the LORD has made; we will rejoice and be glad in it.
contents: This is the day that the LORD has made;
we will rejoice and be glad in it.

contents.verseText: O LORD, save us, we pray. We beseech You, O LORD, cause us to prosper!
contents: O LORD, save us, we pray.

footnote.ft: Hebrew hosia-na, meaning save, we pray or save now; see Matthew 21:9, Matthew 21:15, Mark 11:9, and John 12:13.

contents: We beseech You, O LORD, cause us to prosper!

contents.verseText: Blessed is he who comes in the name of the LORD. From the house of the LORD we bless you.
contents: Blessed is he who comes in the name of the LORD.

footnote.ft: Cited in Matthew 21:9, Matthew 23:39, Mark 11:9, Luke 13:35, Luke 19:38, and John 12:13

contents: From the house of the LORD we bless you.

contents.verseText: The LORD is God; He has made His light to shine upon us. Bind the festal sacrifice with cords to the horns of the altar.
contents: The LORD is God;
He has made His light to shine upon us.
Bind the festal sacrifice with cords
to the horns of the altar.

footnote.ft: Or Join in the festal procession with boughs in hand, up to the horns of the altar.

contents.verseText: You are my God, and I will give You thanks. You are my God, and I will exalt You.
contents: You are my God, and I will give You thanks.
You are my God, and I will exalt You.

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good; His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good;
His loving devotion endures forever.

s1: Your Word Is a Lamp to My Feet

contents.verseText: Blessed are those whose way is blameless, who walk in the Law of the LORD.
contents: Blessed

footnote.ft: This psalm is an acrostic poem of twenty-two stanzas, following the letters of the Hebrew alphabet; within a stanza, each verse begins with the same Hebrew letter.

contents: are those whose way is blameless,
who walk in the Law of the LORD.

contents.verseText: Blessed are those who keep His testimonies and seek Him with all their heart.
contents: Blessed are those who keep His testimonies
and seek Him with all their heart.

contents.verseText: They do no iniquity; they walk in His ways.
contents: They do no iniquity;
they walk in His ways.

contents.verseText: You have ordained Your precepts, that we should keep them diligently.
contents: You have ordained Your precepts,
that we should keep them diligently.

contents.verseText: Oh, that my ways were committed to keeping Your statutes!
contents: Oh, that my ways were committed
to keeping Your statutes!

contents.verseText: Then I would not be ashamed when I consider all Your commandments.
contents: Then I would not be ashamed
when I consider all Your commandments.

contents.verseText: I will praise You with an upright heart when I learn Your righteous judgments.
contents: I will praise You with an upright heart
when I learn Your righteous judgments.

contents.verseText: I will keep Your statutes; do not utterly forsake me.
contents: I will keep Your statutes;
do not utterly forsake me.

contents.verseText: How can a young man keep his way pure? By guarding it according to Your word.
contents: How can a young man keep his way pure?
By guarding it according to Your word.

contents.verseText: With all my heart I have sought You; do not let me stray from Your commandments.
contents: With all my heart I have sought You;
do not let me stray from Your commandments.

contents.verseText: I have hidden Your word in my heart that I might not sin against You.
contents: I have hidden Your word in my heart
that I might not sin against You.

contents.verseText: Blessed are You, O LORD; teach me Your statutes.
contents: Blessed are You, O LORD;
teach me Your statutes.

contents.verseText: With my lips I proclaim all the judgments of Your mouth.
contents: With my lips I proclaim
all the judgments of Your mouth.

contents.verseText: I rejoice in the way of Your testimonies as much as in all riches.
contents: I rejoice in the way of Your testimonies
as much as in all riches.

contents.verseText: I will meditate on Your precepts and regard Your ways.
contents: I will meditate on Your precepts
and regard Your ways.

contents.verseText: I will delight in Your statutes; I will not forget Your word.
contents: I will delight in Your statutes;
I will not forget Your word.

contents.verseText: Deal bountifully with Your servant, that I may live and keep Your word.
contents: Deal bountifully with Your servant,
that I may live and keep Your word.

contents.verseText: Open my eyes that I may see wondrous things from Your law.
contents: Open my eyes that I may see
wondrous things from Your law.

contents.verseText: I am a stranger on the earth; do not hide Your commandments from me.
contents: I am a stranger on the earth;
do not hide Your commandments from me.

contents.verseText: My soul is consumed with longing for Your judgments at all times.
contents: My soul is consumed with longing
for Your judgments at all times.

contents.verseText: You rebuke the arrogant—the cursed who stray from Your commandments.
contents: You rebuke the arrogant—
the cursed who stray from Your commandments.

contents.verseText: Remove my scorn and contempt, for I have kept Your testimonies.
contents: Remove my scorn and contempt,
for I have kept Your testimonies.

contents.verseText: Though rulers sit and slander me, Your servant meditates on Your statutes.
contents: Though rulers sit and slander me,
Your servant meditates on Your statutes.

contents.verseText: Your testimonies are indeed my delight; they are my counselors.
contents: Your testimonies are indeed my delight;
they are my counselors.

contents.verseText: My soul cleaves to the dust; revive me according to Your word.
contents: My soul cleaves to the dust;
revive me according to Your word.

contents.verseText: I recounted my ways, and You answered me; teach me Your statutes.
contents: I recounted my ways, and You answered me;
teach me Your statutes.

contents.verseText: Make clear to me the way of Your precepts; then I will meditate on Your wonders.
contents: Make clear to me the way of Your precepts;
then I will meditate on Your wonders.

contents.verseText: My soul melts with sorrow; strengthen me according to Your word.
contents: My soul melts with sorrow;
strengthen me according to Your word.

contents.verseText: Remove me from the path of deceit and graciously grant me Your law.
contents: Remove me from the path of deceit
and graciously grant me Your law.

contents.verseText: I have chosen the way of truth; I have set Your ordinances before me.
contents: I have chosen the way of truth;
I have set Your ordinances before me.

contents.verseText: I cling to Your testimonies, O LORD; let me not be put to shame.
contents: I cling to Your testimonies, O LORD;
let me not be put to shame.

contents.verseText: I run in the path of Your commandments, for You will enlarge my heart.
contents: I run in the path of Your commandments,
for You will enlarge my heart.

contents.verseText: Teach me, O LORD, the way of Your statutes, and I will keep them to the end.
contents: Teach me, O LORD, the way of Your statutes,
and I will keep them to the end.

footnote.ft: Or keep them as my reward

contents.verseText: Give me understanding that I may obey Your law, and follow it with all my heart.
contents: Give me understanding that I may obey Your law,
and follow it with all my heart.

contents.verseText: Direct me in the path of Your commandments, for there I find delight.
contents: Direct me in the path of Your commandments,
for there I find delight.

contents.verseText: Turn my heart to Your testimonies and not to covetous gain.
contents: Turn my heart to Your testimonies
and not to covetous gain.

contents.verseText: Turn my eyes away from worthless things; revive me with Your word.
contents: Turn my eyes away from worthless things;
revive me with Your word.

footnote.ft: Two MT manuscripts and DSS; most MT manuscripts in Your way

contents.verseText: Establish Your word to Your servant, to produce reverence for You.
contents: Establish Your word to Your servant,
to produce reverence for You.

contents.verseText: Turn away the disgrace I dread, for Your judgments are good.
contents: Turn away the disgrace I dread,
for Your judgments are good.

contents.verseText: How I long for Your precepts! Revive me in Your righteousness.
contents: How I long for Your precepts!
Revive me in Your righteousness.

contents.verseText: May Your loving devotion come to me, O LORD, Your salvation, according to Your promise.
contents: May Your loving devotion come to me, O LORD,
Your salvation, according to Your promise.

contents.verseText: Then I can answer him who taunts, for I trust in Your word.
contents: Then I can answer him who taunts,
for I trust in Your word.

contents.verseText: Never take Your word of truth from my mouth, for I hope in Your judgments.
contents: Never take Your word of truth from my mouth,
for I hope in Your judgments.

contents.verseText: I will always obey Your law, forever and ever.
contents: I will always obey Your law,
forever and ever.

contents.verseText: And I will walk in freedom, for I have sought Your precepts.
contents: And I will walk in freedom,
for I have sought Your precepts.

contents.verseText: I will speak of Your testimonies before kings, and I will not be ashamed.
contents: I will speak of Your testimonies before kings,
and I will not be ashamed.

contents.verseText: I delight in Your commandments because I love them.
contents: I delight in Your commandments
because I love them.

contents.verseText: I lift up my hands to Your commandments, which I love, and I meditate on Your statutes.
contents: I lift up my hands to Your commandments, which I love,
and I meditate on Your statutes.

contents.verseText: Remember Your word to Your servant, upon which You have given me hope.
contents: Remember Your word to Your servant,
upon which You have given me hope.

contents.verseText: This is my comfort in affliction, that Your promise has given me life.
contents: This is my comfort in affliction,
that Your promise has given me life.

contents.verseText: The arrogant utterly deride me, but I do not turn from Your law.
contents: The arrogant utterly deride me,
but I do not turn from Your law.

contents.verseText: I remember Your judgments of old, O LORD, and in them I find comfort.
contents: I remember Your judgments of old, O LORD,
and in them I find comfort.

contents.verseText: Rage has taken hold of me because of the wicked who reject Your law.
contents: Rage has taken hold of me
because of the wicked who reject Your law.

contents.verseText: Your statutes are songs to me in the house of my pilgrimage.
contents: Your statutes are songs to me
in the house of my pilgrimage.

contents.verseText: In the night, O LORD, I remember Your name, that I may keep Your law.
contents: In the night, O LORD, I remember Your name,
that I may keep Your law.

contents.verseText: This is my practice, for I obey Your precepts.
contents: This is my practice,
for I obey Your precepts.

contents.verseText: The LORD is my portion; I have promised to keep Your words.
contents: The LORD is my portion;
I have promised to keep Your words.

contents.verseText: I have sought Your face with all my heart; be gracious to me according to Your promise.
contents: I have sought Your face with all my heart;
be gracious to me according to Your promise.

contents.verseText: I considered my ways and turned my steps to Your testimonies.
contents: I considered my ways
and turned my steps to Your testimonies.

contents.verseText: I hurried without hesitating to keep Your commandments.
contents: I hurried without hesitating
to keep Your commandments.

contents.verseText: Though the ropes of the wicked bind me, I do not forget Your law.
contents: Though the ropes of the wicked bind me,
I do not forget Your law.

contents.verseText: At midnight I rise to give You thanks for Your righteous judgments.
contents: At midnight I rise to give You thanks
for Your righteous judgments.

contents.verseText: I am a friend to all who fear You, and to those who keep Your precepts.
contents: I am a friend to all who fear You,
and to those who keep Your precepts.

contents.verseText: The earth is filled with Your loving devotion, O LORD; teach me Your statutes.
contents: The earth is filled with Your loving devotion, O LORD;
teach me Your statutes.

contents.verseText: You are good to Your servant, O LORD, according to Your word.
contents: You are good to Your servant, O LORD,
according to Your word.

contents.verseText: Teach me good judgment and knowledge, for I believe in Your commandments.
contents: Teach me good judgment and knowledge,
for I believe in Your commandments.

contents.verseText: Before I was afflicted, I went astray; but now I keep Your word.
contents: Before I was afflicted, I went astray;
but now I keep Your word.

contents.verseText: You are good, and You do what is good; teach me Your statutes.
contents: You are good, and You do what is good;
teach me Your statutes.

contents.verseText: Though the arrogant have smeared me with lies, I keep Your precepts with all my heart.
contents: Though the arrogant have smeared me with lies,
I keep Your precepts with all my heart.

contents.verseText: Their hearts are hard and callous, but I delight in Your law.
contents: Their hearts are hard

footnote.ft: Or fat

contents: and callous,
but I delight in Your law.

contents.verseText: It was good for me to be afflicted, that I might learn Your statutes.
contents: It was good for me to be afflicted,
that I might learn Your statutes.

contents.verseText: The law from Your mouth is more precious to me than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.
contents: The law from Your mouth is more precious to me
than thousands of pieces of gold and silver.

contents.verseText: Your hands have made me and fashioned me; give me understanding to learn Your commandments.
contents: Your hands have made me and fashioned me;
give me understanding to learn Your commandments.

contents.verseText: May those who fear You see me and rejoice, for I have hoped in Your word.
contents: May those who fear You see me and rejoice,
for I have hoped in Your word.

contents.verseText: I know, O LORD, that Your judgments are righteous, and that in faithfulness You have afflicted me.
contents: I know, O LORD, that Your judgments are righteous,
and that in faithfulness You have afflicted me.

contents.verseText: May Your loving devotion comfort me, I pray, according to Your promise to Your servant.
contents: May Your loving devotion comfort me, I pray,
according to Your promise to Your servant.

contents.verseText: May Your compassion come to me, that I may live, for Your law is my delight.
contents: May Your compassion come to me, that I may live,
for Your law is my delight.

contents.verseText: May the arrogant be put to shame for subverting me with a lie; I will meditate on Your precepts.
contents: May the arrogant be put to shame for subverting me with a lie;
I will meditate on Your precepts.

contents.verseText: May those who fear You turn to me, those who know Your testimonies.
contents: May those who fear You turn to me,
those who know Your testimonies.

contents.verseText: May my heart be blameless in Your statutes, that I may not be put to shame.
contents: May my heart be blameless in Your statutes,
that I may not be put to shame.

contents.verseText: My soul faints for Your salvation; I wait for Your word.
contents: My soul faints for Your salvation;
I wait for Your word.

contents.verseText: My eyes fail, looking for Your promise; I ask, “When will You comfort me?”
contents: My eyes fail, looking for Your promise;
I ask, “When will You comfort me?”

contents.verseText: Though I am like a wineskin dried up by smoke, I do not forget Your statutes.
contents: Though I am like a wineskin dried up by smoke,
I do not forget Your statutes.

contents.verseText: How many days must Your servant wait? When will You execute judgment on my persecutors?
contents: How many days must Your servant wait?

footnote.ft: Or How many are the days of Your servant?

contents: When will You execute judgment on my persecutors?

contents.verseText: The arrogant have dug pits for me in violation of Your law.
contents: The arrogant have dug pits for me
in violation of Your law.

contents.verseText: All Your commandments are faithful; I am persecuted without cause—help me!
contents: All Your commandments are faithful;
I am persecuted without cause—help me!

contents.verseText: They almost wiped me from the earth, but I have not forsaken Your precepts.
contents: They almost wiped me from the earth,
but I have not forsaken Your precepts.

contents.verseText: Revive me according to Your loving devotion, that I may obey the testimony of Your mouth.
contents: Revive me according to Your loving devotion,
that I may obey the testimony of Your mouth.

contents.verseText: Your word, O LORD, is everlasting; it is firmly fixed in the heavens.
contents: Your word, O LORD, is everlasting;
it is firmly fixed in the heavens.

contents.verseText: Your faithfulness continues through all generations; You established the earth, and it endures.
contents: Your faithfulness continues through all generations;
You established the earth, and it endures.

contents.verseText: Your ordinances stand to this day, for all things are servants to You.
contents: Your ordinances stand to this day,

footnote.ft: Or They stand this day according to Your ordinances

contents: for all things are servants to You.

contents.verseText: If Your law had not been my delight, then I would have perished in my affliction.
contents: If Your law had not been my delight,
then I would have perished in my affliction.

contents.verseText: I will never forget Your precepts, for by them You have revived me.
contents: I will never forget Your precepts,
for by them You have revived me.

contents.verseText: I am Yours; save me, for I have sought Your precepts.
contents: I am Yours; save me,
for I have sought Your precepts.

contents.verseText: The wicked wait to destroy me, but I will ponder Your testimonies.
contents: The wicked wait to destroy me,
but I will ponder Your testimonies.

contents.verseText: I have seen a limit to all perfection, but Your commandment is without limit.
contents: I have seen a limit to all perfection,
but Your commandment is without limit.

contents.verseText: Oh, how I love Your law! All day long it is my meditation.
contents: Oh, how I love Your law!
All day long it is my meditation.

contents.verseText: Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies, for they are always with me.
contents: Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies,
for they are always with me.

contents.verseText: I have more insight than all my teachers, for Your testimonies are my meditation.
contents: I have more insight than all my teachers,
for Your testimonies are my meditation.

contents.verseText: I discern more than the elders, for I obey Your precepts.
contents: I discern more than the elders,
for I obey Your precepts.

contents.verseText: I have kept my feet from every evil path, that I may keep Your word.
contents: I have kept my feet from every evil path,
that I may keep Your word.

contents.verseText: I have not departed from Your ordinances, for You Yourself have taught me.
contents: I have not departed from Your ordinances,
for You Yourself have taught me.

contents.verseText: How sweet are Your words to my taste—sweeter than honey in my mouth!
contents: How sweet are Your words to my taste—
sweeter than honey in my mouth!

contents.verseText: I gain understanding from Your precepts; therefore I hate every false way.
contents: I gain understanding from Your precepts;
therefore I hate every false way.

contents.verseText: Your word is a lamp to my feet and a light to my path.
contents: Your word is a lamp to my feet
and a light to my path.

contents.verseText: I have sworn and confirmed that I will keep Your righteous judgments.
contents: I have sworn and confirmed
that I will keep Your righteous judgments.

contents.verseText: I am severely afflicted, O LORD; revive me through Your word.
contents: I am severely afflicted, O LORD;
revive me through Your word.

contents.verseText: Accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD, and teach me Your judgments.
contents: Accept the freewill offerings of my mouth, O LORD,
and teach me Your judgments.

contents.verseText: I constantly take my life in my hands, yet I do not forget Your law.
contents: I constantly take my life in my hands,
yet I do not forget Your law.

contents.verseText: The wicked have set a snare for me, but I have not strayed from Your precepts.
contents: The wicked have set a snare for me,
but I have not strayed from Your precepts.

contents.verseText: Your testimonies are my heritage forever, for they are the joy of my heart.
contents: Your testimonies are my heritage forever,
for they are the joy of my heart.

contents.verseText: I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes, even to the very end.
contents: I have inclined my heart to perform Your statutes,
even to the very end.

contents.verseText: The double-minded I despise, but Your law I love.
contents: The double-minded I despise,
but Your law I love.

contents.verseText: You are my hiding place and my shield; I put my hope in Your word.
contents: You are my hiding place and my shield;
I put my hope in Your word.

contents.verseText: Depart from me, you evildoers, that I may obey the commandments of my God.
contents: Depart from me, you evildoers,
that I may obey the commandments of my God.

contents.verseText: Sustain me as You promised, that I may live; let me not be ashamed of my hope.
contents: Sustain me as You promised, that I may live;
let me not be ashamed of my hope.

contents.verseText: Uphold me, and I will be saved, that I may always regard Your statutes.
contents: Uphold me, and I will be saved,
that I may always regard Your statutes.

contents.verseText: You reject all who stray from Your statutes, for their deceitfulness is in vain.
contents: You reject all who stray from Your statutes,
for their deceitfulness is in vain.

contents.verseText: All the wicked on earth You discard like dross; therefore I love Your testimonies.
contents: All the wicked on earth You discard like dross;
therefore I love Your testimonies.

contents.verseText: My flesh trembles in awe of You; I stand in fear of Your judgments.
contents: My flesh trembles in awe of You;
I stand in fear of Your judgments.

contents.verseText: I have done what is just and right; do not leave me to my oppressors.
contents: I have done what is just and right;
do not leave me to my oppressors.

contents.verseText: Ensure Your servant’s well-being; do not let the arrogant oppress me.
contents: Ensure Your servant’s well-being;
do not let the arrogant oppress me.

contents.verseText: My eyes fail, looking for Your salvation, and for Your righteous promise.
contents: My eyes fail, looking for Your salvation,
and for Your righteous promise.

contents.verseText: Deal with Your servant according to Your loving devotion, and teach me Your statutes.
contents: Deal with Your servant according to Your loving devotion,
and teach me Your statutes.

contents.verseText: I am Your servant; give me understanding, that I may know Your testimonies.
contents: I am Your servant; give me understanding,
that I may know Your testimonies.

contents.verseText: It is time for the LORD to act, for they have broken Your law.
contents: It is time for the LORD to act,
for they have broken Your law.

contents.verseText: Therefore I love Your commandments more than gold, even the purest gold.
contents: Therefore I love Your commandments more than gold,
even the purest gold.

contents.verseText: Therefore I admire all Your precepts and hate every false way.
contents: Therefore I admire all Your precepts
and hate every false way.

contents.verseText: Wonderful are Your testimonies; therefore I obey them.
contents: Wonderful are Your testimonies;
therefore I obey them.

contents.verseText: The unfolding of Your words gives light; it informs the simple.
contents: The unfolding of Your words gives light;
it informs the simple.

contents.verseText: I open my mouth and pant, longing for Your commandments.
contents: I open my mouth and pant,
longing for Your commandments.

contents.verseText: Turn to me and show me mercy, as You do to those who love Your name.
contents: Turn to me and show me mercy,
as You do to those who love Your name.

contents.verseText: Order my steps in Your word; let no sin rule over me.
contents: Order my steps in Your word;
let no sin rule over me.

contents.verseText: Redeem me from the oppression of man, that I may keep Your precepts.
contents: Redeem me from the oppression of man,
that I may keep Your precepts.

contents.verseText: Make Your face shine upon Your servant, and teach me Your statutes.
contents: Make Your face shine upon Your servant,
and teach me Your statutes.

contents.verseText: My eyes shed streams of tears because Your law is not obeyed.
contents: My eyes shed streams of tears
because Your law is not obeyed.

contents.verseText: Righteous are You, O LORD, and upright are Your judgments.
contents: Righteous are You, O LORD,
and upright are Your judgments.

contents.verseText: The testimonies You have laid down are righteous and altogether faithful.
contents: The testimonies You have laid down are righteous
and altogether faithful.

contents.verseText: My zeal has consumed me because my foes forget Your words.
contents: My zeal has consumed me
because my foes forget Your words.

contents.verseText: Your promise is completely pure; therefore Your servant loves it.
contents: Your promise is completely pure;
therefore Your servant loves it.

contents.verseText: I am lowly and despised, but I do not forget Your precepts.
contents: I am lowly and despised,
but I do not forget Your precepts.

contents.verseText: Your righteousness is everlasting and Your law is true.
contents: Your righteousness is everlasting
and Your law is true.

contents.verseText: Trouble and distress have found me, but Your commandments are my delight.
contents: Trouble and distress have found me,
but Your commandments are my delight.

contents.verseText: Your testimonies are righteous forever. Give me understanding, that I may live.
contents: Your testimonies are righteous forever.
Give me understanding, that I may live.

contents.verseText: I call with all my heart; answer me, O LORD! I will obey Your statutes.
contents: I call with all my heart; answer me, O LORD!
I will obey Your statutes.

contents.verseText: I call to You; save me, that I may keep Your testimonies.
contents: I call to You; save me,
that I may keep Your testimonies.

contents.verseText: I rise before dawn and cry for help; in Your word I have put my hope.
contents: I rise before dawn and cry for help;
in Your word I have put my hope.

contents.verseText: My eyes anticipate the watches of night, that I may meditate on Your word.
contents: My eyes anticipate the watches of night,
that I may meditate on Your word.

contents.verseText: Hear my voice, O LORD, according to Your loving devotion; give me life according to Your justice.
contents: Hear my voice, O LORD, according to Your loving devotion;
give me life according to Your justice.

contents.verseText: Those who follow after wickedness draw near; they are far from Your law.
contents: Those who follow after wickedness draw near;
they are far from Your law.

contents.verseText: You are near, O LORD, and all Your commandments are true.
contents: You are near, O LORD,
and all Your commandments are true.

contents.verseText: Long ago I learned from Your testimonies that You have established them forever.
contents: Long ago I learned from Your testimonies
that You have established them forever.

contents.verseText: Look upon my affliction and rescue me, for I have not forgotten Your law.
contents: Look upon my affliction and rescue me,
for I have not forgotten Your law.

contents.verseText: Defend my cause and redeem me; revive me according to Your word.
contents: Defend my cause and redeem me;
revive me according to Your word.

contents.verseText: Salvation is far from the wicked because they do not seek Your statutes.
contents: Salvation is far from the wicked
because they do not seek Your statutes.

contents.verseText: Great are Your mercies, O LORD; revive me according to Your ordinances.
contents: Great are Your mercies, O LORD;
revive me according to Your ordinances.

contents.verseText: Though my persecutors and foes are many, I have not turned from Your testimonies.
contents: Though my persecutors and foes are many,
I have not turned from Your testimonies.

contents.verseText: I look on the faithless with loathing because they do not keep Your word.
contents: I look on the faithless with loathing
because they do not keep Your word.

contents.verseText: Consider how I love Your precepts, O LORD; give me life according to Your loving devotion.
contents: Consider how I love Your precepts, O LORD;
give me life according to Your loving devotion.

contents.verseText: The entirety of Your word is truth, and all Your righteous judgments endure forever.
contents: The entirety of Your word is truth,
and all Your righteous judgments endure forever.

contents.verseText: Rulers persecute me without cause, but my heart fears only Your word.
contents: Rulers persecute me without cause,
but my heart fears only Your word.

contents.verseText: I rejoice in Your promise like one who finds great spoil.
contents: I rejoice in Your promise
like one who finds great spoil.

contents.verseText: I hate and abhor falsehood, but Your law I love.
contents: I hate and abhor falsehood,
but Your law I love.

contents.verseText: Seven times a day I praise You for Your righteous judgments.
contents: Seven times a day I praise You
for Your righteous judgments.

contents.verseText: Abundant peace belongs to those who love Your instruction; nothing can make them stumble.
contents: Abundant peace belongs to those who love Your instruction;
nothing can make them stumble.

contents.verseText: I wait for Your salvation, O LORD, and I carry out Your commandments.
contents: I wait for Your salvation, O LORD,
and I carry out Your commandments.

contents.verseText: I obey Your testimonies and love them greatly.
contents: I obey Your testimonies
and love them greatly.

contents.verseText: I obey Your precepts and Your testimonies, for all my ways are before You.
contents: I obey Your precepts and Your testimonies,
for all my ways are before You.

contents.verseText: May my cry come before You, O LORD; give me understanding according to Your word.
contents: May my cry come before You, O LORD;
give me understanding according to Your word.

contents.verseText: May my plea come before You; rescue me according to Your promise.
contents: May my plea come before You;
rescue me according to Your promise.

contents.verseText: My lips pour forth praise, for You teach me Your statutes.
contents: My lips pour forth praise,
for You teach me Your statutes.

contents.verseText: My tongue sings of Your word, for all Your commandments are righteous.
contents: My tongue sings of Your word,
for all Your commandments are righteous.

contents.verseText: May Your hand be ready to help me, for I have chosen Your precepts.
contents: May Your hand be ready to help me,
for I have chosen Your precepts.

contents.verseText: I long for Your salvation, O LORD, and Your law is my delight.
contents: I long for Your salvation, O LORD,
and Your law is my delight.

contents.verseText: Let me live to praise You; may Your judgments sustain me.
contents: Let me live to praise You;
may Your judgments sustain me.

contents.verseText: I have strayed like a lost sheep; seek Your servant, for I have not forgotten Your commandments.
contents: I have strayed like a lost sheep;
seek Your servant, for I have not forgotten Your commandments.

s1: In My Distress I Cried to the LORD

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: In my distress I cried to the LORD, and He answered me.
contents: In my distress I cried to the LORD,
and He answered me.

contents.verseText: Deliver my soul, O LORD, from lying lips and a deceitful tongue.
contents: Deliver my soul, O LORD,
from lying lips and a deceitful tongue.

contents.verseText: What will He do to you, and what will be added to you, O deceitful tongue?
contents: What will He do to you,
and what will be added to you,
O deceitful tongue?

contents.verseText: Sharp arrows will come from the warrior, with burning coals of the broom tree!
contents: Sharp arrows will come from the warrior,
with burning coals of the broom tree!

contents.verseText: Woe to me that I dwell in Meshech, that I live among the tents of Kedar!
contents: Woe to me that I dwell in Meshech,
that I live among the tents of Kedar!

contents.verseText: Too long have I dwelt among those who hate peace.
contents: Too long have I dwelt
among those who hate peace.

contents.verseText: I am in favor of peace; but when I speak, they want war.
contents: I am in favor of peace;
but when I speak, they want war.

s1: I Lift Up My Eyes to the Hills

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: I lift up my eyes to the hills. From where does my help come?
contents: I lift up my eyes to the hills.
From where does my help come?

contents.verseText: My help comes from the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.
contents: My help comes from the LORD,
the Maker of heaven and earth.

contents.verseText: He will not allow your foot to slip; your Protector will not slumber.
contents: He will not allow your foot to slip;
your Protector will not slumber.

contents.verseText: Behold, the Protector of Israel will neither slumber nor sleep.
contents: Behold, the Protector of Israel
will neither slumber nor sleep.

contents.verseText: The LORD is your keeper; the LORD is the shade on your right hand.
contents: The LORD is your keeper;
the LORD is the shade on your right hand.

contents.verseText: The sun will not strike you by day, nor the moon by night.
contents: The sun will not strike you by day,
nor the moon by night.

contents.verseText: The LORD will guard you from all evil; He will preserve your soul.
contents: The LORD will guard you from all evil;
He will preserve your soul.

contents.verseText: The LORD will watch over your coming and going, both now and forevermore.
contents: The LORD will watch over your coming and going,
both now and forevermore.

s1: Pray for the Peace of Jerusalem

d: A song of ascents. Of David.

contents.verseText: I was glad when they said to me, “Let us go to the house of the LORD.”
contents: I was glad when they said to me,
“Let us go to the house of the LORD.”

contents.verseText: Our feet are standing in your gates, O Jerusalem.
contents: Our feet are standing in your gates,
O Jerusalem.

contents.verseText: Jerusalem is built up as a city united together,
contents: Jerusalem is built up
as a city united together,

contents.verseText: where the tribes go up, the tribes of the LORD, as a testimony for Israel, to give thanks to the name of the LORD.
contents: where the tribes go up,
the tribes of the LORD,
as a testimony for Israel,
to give thanks to the name of the LORD.

contents.verseText: For there the thrones of judgment stand, the thrones of the house of David.
contents: For there the thrones of judgment stand,
the thrones of the house of David.

contents.verseText: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem: “May those who love you prosper.
contents: Pray for the peace of Jerusalem:
“May those who love you prosper.

footnote.ft: Or be secure

contents.verseText: May there be peace within your walls, and prosperity inside your fortresses.”
contents: May there be peace within your walls,
and prosperity

footnote.ft: Or security

contents: inside your fortresses.”

contents.verseText: For the sake of my brothers and friends, I will say, “Peace be within you.”
contents: For the sake of my brothers and friends,
I will say, “Peace be within you.”

contents.verseText: For the sake of the house of the LORD our God, I will seek your prosperity.
contents: For the sake of the house of the LORD our God,
I will seek your prosperity.

s1: I Lift Up My Eyes to You

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: I lift up my eyes to You, the One enthroned in heaven.
contents: I lift up my eyes to You,
the One enthroned in heaven.

contents.verseText: As the eyes of servants look to the hand of their master, as the eyes of a maidservant look to the hand of her mistress, so our eyes are on the LORD our God until He shows us mercy.
contents: As the eyes of servants
look to the hand of their master,
as the eyes of a maidservant
look to the hand of her mistress,
so our eyes are on the LORD our God
until He shows us mercy.

contents.verseText: Have mercy on us, O LORD, have mercy, for we have endured much contempt.
contents: Have mercy on us, O LORD, have mercy,
for we have endured much contempt.

contents.verseText: We have endured much scorn from the arrogant, much contempt from the proud.
contents: We have endured much scorn from the arrogant,
much contempt from the proud.

s1: Our Help Is in the Name of the LORD

d: A song of ascents. Of David.

contents.verseText: If the LORD had not been on our side—let Israel now declare—
contents: If the LORD had not been on our side—
let Israel now declare—

contents.verseText: if the LORD had not been on our side when men attacked us,
contents: if the LORD had not been on our side
when men attacked us,

contents.verseText: when their anger flared against us, then they would have swallowed us alive,
contents: when their anger flared against us,
then they would have swallowed us alive,

contents.verseText: then the floods would have engulfed us, then the torrent would have overwhelmed us,
contents: then the floods would have engulfed us,
then the torrent would have overwhelmed us,

contents.verseText: then the raging waters would have swept us away.
contents: then the raging waters
would have swept us away.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD, who has not given us as prey to their teeth.
contents: Blessed be the LORD,
who has not given us as prey to their teeth.

contents.verseText: We have escaped like a bird from the snare of the fowler; the net is torn, and we have slipped away.
contents: We have escaped like a bird from the snare of the fowler;
the net is torn, and we have slipped away.

contents.verseText: Our help is in the name of the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth.
contents: Our help is in the name of the LORD,
the Maker of heaven and earth.

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion. It cannot be moved; it abides forever.
contents: Those who trust in the LORD are like Mount Zion.
It cannot be moved; it abides forever.

contents.verseText: As the mountains surround Jerusalem, so the LORD surrounds His people, both now and forevermore.
contents: As the mountains surround Jerusalem,
so the LORD surrounds His people,
both now and forevermore.

contents.verseText: For the scepter of the wicked will not rest upon the land allotted to the righteous, so that the righteous will not put forth their hands to injustice.
contents: For the scepter of the wicked will not rest
upon the land allotted to the righteous,
so that the righteous will not put forth
their hands to injustice.

contents.verseText: Do good, O LORD, to those who are good, and to the upright in heart.
contents: Do good, O LORD, to those who are good,
and to the upright in heart.

contents.verseText: But those who turn to crooked ways the LORD will banish with the evildoers. Peace be upon Israel.
contents: But those who turn to crooked ways
the LORD will banish with the evildoers.
Peace be upon Israel.

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: When the LORD restored the captives of Zion, we were like dreamers.
contents: When the LORD restored the captives of Zion,

footnote.ft: Or brought back the captives to Zion; or restored the fortunes of Zion

contents: we were like dreamers.

footnote.ft: Or like those restored to health

contents.verseText: Then our mouths were filled with laughter, our tongues with shouts of joy. Then it was said among the nations, “The LORD has done great things for them.”
contents: Then our mouths were filled with laughter,
our tongues with shouts of joy.
Then it was said among the nations,
“The LORD has done great things for them.”

contents.verseText: The LORD has done great things for us; we are filled with joy.
contents: The LORD has done great things for us;
we are filled with joy.

contents.verseText: Restore our captives, O LORD, like streams in the Negev.
contents: Restore our captives,

footnote.ft: Or Restore our fortunes

contents: O LORD,
like streams in the Negev.

contents.verseText: Those who sow in tears will reap with shouts of joy.
contents: Those who sow in tears
will reap with shouts of joy.

contents.verseText: He who goes out weeping, bearing a trail of seed, will surely return with shouts of joy, carrying sheaves of grain.
contents: He who goes out weeping,
bearing a trail of seed,
will surely return with shouts of joy,
carrying sheaves of grain.

s1: Children Are a Heritage from the LORD

d: A song of ascents. Of Solomon.

contents.verseText: Unless the LORD builds the house, its builders labor in vain; unless the LORD protects the city, its watchmen stand guard in vain.
contents: Unless the LORD builds the house,
its builders labor in vain;
unless the LORD protects the city,
its watchmen stand guard in vain.

contents.verseText: In vain you rise early and stay up late, toiling for bread to eat—for He gives sleep to His beloved.
contents: In vain you rise early
and stay up late,
toiling for bread to eat—
for He gives sleep to His beloved.

contents.verseText: Children are indeed a heritage from the LORD, and the fruit of the womb is His reward.
contents: Children are indeed a heritage from the LORD,
and the fruit of the womb is His reward.

contents.verseText: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior, so are children born in one’s youth.
contents: Like arrows in the hand of a warrior,
so are children born in one’s youth.

contents.verseText: Blessed is the man whose quiver is full of them. He will not be put to shame when he confronts the enemies at the gate.
contents: Blessed is the man
whose quiver is full of them.
He will not be put to shame
when he confronts the enemies at the gate.

s1: The Blessed Fear of the LORD

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: Blessed are all who fear the LORD, who walk in His ways!
contents: Blessed are all who fear the LORD,
who walk in His ways!

contents.verseText: For when you eat the fruit of your labor, blessings and prosperity will be yours.
contents: For when you eat the fruit of your labor,
blessings and prosperity will be yours.

contents.verseText: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine flourishing within your house, your sons like olive shoots sitting around your table.
contents: Your wife will be like a fruitful vine
flourishing within your house,
your sons like olive shoots
sitting around your table.

contents.verseText: In this way indeed shall blessing come to the man who fears the LORD.
contents: In this way indeed shall blessing come
to the man who fears the LORD.

contents.verseText: May the LORD bless you from Zion, that you may see the prosperity of Jerusalem all the days of your life,
contents: May the LORD bless you from Zion,
that you may see the prosperity of Jerusalem
all the days of your life,

contents.verseText: that you may see your children’s children. Peace be upon Israel!
contents: that you may see
your children’s children.
Peace be upon Israel!

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: Many a time they have persecuted me from my youth—let Israel now declare—
contents: Many a time they have persecuted me from my youth—
let Israel now declare—

contents.verseText: many a time they have persecuted me from my youth, but they have not prevailed against me.
contents: many a time they have persecuted me from my youth,
but they have not prevailed against me.

contents.verseText: The plowmen plowed over my back; they made their furrows long.
contents: The plowmen plowed over my back;
they made their furrows long.

contents.verseText: The LORD is righteous; He has cut me from the cords of the wicked.
contents: The LORD is righteous;
He has cut me from the cords of the wicked.

contents.verseText: May all who hate Zion be turned back in shame.
contents: May all who hate Zion
be turned back in shame.

contents.verseText: May they be like grass on the rooftops, which withers before it can grow,
contents: May they be like grass on the rooftops,
which withers before it can grow,

contents.verseText: unable to fill the hands of the reaper, or the arms of the binder of sheaves.
contents: unable to fill the hands of the reaper,
or the arms of the binder of sheaves.

contents.verseText: May none who pass by say to them, “The blessing of the LORD be on you; we bless you in the name of the LORD.”
contents: May none who pass by say to them,
“The blessing of the LORD be on you;
we bless you in the name of the LORD.”

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: Out of the depths I cry to You, O LORD!
contents: Out of the depths
I cry to You, O LORD!

contents.verseText: O Lord, hear my voice; let Your ears be attentive to my plea for mercy.
contents: O Lord, hear my voice;
let Your ears be attentive to my plea for mercy.

contents.verseText: If You, O LORD, kept track of iniquities, then who, O Lord, could stand?
contents: If You, O LORD, kept track of iniquities,
then who, O Lord, could stand?

contents.verseText: But with You there is forgiveness, so that You may be feared.
contents: But with You there is forgiveness,
so that You may be feared.

contents.verseText: I wait for the LORD; my soul does wait, and in His word I put my hope.
contents: I wait for the LORD; my soul does wait,
and in His word I put my hope.

contents.verseText: My soul waits for the Lord more than watchmen wait for the morning—more than watchmen wait for the morning.
contents: My soul waits for the Lord
more than watchmen wait for the morning—
more than watchmen wait for the morning.

contents.verseText: O Israel, put your hope in the LORD, for with the LORD is loving devotion, and with Him is redemption in abundance.
contents: O Israel, put your hope in the LORD,
for with the LORD is loving devotion,
and with Him is redemption in abundance.

contents.verseText: And He will redeem Israel from all iniquity.
contents: And He will redeem Israel
from all iniquity.

d: A song of ascents. Of David.

contents.verseText: My heart is not proud, O LORD, my eyes are not haughty. I do not aspire to great things or matters too lofty for me.
contents: My heart is not proud, O LORD,
my eyes are not haughty.
I do not aspire to great things
or matters too lofty for me.

contents.verseText: Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul; like a weaned child with his mother, like a weaned child is my soul within me.
contents: Surely I have stilled and quieted my soul;
like a weaned child with his mother,
like a weaned child is my soul within me.

contents.verseText: O Israel, put your hope in the LORD, both now and forevermore.
contents: O Israel, put your hope in the LORD,
both now and forevermore.

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: O LORD, remember on behalf of David all the hardships he endured,
contents: O LORD, remember on behalf of David
all the hardships he endured,

contents.verseText: how he swore an oath to the LORD, and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:
contents: how he swore an oath to the LORD,
and vowed to the Mighty One of Jacob:

contents.verseText: “I will not enter my house or get into my bed,
contents: “I will not enter my house
or get into my bed,

contents.verseText: I will not give sleep to my eyes or slumber to my eyelids,
contents: I will not give sleep to my eyes
or slumber to my eyelids,

contents.verseText: until I find a place for the LORD, a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.”
contents: until I find a place for the LORD,
a dwelling for the Mighty One of Jacob.

footnote.ft: LXX for the God of Jacob; see Acts 7:46.

contents.verseText: We heard that the ark was in Ephrathah; we found it in the fields of Jaar.
contents: We heard that the ark was in Ephrathah;

footnote.ft: Literally Behold, we heard of it in Ephrathah

contents: we found it in the fields of Jaar.

contents.verseText: Let us go to His dwelling place; let us worship at His footstool.
contents: Let us go to His dwelling place;
let us worship at His footstool.

contents.verseText: Arise, O LORD, to Your resting place, You and the ark of Your strength.
contents: Arise, O LORD, to Your resting place,
You and the ark of Your strength.

contents.verseText: May Your priests be clothed with righteousness, and Your saints shout for joy.
contents: May Your priests be clothed with righteousness,
and Your saints shout for joy.

contents.verseText: For the sake of Your servant David, do not reject Your anointed one.
contents: For the sake of Your servant David,
do not reject Your anointed one.

contents.verseText: The LORD swore an oath to David, a promise He will not revoke: “One of your descendants I will place on your throne.
contents: The LORD swore an oath to David,
a promise He will not revoke:
“One of your descendants
I will place on your throne.

footnote.ft: Literally “From the fruit of your body I will set (one) on your throne. Cited in Acts 2:30

contents.verseText: If your sons keep My covenant and the testimony I will teach them, then their sons will also sit on your throne forever and ever.”
contents: If your sons keep My covenant
and the testimony I will teach them,
then their sons will also sit on your throne
forever and ever.”

contents.verseText: For the LORD has chosen Zion; He has desired it for His home:
contents: For the LORD has chosen Zion;
He has desired it for His home:

contents.verseText: “This is My resting place forever and ever; here I will dwell, for I have desired this home.
contents: “This is My resting place forever and ever;
here I will dwell, for I have desired this home.

contents.verseText: I will bless her with abundant provisions; I will satisfy her poor with bread.
contents: I will bless her with abundant provisions;
I will satisfy her poor with bread.

contents.verseText: I will clothe her priests with salvation, and her saints will sing out in joy.
contents: I will clothe her priests with salvation,
and her saints will sing out in joy.

contents.verseText: There I will make a horn grow for David; I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.
contents: There I will make a horn grow for David;
I have prepared a lamp for My anointed one.

contents.verseText: I will clothe his enemies with shame, but the crown upon him will gleam.”
contents: I will clothe his enemies with shame,
but the crown upon him will gleam.”

s1: How Pleasant to Live in Harmony!

d: A song of ascents. Of David.

contents.verseText: Behold, how good and pleasant it is when brothers live together in harmony!
contents: Behold, how good and pleasant it is
when brothers live together in harmony!

contents.verseText: It is like fine oil on the head, running down on the beard, running down Aaron’s beard over the collar of his robes.
contents: It is like fine oil on the head,
running down on the beard,
running down Aaron’s beard
over the collar of his robes.

contents.verseText: It is like the dew of Hermon falling on the mountains of Zion. For there the LORD has bestowed the blessing of life forevermore.
contents: It is like the dew of Hermon
falling on the mountains of Zion.
For there the LORD has bestowed the blessing
of life forevermore.

s1: Bless the LORD, All You Servants

d: A song of ascents.

contents.verseText: Come, bless the LORD, all you servants of the LORD who serve by night in the house of the LORD!
contents: Come, bless the LORD,
all you servants of the LORD
who serve by night
in the house of the LORD!

contents.verseText: Lift up your hands to the sanctuary and bless the LORD!
contents: Lift up your hands to the sanctuary
and bless the LORD!

contents.verseText: May the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth, bless you from Zion.
contents: May the LORD, the Maker of heaven and earth,
bless you from Zion.

s1: Give Praise, O Servants of the LORD

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verses 3 and 21

contents.verseText: Praise the name of the LORD. Give praise, O servants of the LORD,
contents: Praise the name of the LORD.
Give praise, O servants of the LORD,

contents.verseText: who stand in the house of the LORD, in the courts of the house of our God.
contents: who stand in the house of the LORD,
in the courts of the house of our God.

contents.verseText: Hallelujah, for the LORD is good; sing praises to His name, for it is lovely.
contents: Hallelujah, for the LORD is good;
sing praises to His name, for it is lovely.

contents.verseText: For the LORD has chosen Jacob as His own, Israel as His treasured possession.
contents: For the LORD has chosen Jacob as His own,
Israel as His treasured possession.

contents.verseText: For I know that the LORD is great; our Lord is above all gods.
contents: For I know that the LORD is great;
our Lord is above all gods.

contents.verseText: The LORD does all that pleases Him in the heavens and on the earth, in the seas and in all their depths.
contents: The LORD does all that pleases Him
in the heavens and on the earth,
in the seas and in all their depths.

contents.verseText: He causes the clouds to rise from the ends of the earth. He generates the lightning with the rain and brings forth the wind from His storehouses.
contents: He causes the clouds to rise
from the ends of the earth.
He generates the lightning with the rain
and brings forth the wind from His storehouses.

contents.verseText: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt, of both man and beast.
contents: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt,
of both man and beast.

contents.verseText: He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt, against Pharaoh and all his servants.
contents: He sent signs and wonders into your midst, O Egypt,
against Pharaoh and all his servants.

contents.verseText: He struck down many nations and slaughtered mighty kings:
contents: He struck down many nations
and slaughtered mighty kings:

contents.verseText: Sihon king of the Amorites, Og king of Bashan, and all the kings of Canaan.
contents: Sihon king of the Amorites,
Og king of Bashan,
and all the kings of Canaan.

contents.verseText: He gave their land as an inheritance, as a heritage to His people Israel.
contents: He gave their land as an inheritance,
as a heritage to His people Israel.

contents.verseText: Your name, O LORD, endures forever, Your renown, O LORD, through all generations.
contents: Your name, O LORD, endures forever,
Your renown, O LORD, through all generations.

contents.verseText: For the LORD will vindicate His people and will have compassion on His servants.
contents: For the LORD will vindicate His people

footnote.ft: Or will judge His people; see also LXX; cited in Hebrews 10:30.

contents: and will have compassion on His servants.

contents.verseText: The idols of the nations are silver and gold, made by the hands of men.
contents: The idols of the nations are silver and gold,
made by the hands of men.

contents.verseText: They have mouths, but cannot speak; they have eyes, but cannot see;
contents: They have mouths, but cannot speak;
they have eyes, but cannot see;

contents.verseText: they have ears, but cannot hear; nor is there breath in their mouths.
contents: they have ears, but cannot hear;
nor is there breath in their mouths.

contents.verseText: Those who make them become like them, as do all who trust in them.
contents: Those who make them become like them,
as do all who trust in them.

contents.verseText: O house of Israel, bless the LORD; O house of Aaron, bless the LORD;
contents: O house of Israel, bless the LORD;
O house of Aaron, bless the LORD;

contents.verseText: O house of Levi, bless the LORD; you who fear the LORD, bless the LORD!
contents: O house of Levi, bless the LORD;
you who fear the LORD, bless the LORD!

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD from Zion—He who dwells in Jerusalem. Hallelujah!
contents: Blessed be the LORD from Zion—
He who dwells in Jerusalem.
Hallelujah!

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the LORD, for He is good.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the God of gods. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the God of gods.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the Lord of lords. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the Lord of lords.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He alone does great wonders. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: He alone does great wonders.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: By His insight He made the heavens. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: By His insight He made the heavens.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He spread out the earth upon the waters. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: He spread out the earth upon the waters.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He made the great lights—His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: He made the great lights—
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: the sun to rule the day, His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: the sun to rule the day,
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: the moon and stars to govern the night. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: the moon and stars to govern the night.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: He struck down the firstborn of Egypt
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: and brought Israel out from among them His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: and brought Israel out from among them
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: with a mighty hand and an outstretched arm.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He divided the Red Sea in two His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: He divided the Red Sea

footnote.ft: Or the Sea of Reeds; also in verse 15

contents: in two
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: and led Israel through the midst, His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: and led Israel through the midst,
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: but swept Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: but swept

footnote.ft: Hebrew shook off

contents: Pharaoh and his army into the Red Sea.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He led His people through the wilderness. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: He led His people through the wilderness.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He struck down great kings His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: He struck down great kings
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: and slaughtered mighty kings—His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: and slaughtered mighty kings—
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: Sihon king of the Amorites His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Sihon king of the Amorites
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: and Og king of Bashan—His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: and Og king of Bashan—
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: and He gave their land as an inheritance, His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: and He gave their land as an inheritance,
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: a heritage to His servant Israel. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: a heritage to His servant Israel.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He remembered us in our low estate His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: He remembered us in our low estate
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: and freed us from our enemies. His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: and freed us from our enemies.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: He gives food to every creature. His loving devotion endures forever.
