contents: He gives food to every creature.
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: Give thanks to the God of heaven! His loving devotion endures forever.
contents: Give thanks to the God of heaven!
His loving devotion endures forever.

contents.verseText: By the rivers of Babylon we sat and wept when we remembered Zion.
contents: By the rivers of Babylon we sat and wept
when we remembered Zion.

contents.verseText: There on the willows we hung our harps,
contents: There on the willows

footnote.ft: Or poplars

contents: we hung our harps,

contents.verseText: for there our captors requested a song; our tormentors demanded songs of joy: “Sing us a song of Zion.”
contents: for there our captors requested a song;
our tormentors demanded songs of joy:
“Sing us a song of Zion.”

contents.verseText: How can we sing a song of the LORD in a foreign land?
contents: How can we sing a song of the LORD
in a foreign land?

contents.verseText: If I forget you, O Jerusalem, may my right hand cease to function.
contents: If I forget you, O Jerusalem,
may my right hand cease to function.

contents.verseText: May my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth if I do not remember you, if I do not exalt Jerusalem as my greatest joy!
contents: May my tongue cling to the roof of my mouth
if I do not remember you,
if I do not exalt Jerusalem
as my greatest joy!

contents.verseText: Remember, O LORD, the sons of Edom on the day Jerusalem fell: “Destroy it,” they said, “tear it down to its foundations!”
contents: Remember, O LORD,
the sons of Edom on the day Jerusalem fell:
“Destroy it,” they said,
“tear it down to its foundations!”

contents.verseText: O Daughter of Babylon, doomed to destruction, blessed is he who repays you as you have done to us.
contents: O Daughter of Babylon,
doomed to destruction,
blessed is he who repays you
as you have done to us.

contents.verseText: Blessed is he who seizes your infants and dashes them against the rocks.
contents: Blessed is he who seizes your infants
and dashes them against the rocks.

d: Of David.

contents.verseText: I give You thanks with all my heart; before the gods I sing Your praises.
contents: I give You thanks with all my heart;
before the gods I sing Your praises.

contents.verseText: I bow down toward Your holy temple and give thanks to Your name for Your loving devotion and Your faithfulness; You have exalted Your name and Your word above all else.
contents: I bow down toward Your holy temple
and give thanks to Your name
for Your loving devotion and Your faithfulness;
You have exalted Your name
and Your word above all else.

contents.verseText: On the day I called, You answered me; You emboldened me and strengthened my soul.
contents: On the day I called, You answered me;
You emboldened me and strengthened my soul.

footnote.ft: Or You emboldened me with strength in my soul

contents.verseText: All the kings of the earth will give You thanks, O LORD, when they hear the words of Your mouth.
contents: All the kings of the earth will give You thanks, O LORD,
when they hear the words of Your mouth.

contents.verseText: They will sing of the ways of the LORD, for the glory of the LORD is great.
contents: They will sing of the ways of the LORD,
for the glory of the LORD is great.

contents.verseText: Though the LORD is on high, He attends to the lowly; but the proud He knows from afar.
contents: Though the LORD is on high,
He attends to the lowly;
but the proud He knows from afar.

contents.verseText: If I walk in the midst of trouble, You preserve me from the anger of my foes; You extend Your hand, and Your right hand saves me.
contents: If I walk in the midst of trouble,
You preserve me from the anger of my foes;
You extend Your hand,
and Your right hand saves me.

contents.verseText: The LORD will fulfill His purpose for me. O LORD, Your loving devotion endures forever—do not abandon the works of Your hands.
contents: The LORD will fulfill
His purpose for me.
O LORD, Your loving devotion endures forever—
do not abandon the works of Your hands.

s1: You Have Searched Me and Known Me

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: O LORD, You have searched me and known me.
contents: O LORD, You have searched me
and known me.

contents.verseText: You know when I sit and when I rise; You understand my thoughts from afar.
contents: You know when I sit and when I rise;
You understand my thoughts from afar.

contents.verseText: You search out my path and my lying down; You are aware of all my ways.
contents: You search out my path and my lying down;
You are aware of all my ways.

contents.verseText: Even before a word is on my tongue, You know all about it, O LORD.
contents: Even before a word is on my tongue,
You know all about it, O LORD.

contents.verseText: You hem me in behind and before; You have laid Your hand upon me.
contents: You hem me in behind and before;
You have laid Your hand upon me.

contents.verseText: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me, too lofty for me to attain.
contents: Such knowledge is too wonderful for me,
too lofty for me to attain.

contents.verseText: Where can I go to escape Your Spirit? Where can I flee from Your presence?
contents: Where can I go to escape Your Spirit?
Where can I flee from Your presence?

contents.verseText: If I ascend to the heavens, You are there; if I make my bed in Sheol, You are there.
contents: If I ascend to the heavens, You are there;
if I make my bed in Sheol, You are there.

contents.verseText: If I rise on the wings of the dawn, if I settle by the farthest sea,
contents: If I rise on the wings of the dawn,
if I settle by the farthest sea,

contents.verseText: even there Your hand will guide me; Your right hand will hold me fast.
contents: even there Your hand will guide me;
Your right hand will hold me fast.

contents.verseText: If I say, “Surely the darkness will hide me, and the light become night around me”—
contents: If I say, “Surely the darkness will hide me,
and the light become night around me”—

contents.verseText: even the darkness is not dark to You, but the night shines like the day, for darkness is as light to You.
contents: even the darkness is not dark to You,
but the night shines like the day,
for darkness is as light to You.

contents.verseText: For You formed my inmost being; You knit me together in my mother’s womb.
contents: For You formed my inmost being;

footnote.ft: Hebrew my kidneys

contents: You knit me together in my mother’s womb.

contents.verseText: I praise You, for I am fearfully and wonderfully made. Marvelous are Your works, and I know this very well.
contents: I praise You,
for I am fearfully and wonderfully made.
Marvelous are Your works,
and I know this very well.

contents.verseText: My frame was not hidden from You when I was made in secret, when I was woven together in the depths of the earth.
contents: My frame was not hidden from You
when I was made in secret,
when I was woven together
in the depths of the earth.

contents.verseText: Your eyes saw my unformed body; all my days were written in Your book and ordained for me before one of them came to be.
contents: Your eyes saw my unformed body;
all my days were written in Your book
and ordained for me
before one of them came to be.

contents.verseText: How precious to me are Your thoughts, O God, how vast is their sum!
contents: How precious to me are Your thoughts,

footnote.ft: Or How amazing are Your thoughts concerning me

contents: O God,
how vast is their sum!

contents.verseText: If I were to count them, they would outnumber the grains of sand; and when I awake, I am still with You.
contents: If I were to count them,
they would outnumber the grains of sand;
and when I awake,
I am still with You.

contents.verseText: O God, that You would slay the wicked—away from me, you bloodthirsty men—
contents: O God, that You would slay the wicked—
away from me, you bloodthirsty men—

contents.verseText: who speak of You deceitfully; Your enemies take Your name in vain.
contents: who speak of You deceitfully;
Your enemies take Your name in vain.

footnote.ft: Hebrew Your enemies take in vain or Your enemies bear up in vain; LXX Your enemies take Your cities in vain

contents.verseText: Do I not hate those who hate You, O LORD, and detest those who rise against You?
contents: Do I not hate those who hate You, O LORD,
and detest those who rise against You?

contents.verseText: I hate them with perfect hatred; I count them as my enemies.
contents: I hate them with perfect hatred;
I count them as my enemies.

contents.verseText: Search me, O God, and know my heart; test me and know my concerns.
contents: Search me, O God, and know my heart;
test me and know my concerns.

contents.verseText: See if there is any offensive way in me; lead me in the way everlasting.
contents: See if there is any offensive way in me;
lead me in the way everlasting.

d: For the choirmaster. A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men. Protect me from men of violence,
contents: Rescue me, O LORD, from evil men.
Protect me from men of violence,

contents.verseText: who devise evil in their hearts and stir up war all day long.
contents: who devise evil in their hearts
and stir up war all day long.

contents.verseText: They sharpen their tongues like snakes; the venom of vipers is on their lips. Selah
contents: They sharpen their tongues like snakes;
the venom of vipers is on their lips.

footnote.ft: Cited in Romans 3:13

contents: Selah

contents.verseText: Guard me, O LORD, from the hands of the wicked. Keep me safe from men of violence who scheme to make me stumble.
contents: Guard me, O LORD,
from the hands of the wicked.
Keep me safe from men of violence
who scheme to make me stumble.

contents.verseText: The proud hide a snare for me; the cords of their net are spread along the path, and lures are set out for me. Selah
contents: The proud hide a snare for me;
the cords of their net are spread along the path,
and lures are set out for me.
Selah

contents.verseText: I say to the LORD, “You are my God.” Hear, O LORD, my cry for help.
contents: I say to the LORD, “You are my God.”
Hear, O LORD, my cry for help.

contents.verseText: O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation, You shield my head in the day of battle.
contents: O GOD the Lord, the strength of my salvation,
You shield my head in the day of battle.

contents.verseText: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked; do not promote their evil plans, lest they be exalted. Selah
contents: Grant not, O LORD, the desires of the wicked;
do not promote their evil plans,
lest they be exalted.
Selah

contents.verseText: May the heads of those who surround me be covered in the trouble their lips have caused.
contents: May the heads of those who surround me
be covered in the trouble their lips have caused.

contents.verseText: May burning coals fall on them; may they be thrown into the fire, into the miry pits, never to rise again.
contents: May burning coals fall on them;
may they be thrown into the fire,
into the miry pits, never to rise again.

contents.verseText: May no slanderer be established in the land; may calamity hunt down the man of violence.
contents: May no slanderer be established in the land;
may calamity hunt down the man of violence.

contents.verseText: I know that the LORD upholds justice for the poor and defends the cause of the needy.
contents: I know that the LORD upholds justice for the poor
and defends the cause of the needy.

contents.verseText: Surely the righteous will praise Your name; the upright will dwell in Your presence.
contents: Surely the righteous will praise Your name;
the upright will dwell in Your presence.

d: A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: I call upon You, O LORD; come quickly to me. Hear my voice when I call to You.
contents: I call upon You, O LORD; come quickly to me.
Hear my voice when I call to You.

contents.verseText: May my prayer be set before You like incense, my uplifted hands like the evening offering.
contents: May my prayer be set before You like incense,
my uplifted hands like the evening offering.

contents.verseText: Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth; keep watch at the door of my lips.
contents: Set a guard, O LORD, over my mouth;
keep watch at the door of my lips.

contents.verseText: Do not let my heart be drawn to any evil thing or take part in works of wickedness with men who do iniquity; let me not feast on their delicacies.
contents: Do not let my heart be drawn to any evil thing
or take part in works of wickedness
with men who do iniquity;
let me not feast on their delicacies.

contents.verseText: Let the righteous man strike me; let his rebuke be an act of loving devotion. It is oil for my head; let me not refuse it. For my prayer is ever against the deeds of the wicked.
contents: Let the righteous man strike me;
let his rebuke be an act of loving devotion.
It is oil for my head; let me not refuse it.
For my prayer is ever against the deeds of the wicked.

contents.verseText: When their rulers are thrown down from the cliffs, the people will listen to my words, for they are pleasant.
contents: When their rulers are thrown down from the cliffs,
the people will listen to my words,
for they are pleasant.

contents.verseText: As when one plows and breaks up the soil, so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol.
contents: As when one plows and breaks up the soil,
so our bones have been scattered at the mouth of Sheol.

contents.verseText: But my eyes are fixed on You, O GOD the Lord. In You I seek refuge; do not leave my soul defenseless.
contents: But my eyes are fixed on You,
O GOD the Lord.
In You I seek refuge;
do not leave my soul defenseless.

footnote.ft: Or do not pour out my life or do not give me over to death

contents.verseText: Keep me from the snares they have laid for me, and from the lures of evildoers.
contents: Keep me from the snares they have laid for me,
and from the lures of evildoers.

contents.verseText: Let the wicked fall into their own nets, while I pass by in safety.
contents: Let the wicked fall into their own nets,
while I pass by in safety.

s1: I Lift My Voice to the LORD

d: A Maskil

footnote.ft: Maskil is probably a musical or liturgical term; used for Psalms 32, 42, 44–45, 52–55, 74, 78, 88–89, and 142.

d: of David, when he was in the cave. A prayer.

contents.verseText: I cry aloud to the LORD; I lift my voice to the LORD for mercy.
contents: I cry aloud to the LORD;
I lift my voice to the LORD for mercy.

contents.verseText: I pour out my complaint before Him; I reveal my trouble to Him.
contents: I pour out my complaint before Him;
I reveal my trouble to Him.

contents.verseText: Although my spirit grows faint within me, You know my way. Along the path I travel they have hidden a snare for me.
contents: Although my spirit grows faint within me,
You know my way.
Along the path I travel
they have hidden a snare for me.

contents.verseText: Look to my right and see; no one attends to me. There is no refuge for me; no one cares for my soul.
contents: Look to my right and see;
no one attends to me.
There is no refuge for me;
no one cares for my soul.

contents.verseText: I cry to You, O LORD: “You are my refuge, my portion in the land of the living.”
contents: I cry to You, O LORD: “You are my refuge,
my portion in the land of the living.”

contents.verseText: Listen to my cry, for I am brought quite low. Rescue me from my pursuers, for they are too strong for me.
contents: Listen to my cry,
for I am brought quite low.
Rescue me from my pursuers,
for they are too strong for me.

contents.verseText: Free my soul from prison, that I may praise Your name. The righteous will gather around me because of Your goodness to me.
contents: Free my soul from prison,
that I may praise Your name.
The righteous will gather around me
because of Your goodness to me.

s1: I Stretch Out My Hands to You

d: A Psalm of David.

contents.verseText: O LORD, hear my prayer. In Your faithfulness, give ear to my plea; in Your righteousness, answer me.
contents: O LORD, hear my prayer.
In Your faithfulness, give ear to my plea;
in Your righteousness, answer me.

contents.verseText: Do not bring Your servant into judgment, for no one alive is righteous before You.
contents: Do not bring Your servant into judgment,
for no one alive is righteous before You.

contents.verseText: For the enemy has pursued my soul, crushing my life to the ground, making me dwell in darkness like those long since dead.
contents: For the enemy has pursued my soul,
crushing my life to the ground,
making me dwell in darkness
like those long since dead.

contents.verseText: My spirit grows faint within me; my heart is dismayed inside me.
contents: My spirit grows faint within me;
my heart is dismayed inside me.

contents.verseText: I remember the days of old; I meditate on all Your works; I consider the work of Your hands.
contents: I remember the days of old;
I meditate on all Your works;
I consider the work of Your hands.

contents.verseText: I stretch out my hands to You; my soul thirsts for You like a parched land. Selah
contents: I stretch out my hands to You;
my soul thirsts for You like a parched land.
Selah

contents.verseText: Answer me quickly, O LORD; my spirit fails. Do not hide Your face from me, or I will be like those who descend to the Pit.
contents: Answer me quickly, O LORD;
my spirit fails.
Do not hide Your face from me,
or I will be like those who descend to the Pit.

contents.verseText: Let me hear Your loving devotion in the morning, for I have put my trust in You. Teach me the way I should walk, for to You I lift up my soul.
contents: Let me hear Your loving devotion in the morning,
for I have put my trust in You.
Teach me the way I should walk,
for to You I lift up my soul.

contents.verseText: Deliver me from my enemies, O LORD; I flee to You for refuge.
contents: Deliver me from my enemies, O LORD;
I flee to You for refuge.

footnote.ft: LXX and one Hebrew manuscript; most Hebrew manuscripts in You I take cover

contents.verseText: Teach me to do Your will, for You are my God. May Your good Spirit lead me on level ground.
contents: Teach me to do Your will,
for You are my God.
May Your good Spirit lead me
on level ground.

contents.verseText: For the sake of Your name, O LORD, revive me. In Your righteousness, bring my soul out of trouble.
contents: For the sake of Your name, O LORD,
revive me.
In Your righteousness,
bring my soul out of trouble.

contents.verseText: And in Your loving devotion, cut off my enemies. Destroy all who afflict me, for I am Your servant.
contents: And in Your loving devotion,
cut off my enemies.
Destroy all who afflict me,
for I am Your servant.

s1: Blessed Be the LORD, My Rock

d: Of David.

contents.verseText: Blessed be the LORD, my Rock, who trains my hands for war, my fingers for battle.
contents: Blessed be the LORD, my Rock,
who trains my hands for war,
my fingers for battle.

contents.verseText: He is my steadfast love and my fortress, my stronghold and my deliverer. He is my shield, in whom I take refuge, who subdues peoples under me.
contents: He is my steadfast love and my fortress,
my stronghold and my deliverer.
He is my shield, in whom I take refuge,
who subdues peoples

footnote.ft: Many Hebrew manuscripts, DSS, Syriac; most Hebrew manuscripts subdues my people

contents: under me.

contents.verseText: O LORD, what is man, that You regard him, the son of man that You think of him?
contents: O LORD, what is man, that You regard him,
the son of man that You think of him?

contents.verseText: Man is like a breath; his days are like a passing shadow.
contents: Man is like a breath;
his days are like a passing shadow.

contents.verseText: Part Your heavens, O LORD, and come down; touch the mountains, that they may smoke.
contents: Part Your heavens, O LORD, and come down;
touch the mountains, that they may smoke.

contents.verseText: Flash forth Your lightning and scatter them; shoot Your arrows and rout them.
contents: Flash forth Your lightning and scatter them;
shoot Your arrows and rout them.

contents.verseText: Reach down from on high; set me free and rescue me from the deep waters, from the grasp of foreigners,
contents: Reach down from on high;
set me free and rescue me
from the deep waters,
from the grasp of foreigners,

contents.verseText: whose mouths speak falsehood, whose right hands are deceitful.
contents: whose mouths speak falsehood,
whose right hands are deceitful.

contents.verseText: I will sing to You a new song, O God; on a harp of ten strings I will make music to You—
contents: I will sing to You a new song, O God;
on a harp of ten strings I will make music to You—

contents.verseText: to Him who gives victory to kings, who frees His servant David from the deadly sword.
contents: to Him who gives victory to kings,
who frees His servant David from the deadly sword.

contents.verseText: Set me free and rescue me from the grasp of foreigners, whose mouths speak falsehood, whose right hands are deceitful.
contents: Set me free and rescue me
from the grasp of foreigners,
whose mouths speak falsehood,
whose right hands are deceitful.

contents.verseText: Then our sons will be like plants nurtured in their youth, our daughters like corner pillars carved to adorn a palace.
contents: Then our sons will be like plants
nurtured in their youth,
our daughters like corner pillars
carved to adorn a palace.

contents.verseText: Our storehouses will be full, supplying all manner of produce; our flocks will bring forth thousands, tens of thousands in our fields.
contents: Our storehouses will be full,
supplying all manner of produce;
our flocks will bring forth thousands,
tens of thousands in our fields.

contents.verseText: Our oxen will bear great loads. There will be no breach in the walls, no going into captivity, and no cry of lament in our streets.
contents: Our oxen will bear great loads.

footnote.ft: Or Our chieftains will be firmly established

contents: There will be no breach in the walls,
no going into captivity,
and no cry of lament in our streets.

contents.verseText: Blessed are the people of whom this is so; blessed are the people whose God is the LORD.
contents: Blessed are the people of whom this is so;
blessed are the people whose God is the LORD.

s1: I Will Exalt You, My God and King

d: A Psalm of praise. Of David.

footnote.ft: This psalm is an acrostic poem, each verse beginning with the successive letters of the Hebrew alphabet.

contents.verseText: I will exalt You, my God and King; I will bless Your name forever and ever.
contents: I will exalt You, my God and King;
I will bless Your name forever and ever.

contents.verseText: Every day I will bless You, and I will praise Your name forever and ever.
contents: Every day I will bless You,
and I will praise Your name forever and ever.

contents.verseText: Great is the LORD and greatly to be praised; His greatness is unsearchable.
contents: Great is the LORD and greatly to be praised;
His greatness is unsearchable.

contents.verseText: One generation will commend Your works to the next, and will proclaim Your mighty acts—
contents: One generation will commend Your works to the next,
and will proclaim Your mighty acts—

contents.verseText: the glorious splendor of Your majesty. And I will meditate on Your wondrous works.
contents: the glorious splendor of Your majesty.
And I will meditate on Your wondrous works.

contents.verseText: They will proclaim the power of Your awesome deeds, and I will declare Your greatness.
contents: They will proclaim the power of Your awesome deeds,
and I will declare Your greatness.

contents.verseText: They will extol the fame of Your abundant goodness and sing joyfully of Your righteousness.
contents: They will extol the fame of Your abundant goodness
and sing joyfully of Your righteousness.

contents.verseText: The LORD is gracious and compassionate, slow to anger and abounding in loving devotion.
contents: The LORD is gracious and compassionate,
slow to anger and abounding in loving devotion.

contents.verseText: The LORD is good to all; His compassion rests on all He has made.
contents: The LORD is good to all;
His compassion rests on all He has made.

contents.verseText: All You have made will give You thanks, O LORD, and Your saints will bless You.
contents: All You have made will give You thanks, O LORD,
and Your saints will bless You.

contents.verseText: They will tell of the glory of Your kingdom and speak of Your might,
contents: They will tell of the glory of Your kingdom
and speak of Your might,

contents.verseText: to make known to men Your mighty acts and the glorious splendor of Your kingdom.
contents: to make known to men Your mighty acts
and the glorious splendor of Your kingdom.

contents.verseText: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and Your dominion endures through all generations. The LORD is faithful in all His words and kind in all His actions.
contents: Your kingdom is an everlasting kingdom,
and Your dominion endures through all generations.
The LORD is faithful in all His words
and kind in all His actions.

footnote.ft: The final two lines are supplied by one MT manuscript, LXX, Syriac, and DSS.

contents.verseText: The LORD upholds all who fall and lifts up all who are bowed down.
contents: The LORD upholds all who fall
and lifts up all who are bowed down.

contents.verseText: The eyes of all look to You, and You give them their food in season.
contents: The eyes of all look to You,
and You give them their food in season.

contents.verseText: You open Your hand and satisfy the desire of every living thing.
contents: You open Your hand
and satisfy the desire of every living thing.

contents.verseText: The LORD is righteous in all His ways and kind in all His deeds.
contents: The LORD is righteous in all His ways
and kind in all His deeds.

contents.verseText: The LORD is near to all who call on Him, to all who call out to Him in truth.
contents: The LORD is near to all who call on Him,
to all who call out to Him in truth.

contents.verseText: He fulfills the desires of those who fear Him; He hears their cry and saves them.
contents: He fulfills the desires of those who fear Him;
He hears their cry and saves them.

contents.verseText: The LORD preserves all who love Him, but all the wicked He will destroy.
contents: The LORD preserves all who love Him,
but all the wicked He will destroy.

contents.verseText: My mouth will declare the praise of the LORD; let every creature bless His holy name forever and ever.
contents: My mouth will declare the praise of the LORD;
let every creature bless His holy name
forever and ever.

s1: Praise the LORD, O My Soul

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verse 10

contents.verseText: Praise the LORD, O my soul.
contents: Praise the LORD, O my soul.

contents.verseText: I will praise the LORD all my life; I will sing praises to my God while I have my being.
contents: I will praise the LORD all my life;
I will sing praises to my God while I have my being.

contents.verseText: Put not your trust in princes, in mortal man, who cannot save.
contents: Put not your trust in princes,
in mortal man, who cannot save.

contents.verseText: When his spirit departs, he returns to the ground; on that very day his plans perish.
contents: When his spirit departs, he returns to the ground;
on that very day his plans perish.

contents.verseText: Blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob, whose hope is in the LORD his God,
contents: Blessed is he whose help is the God of Jacob,
whose hope is in the LORD his God,

contents.verseText: the Maker of heaven and earth, the sea, and everything in them. He remains faithful forever.
contents: the Maker of heaven and earth,
the sea, and everything in them.
He remains faithful forever.

contents.verseText: He executes justice for the oppressed and gives food to the hungry. The LORD sets the prisoners free,
contents: He executes justice for the oppressed
and gives food to the hungry.
The LORD sets the prisoners free,

contents.verseText: the LORD opens the eyes of the blind, the LORD lifts those who are weighed down, the LORD loves the righteous.
contents: the LORD opens the eyes of the blind,
the LORD lifts those who are weighed down,
the LORD loves the righteous.

contents.verseText: The LORD protects foreigners; He sustains the fatherless and the widow, but the ways of the wicked He frustrates.
contents: The LORD protects foreigners;
He sustains the fatherless and the widow,
but the ways of the wicked He frustrates.

contents.verseText: The LORD reigns forever, your God, O Zion, for all generations. Hallelujah!
contents: The LORD reigns forever,
your God, O Zion, for all generations.
Hallelujah!

s1: It Is Good to Sing Praises

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verse 20

contents.verseText: How good it is to sing praises to our God, how pleasant and lovely to praise Him!
contents: How good it is to sing praises to our God,
how pleasant and lovely to praise Him!

contents.verseText: The LORD builds up Jerusalem; He gathers the exiles of Israel.
contents: The LORD builds up Jerusalem;
He gathers the exiles of Israel.

contents.verseText: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.
contents: He heals the brokenhearted
and binds up their wounds.

contents.verseText: He determines the number of the stars; He calls them each by name.
contents: He determines the number of the stars;
He calls them each by name.

contents.verseText: Great is our Lord, and mighty in power; His understanding has no limit.
contents: Great is our Lord, and mighty in power;
His understanding has no limit.

contents.verseText: The LORD sustains the humble, but casts the wicked to the ground.
contents: The LORD sustains the humble,
but casts the wicked to the ground.

contents.verseText: Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving; make music on the harp to our God,
contents: Sing to the LORD with thanksgiving;
make music on the harp to our God,

contents.verseText: who covers the sky with clouds, who prepares rain for the earth, who makes grass to grow on the hills.
contents: who covers the sky with clouds,
who prepares rain for the earth,
who makes grass to grow on the hills.

contents.verseText: He provides food for the animals, and for the young ravens when they call.
contents: He provides food for the animals,
and for the young ravens when they call.

contents.verseText: He does not delight in the strength of the horse; He takes no pleasure in the legpower of the man.
contents: He does not delight in the strength of the horse;
He takes no pleasure in the legpower of the man.

contents.verseText: The LORD is pleased with those who fear Him, who hope in His loving devotion.
contents: The LORD is pleased with those who fear Him,
who hope in His loving devotion.

contents.verseText: Exalt the LORD, O Jerusalem; praise your God, O Zion!
contents: Exalt the LORD, O Jerusalem;
praise your God, O Zion!

contents.verseText: For He strengthens the bars of your gates and blesses the children within you.
contents: For He strengthens the bars of your gates
and blesses the children within you.

contents.verseText: He makes peace at your borders; He fills you with the finest wheat.
contents: He makes peace at your borders;
He fills you with the finest wheat.

contents.verseText: He sends forth His command to the earth; His word runs swiftly.
contents: He sends forth His command to the earth;
His word runs swiftly.

contents.verseText: He spreads the snow like wool; He scatters the frost like ashes;
contents: He spreads the snow like wool;
He scatters the frost like ashes;

contents.verseText: He casts forth His hail like pebbles. Who can withstand His icy blast?
contents: He casts forth His hail like pebbles.

footnote.ft: Or like crumbs or like morsels

contents: Who can withstand His icy blast?

contents.verseText: He sends forth His word and melts them; He unleashes His winds, and the waters flow.
contents: He sends forth His word and melts them;
He unleashes His winds, and the waters flow.

contents.verseText: He declares His word to Jacob, His statutes and judgments to Israel.
contents: He declares His word to Jacob,
His statutes and judgments to Israel.

contents.verseText: He has done this for no other nation; they do not know His judgments. Hallelujah!
contents: He has done this for no other nation;
they do not know His judgments.

footnote.ft: MT; DSS and LXX He has not made known to them His judgments

contents: Hallelujah!

s1: Praise the LORD from the Heavens

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verse 14

contents.verseText: Praise the LORD from the heavens; praise Him in the highest places.
contents: Praise the LORD from the heavens;
praise Him in the highest places.

footnote.ft: See Matthew 21:9, Mark 11:10, and Luke 19:38.

contents.verseText: Praise Him, all His angels; praise Him, all His heavenly hosts.
contents: Praise Him, all His angels;
praise Him, all His heavenly hosts.

contents.verseText: Praise Him, O sun and moon; praise Him, all you shining stars.
contents: Praise Him, O sun and moon;
praise Him, all you shining stars.

contents.verseText: Praise Him, O highest heavens, and you waters above the skies.
contents: Praise Him, O highest heavens,
and you waters above the skies.

contents.verseText: Let them praise the name of the LORD, for He gave the command and they were created.
contents: Let them praise the name of the LORD,
for He gave the command and they were created.

contents.verseText: He established them forever and ever; He issued a decree that will never pass away.
contents: He established them forever and ever;
He issued a decree that will never pass away.

contents.verseText: Praise the LORD from the earth, all great sea creatures and ocean depths,
contents: Praise the LORD from the earth,
all great sea creatures and ocean depths,

contents.verseText: lightning and hail, snow and clouds, powerful wind fulfilling His word,
contents: lightning and hail, snow and clouds,
powerful wind fulfilling His word,

contents.verseText: mountains and all hills, fruit trees and all cedars,
contents: mountains and all hills,
fruit trees and all cedars,

contents.verseText: wild animals and all cattle, crawling creatures and flying birds,
contents: wild animals and all cattle,
crawling creatures and flying birds,

contents.verseText: kings of the earth and all peoples, princes and all rulers of the earth,
contents: kings of the earth and all peoples,
princes and all rulers of the earth,

contents.verseText: young men and maidens, old and young together.
contents: young men and maidens,
old and young together.

contents.verseText: Let them praise the name of the LORD, for His name alone is exalted; His splendor is above the earth and the heavens.
contents: Let them praise the name of the LORD,
for His name alone is exalted;
His splendor is above the earth and the heavens.

contents.verseText: He has raised up a horn for His people, the praise of all His saints, of Israel, a people near to Him. Hallelujah!
contents: He has raised up a horn for His people,
the praise of all His saints,
of Israel, a people near to Him.
Hallelujah!

s1: Sing to the LORD a New Song

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verse 9

contents.verseText: Sing to the LORD a new song—His praise in the assembly of the godly.
contents: Sing to the LORD a new song—
His praise in the assembly of the godly.

contents.verseText: Let Israel rejoice in their Maker; let the children of Zion rejoice in their King.
contents: Let Israel rejoice in their Maker;
let the children of Zion rejoice in their King.

contents.verseText: Let them praise His name with dancing, and make music to Him with tambourine and harp.
contents: Let them praise His name with dancing,
and make music to Him with tambourine and harp.

contents.verseText: For the LORD takes pleasure in His people; He adorns the afflicted with salvation.
contents: For the LORD takes pleasure in His people;
He adorns the afflicted with salvation.

contents.verseText: Let the saints exult in glory; let them shout for joy upon their beds.
contents: Let the saints exult in glory;
let them shout for joy upon their beds.

contents.verseText: May the high praises of God be in their mouths, and a double-edged sword in their hands,
contents: May the high praises of God be in their mouths,
and a double-edged sword in their hands,

contents.verseText: to inflict vengeance on the nations and punishment on the peoples,
contents: to inflict vengeance on the nations
and punishment on the peoples,

contents.verseText: to bind their kings with chains and their nobles with shackles of iron,
contents: to bind their kings with chains
and their nobles with shackles of iron,

contents.verseText: to execute the judgment written against them. This honor is for all His saints. Hallelujah!
contents: to execute the judgment written against them.
This honor is for all His saints.
Hallelujah!

s1: Let Everything That Has Breath Praise the LORD

d: Hallelujah!

footnote.ft: Or Hallelu YAH, meaning Praise the LORD; also in verse 6

contents.verseText: Praise God in His sanctuary. Praise Him in His mighty heavens.
contents: Praise God in His sanctuary.
Praise Him in His mighty heavens.

footnote.ft: Or in the expanse of his might or in the firmament of his might; see also Genesis 1:6–8.

contents.verseText: Praise Him for His mighty acts; praise Him for His excellent greatness.
contents: Praise Him for His mighty acts;
praise Him for His excellent greatness.

contents.verseText: Praise Him with the sound of the horn; praise Him with the harp and lyre.
contents: Praise Him with the sound of the horn;
praise Him with the harp and lyre.

contents.verseText: Praise Him with tambourine and dancing; praise Him with strings and flute.
contents: Praise Him with tambourine and dancing;
praise Him with strings and flute.

contents.verseText: Praise Him with clashing cymbals; praise Him with resounding cymbals.
contents: Praise Him with clashing cymbals;
praise Him with resounding cymbals.

contents.verseText: Let everything that has breath praise the LORD! Hallelujah!
contents: Let everything that has breath praise the LORD!
Hallelujah!
